Blog.post: Sunday Sunday Sunday! You know what? I broke my streak of writing a journal entry a day by not writing yesterday, and I had that going since I started...what do I have to say for myself? Hmmm, oh well. Chris and Mike stayed the night last night, we had a blast. We stayed up really late and wigged out. We got to the point where everything was funny to us. I was playing Super Mario Bros (yes the original), and I called one of those canon things a machine and we cracked up forever at the word MACHINE, say it out loud....hahaha crazy word. This morning when we woke up my parents weren't home, and they didn't come home forever, so we were free to do whatever we wanted like all day. We ordered a pizza and watched a little of the Dolphins-Chiefs game, Dolphins lost!!! that sucked. Later on when he left Mike peeled out in reverse in my driveway...in his dad's car...with his dad in the passenger seat...what a kook. In addition, when Chris went home, he didn't bring his boxing gloves because he couldn't find one of them. LOL! I don't know why that's so funny to me, but ya know... and no I didn't hide his boxing glove.(I know that's what you were thinkin) Now for my next subject...MEGA MAN 1, IT IS AWESOME!!!!!! That's right, I'm talking about the first Mega Man game ever, now that is old school my friends. I started playing it today and I couldn't stop. I beat the whole game in like 6 hours. Take that for all you wussie a$$ fags that say Mega Man 1 is the most difficult in the series, everyone said it takes about a week to beat, pshhh yeah right, maybe if you are a freaking dumba$$ that can't remember simple patterns and gets scared when a game moves too fast. Go play Winnie the Pooh or something, fags. And if it is the hardest game in the series then the rest of em should be extremely easy for me...Sorry about freaking out like that, I was under the impression that the game was going to be really hard (I read this at various places). The game was challenging, but it just wasn't as hard as it was cracked up to be. That game is so fun though, I highly recommend it to anyone that is any good at video games (because it is pretty hard). I must say, whenever I beat the game I was so into it, and so serious, but I was yelling crazy sh*t. Like: "what're you missin? I'll show you how it's done!"/ "I derive my just powers by the consent of the governed!"/ "You're mine now, you belong to me!". Oh man this one is funny. On the final form of the last boss I was using the cutter beam thing and whenever I dealt the final blow I yelled "Cutter rocks you kook!", haha it was awesome as hell. And the whole time the credits were rolling, I danced the mightiest dance I have ever danced, seriously. I wigged out, I was bustin some of the craziest moves known to man. It was extra cool because I had socks on, and I was on tile, so I was slidin all around and stuff. That was probably the best end of game celebration by anyone ever, let alone me. Well, at the least I haven't been so happy about beating a game (or that happy in general) in a long time. I can't wait to start playing, and beating, the rest of the Mega Mans...ohhhh yeaaa. I did have a couple other things to talk about, like the mysterious phone call I recieved, and some stuff about ROMs. But I'm in such a good mood that I'd rather end this on a good note, like the one it's at. Party on!

Its Friday...! School didn't matter much today, took notes in Science, sneaked on the internet all day in Computers, did a bunch of work in History, and did a test in Math. But I did laugh a lot today. In History Chase was crackin me up with a story about him getting his nuts caught on the rope swing at the pits. In math we played a game that was reminiscent of musical chairs, I'll spare you the details but I will say that is was mighty fun and mighty funny. The coolest thing about it was it gave Molly Beck a reason to get up and run around the room, even Zac will tell you, it was awesome. Zac and Chris came over after school for a brief amount of time, nothing incredibly cool happened, but ya know. I talked to Jesseca for a while, but she said she was goin to Jessica's house (despite the fact that she's grounded), so I dunno what she did tonight. For hours I sat around and listened to music mindlessly, until Tommy came over. Now let me tell ya a little about this Tommy character. Whenever I moved here from Michigan, I was like 7, one of the first people I met was Tommy. We used to hang out all the time back in the day, he lived 2 blocks away from me. I remember so much stuff we used to do. I recall a couple times where we stole mass amounts of unripe oranges off of people's orange trees,cut and squeezed them into a big kool-aid container, and drank em. Good times. Well eventually he moved to Deltona and then he moved again with his mom to Port Orange, during this time of about 3 years, I didnt see him at all. Then one day, about a year ago, he shows up at my house and we hang out and film some skits. Then I didn't see him again until today, when he came over at about 8:00. He just asked what i've been up to and stuff, he said he skateboards all the time, he also said he's a big fan of Super Mario Sunshine, which is cool. He said he was gonna stop by Sunday so we could hang out, but you never know with Big Tom, for all I know it will be another year before I see him. A little while ago I felt really shitty, I don't know if I was tired, or depressed or what, but I didn't feel like doing anything so I decided to go for a walk. And go for a walk I did. I walked all around my neighborhood and jogged around the central park trail twice. Then I walked over near Jesseca's house to tip over the port o pody, something I do all the time, but I always go on bike, i've never done it walking. This time I didn't run afterwards either, I usually hop on my bike and ride out. This time though I just walked away calmly, and I wanted someone to come out and say something, I felt like getting in a fight anyways. I was hoping cars would stop or some teenager would start something with me so I could kick somebody's ass. This attitude reflects the kind of mood I was in perfectly. I walked by Jesseca's house too, but I dont think she was home because hardcore john's silhouette wasn't visible in her bedroom window. Well she could've been sleeping, but it was only 9:30ish, especially weird since it's a Friday night. I got the sh*t scared out of me on my way home too. A car came up behind me and rode by all fast and then I heard some loud noise so I turned around and I saw some big animal chasing me, it startled me so much that my heart starting beating really hard and fast...you know the feeling. As it turns out it was just a large piece of paper, flying low to the ground, pushed by the wind made by the passing truck. But it was still pretty cool, because I haven't gotten a good scare like that in a while. Me and Chris are going to the Dashboard Confessional concert at the House of Blues next Thursday. That is gonna be hella awesome because they are one of my favorite bands. Probably my favorite right now. I don't think they're gonna play any of the unreleased songs that I listen to all the time, but their cd rocks, so it should be cool anyways.... Th-tha-tha-tha-thathatha-thats all folks. But before I go, I wanted to let everyone know that I noticed a grammatical error in the Declaration of Independance. Where it says "all men were created equal" that is wrong. It should be "all men were created equally". Ask an English teacher (actually a professor would be a better person to go to, because sometimes high school teachers can be kind of dense) if you don't believe me, they'll tell you. I thought that was worth mentioning because although it is a great document, it goes to show you that even smart, famous people like Thomas Jefferson make mistakes.

I couldn't decide whether I should write or not today because I didn't think anything really happened that was worth mentioning, but then I remembered some stuff, so it should be all right. So if this sucks, don't bother telling me, I already know. Today was a pretty normal school day, academic wise. Physics was cool, had to do some work, but I didn't mind. The Navy came into Computers today (but I already saw them in another class). It was alright, I always like to hear what they have to say, and besides I got the day off, so who am I to complain? History was fun as always, because Mr. Eddy is the man. I always seem to favor the History teachers the most for some reason, maybe I just like History... Math was actually ok today, because my teacher was giving people candy to perform their special talents in front of the class. Two things stood out from the crowd. This black kid Marquis (stereotypical black person name by the way) can kick himself in the back of the head, he's showed us before, but this time there was a twist. Today he kicked himself in the head as usual, but upon contact he screamed like a girl. It was crazy because whenever you bend your head/ neck back its hard to make a high pitched sound, so he kept trying forever and my teacher kept telling him to do it over and over until he got it right. His voice was cracking and he made a bunch of odd screeching sounds And if you've never seen someone kick thereself in the back of the head and scream like a girl, let me tell ya, its quite a site to see. Then this kid Nick (the skinniest kid in the world, seriously) did some messed up contortionist crap. He connected his hands behind his back, and with some quick, jerky, squirmy, and flat out nasty movements he brought his hands, still connected, over his shoulders and then straightened his arms out again (they were in some crazy tangled up knot). Throughout the whole performance everyone in the class was like "ewwww", "ahhh" and "what the fu*k!". Then some other kid did it, and he was all happy, but nobody cared because Nick's looked much much weirder. Oh man during lunch we were talking about some of the craziest sh*t ever, it was one of the craziest conversations (it was more of a debate but eh) we've had in a long time. So crazy in fact, that I wont reveal the subject matter due to fear of getting my Journal deleted off the server for innapropriate content. Let's just say it involved Lance Armstrong, Hulk Hogan, A 30x30 foot room whose floor was littered with bars of soap, a big nasty disease ridden fat guy, and the 10 hottest girls in the world. I started reading War of the Worlds today. I didn't get very far, but it has got to be the most boring book of all time! It might be because i'm at the beginning , but I had a hard time bringing myself to read it, and even more trouble sitting through every single freaking page! I think its because of the journalistic, first person nature of the narrative. This style leaves no room for humor, there hasn't been even one attempt at a joke yet. It sucks enough without grammatical and spelling errors, but not to worry, it has plenty of those too. For anyone who thinks H.G. Wells is such a great author, you can suck it, because he can't write for sh*t. This book makes simple things like walking around school, seem interesting and fun in comparison to reading it. That is the only reason I would reccomend this book, otherwise stear clear of War of the Worlds! Woohoo I finally made my Ataris cd. I've wanted to make it for a couple weeks, but I never got around to it because I was busy, busy wiggin. And get this: I fit 31(!) songs onto the cd! Isnt that crazy? well it's crazy if you know anything about cd burners and how much cds hold. That's the most i've heard of, not counting skits and stuff. I have a cd with 22 and I thought that was a lot, and I have another with 26, but 31, wow. I thought I would have to cut out some songs because I had too many, but I ended up adding 3 extra songs at the end...yessiree, pretty cool stuff . That's pretty much all for today, well actually there's more, but I think I've bored you enough for one day.

Before I talk about my day I have to talk about a movie I just watched, because at the moment it is foremost in my mind. I just watched the Virgin Suicides, so what did I think? First I must say that before seeing it I heard nothing but bad reviews from Justin and my sister, but I never really take someone else's opinion on something, especially a movie. This time I was right, I knew I would like it, and I knew those two must have not watched it or understood it or something. Because personally I thought the movie was great. I thought it was thoughtful, curious, tragic, and most of all, realistic. This movie is really good at portraying teenage life and things that happen in it could happen easily in real life, and i'm sure they do. This movie surprised me in a variety of ways. The cast, which I thought would be full of low-end, bad actors, was actually pretty good. It included up and coming stars such as Josh Hartenette, Kirsten Dunst, and Hayden Christensen (who?), the last guy is Anakin Skywalker from Star Wars Episode 2. And the girls were really hot in it, which probably contributed the most to my liking of the movie. Blah Blah Blah, had enough of my big words and English paper style writing? Me too. Ummm I went to Wal-Mart today and got a surge protector for my room (ooh how exciting!) and the new EGM magazine. This is the last EGM I will buy on newstands for 2 years, because I got a subscription, and I was only buying this one to make sure I didnt miss an issue in between the gap of sending my subscription form and recieving my first issue in the mail. Yep Yep Yep. When I was at Wal-Mart I walked buy some Arab dude and he whispered some crazy sh*t in my ear along the lines of "whoop/ shwoop" and I was like "what the f**k, I'll kill you b**ch" and he was like "you do not tell me da f**k, you do not ever tell me da f**k, b**ch" then he charged at me like he was the last of the Mohicans or some sh*t. So I moved out of the way like a spanish bull-fighter and he ran into a big rack of TVs. When he turned around I yelled "watang!" and hit him with a boot to the face. Then he was laying on the ground all doubled over and I got up close to his ear and said "who's the b**ch now?" and strutted off. True story......I sure do like that Jesseca girl. Hey Jesseca! I could say so much more, but I'll leave it at that for tonight because it's late and I am going to be a freaking zombie at school tommorow if I dont go to sleep soon. So peace to mah homies, fool.

Haha i've got an online journal now. It's not as flashy as livejournal, but its free and theres no hassle with getting a passcode and crap. It's alright though I guess. Anyways this is my first time writing in this biotch. Hopefully by reading my journal you will get a good insight into my brain and wacked out thought process. But most likely, you freaks will skim through it and dismiss it as nonsense and get warped perceptions of me based on your own assumptions. Either way, it should be a fun experience for everyone. I'll try to veer away from writing what happened to me during my day in the middle of the day, because you never know what might happen later on in that day. Another thing I would like to adress is cussing (or cursing, whatever floats your boat). I do cuss a lot, as my closest friends know, and if I talk like I regularly do on this journal I will be kicked off on the first day I use it. So I'm gonna do the whole f*$#k, s%@t, a$$, thing and hope that is acceptable. But in the immortal words of Mr. T: "Enough Jibba-Jabba", and on with the actual journal.

I'll cut directly to the chase, no bullshitting. Today was an odd day at school, because Zac, Louie, and Chris weren't there(well if they were there, I didn't see them) It's weird that they all didn't go on the same day, but they weren't even in cahootz. You would think that I would have nobody to hang out with, but I was surprised how many people actually were still there at lunch. At Fazolis it was Matt, Mike, Dan, Gabe, Ricky, and I. So I was anything but bored or lonely. Now think about what it's like at Fazolis on a normal day, it's madness. I hung out with Mike for the rest of lunch and we spent the whole time looking for a snack machine because Mike wanted something. When we found one that had what he wanted it gave him something different than he input. It was funny as hell. Then he went up to Mr. Lily and tried to complain about getting some crazy cheese balls because thats not the button he pressed. Mr. Lily is like 180 years old so he didn't understand he was just like "That's what you wanted right?" and Mike's like "yea...." and we walked off. So he just gave the cheese balls to John Kinder. John was like "No I'll pas....Thank you" and took em with a big smile on his face. I'm not sure why that was so funny to me, but I laughed. In case you don't already know, I say I am going to talk about my day at school, but I only talk about lunch. Halloween is coming up quicker than a nigger in a swimming pool. Of course that's not very quick, since they can't swim, but ya know.. I don't think kids my age should be going trick or treating, and that's exactly why I am going(I encourage everyone to go trick or treating, it's free candy right, so why not?). This year should be the funnest one yet for 2 reasons. One: we're gonna be driving around in Louie's car instead of walking around the whole frickin neighborhood. Two: Me, Chris, and Louie are all dressing up in small, tight ass, children's Power Rangers costumes. Chris is the blue ranger, I'm the red ranger (which is traditionally the leader, yay!) and Louie is the pink ranger. LoL he's the pink ranger. The funny thing is, these things are so tight that when we put em on you can see the outline of our package hardcore style (in other words we are gonna be blatantly flaunting our dicks in front of everyone). Oh well...and if anyone laughs at us they won't think it's too funny when they get their candy stolen from a trio of big, tight costumed wearin Power Rangers. Especially the pink one. If any adults say anything, we'll run em over. So watch out for us on Halloween, GO GO POWER RANGERS!!! Ahem, at the moment I am going to talk about a few movies that I watched over the weekend. 7 movies to be exact, 6 that Me, Chris, Louie and Zac rented, and 1 that my sister rented. Yes, we rented 6 movies, pretty crazy huh. That's probably the most movies I've rented all at once, but the deal is 6 movies for 6 days for 6 bucks. Not bad, we couldn't pass it up. We were in the mood to watch some scary movies I guess because 5 out of the 6 were horror flicks. These included: Phantasm, Texas Chainsaw Massacre 2, Ed Gein, Dawn of the Dead, and The Unnamable. The other one we rented was Jackie Brown, you can classify that under whatever genre you want, because I dunno what it is, I would say crime though. Also, my sister happened to rent the movie 40 Days and 40 Nights, so I watched that too. You are probably thinking "he better not review every single one of those movies, that will take forever". If you are, then you're right that would take forever, but only if I did each one in depth. So I'll be brief... (If you don't care about movies then you can skip this next paragraph) Phantasm : This is one of those crazy 80s horror movies that don't make much sense and don't make any attempt to explain the story and just throw random things at you that you are supposed to think are scary. But that doesn't mean it's a bad movie, it just adds a layer of mystery to the air when you are watching it. I thought this movie was really funny, and not scary at all. It had some good jokes, and things that weren't supposed to be funny, like when the bad guy talks, cracked me up. Here's my favorite line, "You play a good game boy, but the game is finished, now you die!". At least it had a cliffhanger ending, those are always cool. Texas Chainsaw Massacre 2 : This movie was the follow up sequel to one of my favorite horror films, Texas Chainsaw Massacre. Although the first one was based on a true story, this one was just complete bullshit. I think this was a good thing because they were able to go crazy with the story and characters and have things happen that would never happen in real life. The whole movie was action packed, it never slowed down really, which is a very good thing. The outrageous characters and dialogue in this movie were freaking hilarious, some of the scenes had me in tears because they said and did some of the craziest things I've ever witnessed. I think this was the best of the bunch that we rented and I highly reccomend it to anyone who can take some gore, because if you are anything like me, this movie will crack you up, excite you, and most importantly, entertain you. My favorite line, "Lick my plate, dog dick!" Ed Gein : This was supposed to be a real life story about a serial killer from the 50s that pioneered the term "serial killer". The same reasons that made it sound cool, were it's downfall. This guy wasn't cool because he was so old he was practically harmless. He only killed two people in the whole movie, and it wasn't even gory compared to the other movies we watched. He was basically obsessed with his mom, and he misinterpreted the bible into killing people, saw his mom when she was dead, ya know, the usual. Nothing great happened in this movie except for this one part. The killer came out of his house dressed up in this womans skin(boobs and all), and danced around outside in a crazy manner, then walked back into his house. It may not sound like it, but it was extremely funny. Dawn of the Dead : This was your basic zombie movie, a shitload of zombies are roaming the earth( Supposedly hell was full or something) and a group of people try to survive the onslaught. Don't worry, this movie had a plethora of gratuitous violence. Complete with decapitations, shotgun blasts to the face, zombie beatdowns, zombie attacks portraying flesh mutilation while the camera is close up on the action, and even a bunch of pies to the face of zombie put there by an army of bikers. If this doesn't sound cool, I don't know what does. Did I mention that most of the movie takes place in a fully destructable shopping mall. If any of this sounds good to you, then rent this movie. The Unnamable : This movie's title suits it well, I shouldn't even be naming this movie as I talk about the rest of them. This movie was horrible, it sucked a fat schlong. I don't even want to talk about why it sucked so bad, it would bring up bad memories, I want my hour and a half back! Well it was pretty funny at the end when they showed the creature, because it was so stupid it was funny. It just made these really crazy/loud hissing noises, and thats all it did, I swear. It was so funny though, me and Zac were laughing during the whole end sequence because of it. Jackie Brown : I wouldn't know about this one, I didn't really watch it. I left about half way through because Jesseca called, I wasn't digging it too much anyways. If you ask me it sucked, but you would be better off asking Chris or Zac about this one, since they actually watched it. They thought it was pretty good I think. So I dunno. 40 Days and 40 Nights : Finally, the last one. My thoughts on it are these. It was poorly written, it sounded like 40 something guys trying to write hip/cool dialogue for todays youth and it came out awful. There wasn't enough nudity, even though there was a little nudity it wasn't very much for a movie based around sex. The story was good but it was executed wrongly, it could have been so much better, but they screwed it up in their mindless approach. The ending was really bad. I wont spoil anything but I'll tell you it sucks. Just like the old lady in Ed Gein sucks the chrome off of the trailer hitch. Wow, that last paragraph was incredibly boring!!! I didn't mean to make it that way, I am just too tired and too lazy to write with some sort of style and my full skill. So you get the watered down version. You know what, I was totally gonna write about my weekend right here, but I decided against it. I figure it would not only make this the longest journal ever, but also the most boring ever. It wouldn't be so boring if I felt like sitting here for 6 hours making it cool, but I am not gonna do that, not right now at least. So go fuck a duck. Notice I don't blank out cus words anymore, it's much easier for me that way. So if anyone doesn't like me cussing on here you can sue me.... Jesseca is awesomeeeee!!!

I was planning on doing a journal tonight, but now it's too late...However, look forward to tommorow. That's when I will detail my weekend and my day (Monday). So it should be very, very lengthy. Goodnighter, your momma's ass couldn't be whiter.

What am I doing??? I'm supposed to be going to the movies like right now, to see JACKASS: THE MOVIE!!! Hell yea! It is gonna be the funniest movie ever, I have a feeling I am gonna piss my pants from laughing too hard. If that happens I already have a backup plan: I'll cup my hand and catch all of it, then throw it all over everyone in the theater! Hahaha! Actually that's kind of sick huh... So why am I writing in my journal? I dunno. Well as you can see I can't talk right now. Later. (No really, I can't talk. Somebody gagged me and threw me on the floor, I'm typing with my toes.)

Okay, today was a good day. I didn't even have to use my AK...I'm probably understating my hapiness right now, but I think that's a good thing, I don't want to jinx myself. I have a lot of different things to talk about, so pardon me if I switch subjects too fast. I wouldn't even be writing this if Jesseca didn't request it. I would much rather be getting to bed, because I am T-I-R-E-D. So never let anyone tell you I'm not a nice guy. I was trying to think of one of the craziest stories I've ever heard so I could talk about it (there's tons of them), and here's what I came up with. Once upon a time, way back in elementary school, (or maybe middle school, who knows)my friend Tommy was arguing with this kid he didn't like about something. I'm not sure what it was about, probably friggin Mortal Kombat or Power Rangers, judging by the time period. So he gets all mad, and the kid wants to fight him. Instead of pushing the kid or instigating a fight like a normal person, he takes his spork (yes I said spork) and repeatedly stabs him in the hand. Of all places, he stabs him in the hand, with a spork, lol. Bad story huh? Yeaaaa I think so too, but not to worry. I have another, and it goes a little something like this: On the day I was born all the nurses gathered around, and they gazed in wide wonder in the joy they had found. The lead nurse spoke up, she said leave this one alone. She could tell right away, that I was bad to the bone. Bet you can't guess what that's from... Every time you turn on the news you see or hear something about "the sniper", f**k the sniper. I'm sick and tired of hearing about this damn sniper. I've decided that this guy is a f**king pussy. Actually, all snipers are pussies. They stay in a hidden spot and shoot people from about 200 yards away. Now tell me that isn't acting like a little girl. If he wants to kill people that did nothing at all to him he should at least walk up to them and to shoot them where they can see it. Or act like a real killer and use a knife. This "sniper" is the biggest wussy I've ever heard of. The F.B.I. needs to stop playing around with this guy and start threatening him, insulting him, calling him a pussy, and challenging him to come out and do something for a change. My mom said they were gonna try using satellites to catch him and I'll tell you right now, that's not gonna work. I'm aware that challenging him will cause him to kill more people, but eventually he'll just kill the same amount anyway, at the rate they're going. They sure as hell aren't getting anywhere right now. I say they issue a open challenge to this b*tch, and call him names. That way his emotions might get involved, making him much more vulnerable to making a mistake. Lastly, I hear he's starting to communicate with the authorities. Personally, if I got a chance to talk to him, I'd tell him to bring it on. School... can't live with it, can't live without it. I got my report card today, as I'm sure almost everyone else did. I did pretty good on it, better than I thought actually. That's because I really had a D in computers, but since my teacher likes me and knows I'm smarter than that she raised it up to a B at the last minute. Thanks Mrs. Borden. I got A's in history and physics. Pretty good so far... and then there's Mrs. Kelley. That stupid overweight dike gave me a C, and I had a 78.6 in there. I kind of deserved it, but she doesn't have to be a b*tch about it. She told Zac that there was no hope for me, what a crazy thing to say. I don't think she's aware that I am one of the smartest kids in her class, and that I purposely didn't do any work/didn't pay attention on many occasions just to spite her. I f*king hate that whore. She plays around way too much, pays attention to 3 or 4 kids out of the 35, is unorganized, unforgiving, dumb, ignorant in so many ways about other countries and her own goverment, likes stupid movies, is obsessed with pop culture, is dorky, and is biased. That's a lot right there, but the thing that pisses me off most about her is SHE ISN'T FUNNY! She tries so hard to be funny everyday and I am not amused, neither is 90% of the class. She thinks she is so funny, and not once has she made me laugh other than by her appearance being so sad it's funny to me. You know what? Fu*k You Mrs. Kelley! Staying with the topic of school I have something else to complain about. People that try to whisper things to me in class, or try to get me to understand something by any means other than by talking in a normal voice. I don't know if this happens to anybody else, but it happens to me all the time. Some f**ker that's sitting next to me [cough *tadandchasemchmahon* cough] will be like "psst sihdfuiohfnko", the jibberish means some random sh*t in a really low voice, trying to get me to understand what they're saying in a quiet voice so the teacher won't hear them. Or sometimes Tad will write something on his desk really small and at a crazy f**king angle so I have to lean really close to read it, and even so, I don't know what it says. After they do this crap they always laugh or look at me and expect me to laugh or somthing, but everytime I tell them "what the hell are you talking about". So they keep whispering it over and over and I still don't know what they're saying so I'm just like "ha, yea..." Then when I do find out what they said it is usually not funny at all, and I am easily amused. Here's a news flash for you: I DO NOT COMPREHEND WHAT YOU ARE SAYING WHEN YOU TALK WITH YOUR VOICE AT NEGATIVE 5 DECIPALS AND I CANNOT READ WORDS THAT ARE WRITTEN WITH THEIR LETTERS 1 MILLIMETER TALL. SO IF YOU WANT TO SAY A JOKE TO ME FIRST MAKE SURE ITS FUNNY, THEN SAY HEY DAVE, AND SPEAK UP TO TELL THE JOKE, IN ENGLISH. THIS EXLUDES YOU IF YOUR NAME IS CHASE MCMAHON. IN THAT CASE DO NOT TELL ME A JOKE PERIOD, BECAUSE IT IS A PROVEN FACT THAT YOU ARE NEVER FUNNY, EVER, AND I FEEL SORRY FOR YOU. YOU REDFACED TERET SYNDROME BASTARD. I keep forgetting to ask Jesseca out when we're on the phone, because I don't want to do it on the computer. But I'll do it one of these days, probably tommorow. So don't try and beat me to it anyone. That's right you little surfer midget, now sit down before I get Ben Boatner on you. Besides, I think it's time for you to go watch your favorite movie - Surf Ninjas . That's about it for today. Pretty long considering I just thought it up as I went along. Also, the only post on Sundays and Tuesdays trend continues. For those of you keeping track thats 7 in a row, I think. I can't wait to go to my comfy bed, I'm gonna listen to The Starting Line to put me to sleep. I didn't listen to them for about a month and now when I listen to the cd it's like it's brand new again (you should try that sometime). I love it, good band. Later guys. I'll leave you with a great line from The Ataris, always remember this: "Life ain't all that bad, life ain't all that bad, even if Henry Rollins is your dad"

What's with me and writing journals on Tuesdays and Sundays? If you would notice every recent journal I've written is dated one of these days. There must be some mysterious mental pattern in my mind that makes me do this, or not. I'll just chalk it up to coincidence... Earlier tonight, at like 12, I ran all the way home from Chris's house and "OHHHHHHH WHAAAAAT AAA RUUUUUSSSHHHH" (somebody's got to remember that from the old days of wrasslin). If you don't know how far that is, it's pretty far, about 2-3 miles. Now I said ran, not walked or jogged. That's a good run. Especially when I was going down Old King's Road, it seemed like it went on forever. That road is all dark and "scary" too, but I wasn't scared because I had a golf ball that I was ready to throw through somebody's head if they surprised me. At the end of the street there was a big blocked off construction site. There were barriers and signs saying not to go in, but those only apply to cars, I think. If not then oh well because I went through there anyway. It was a good thing I didn't fall into a gigantic hole or something. When I passed by Justin's house I decided to go up to his window and see what he was doing. I didn't knock or anything but I saw him and he was wiggin out, haha, crazy Justin. You're probably wondering why the hell I ran home from Chris's, well here's your reason. We just got back from ridin around in Louie's car all night. We went to Chris's and I didn't want to stay the night there, for various reasons. Mostly because Louie was pissing me off and being annoying. So I went in, got a drink of Powerade, told em "that'll cost ya extry" and walked out the door. As for the question of why I ran home instead of walking, I did it for the challenge and the exercise. I can't remember anything else worth mentioning that happened today, it was just the usual sh*ts n giggles, nothing out of the ordinary. So I'll talk about the events of Friday night. Homecoming was on Friday and yes I went to it, it was alright. Get this, the name of the dance was "Night of Fire: Dance to That Salsa Beat", if that's not the craziest homecoming name you've ever heard I don't know what is. How should I explain the night... umm, I'll start from the beginning. At 7 Chris and I were all dressed up and ready to go. My tie wasn't on though because apparently nobody around here knows how to put on a tie, except for my dad, and he wasn't home. Being dressed up was cool as hell for me because I never get dressed up, Chris thought it was cool as well. I wore black dress pants/shoes, a white shirt, and a tie. Chris, however, went all out. He was wearing a big shiny purple suit with a golden pimp cain and a orange top hat, not to mention his slick willy size 23 turd green shoes. That Chris is quite the character. Alright Alright, I'm just kidding... After my dad got home and tied my tie we went to Lauren's. Her mom said we "cleaned up really nice" and her dad got some footage of me, Chris, and the girls (Lauren, Whitney and Jaclyn) with their video camera. The girls all looked very pretty in their dresses, your welcome Lauren, Whitney and Jaclyn. After a little bit we ate dinner, which was good. Consisting of steak, a potatoe, apple pie, and salad. Then we left for the dance. I didn't buy a ticket at school so I was a little worried that they wouldn't be selling them at the door and not let me in. My worries didn't last long, it was easy as can be to get my ticket. Soon I found out you couldn't come back in if you left, I was like "that sucks" and dismissed it, I wasn't planning on leaving anytime soon. When we first went into the room where the dance was I was thinkin "What the hell this is really gay. This is what homecoming's like, what the heck". Chris said he was thinking the same thing. We probably just thought that because we got there early and there wasn't very many people there yet. Later on we had fun though. Let me clear this up real quick: even though technically me and Whitney were there together, we didn't hang out much at all. Maybe because she was hanging with Jaclyn... I dunno but I would have danced with her if I saw her dancing, but I don't think she did much of that. There was a few things that were cool about this homecoming. One, my dawg John told me I had the best looking tie in the whole place, and that nobody knew how to pick out ties like me. I was like "thanks man, your tie is nice too" but he wasn't wearing a tie. Second, I saw all kinds of kooks I know and talked to em, ya know how that goes. This crazy girl I know took a picture of me when I wasn't expecting it and the flash blinded me for several minutes, it was funny. Third, I danced with some random girl for a little while, so that was pretty fun. I was standing there semi-dancing with Chris and Lauren and a girl was like "hey my friend thinks you're hot, she wants to dance with you", so I was like "alright". There was like four girls wiggin out around me, I suppose they were her friends, but ya never know. Near the end of the dance people were tearing balloons off of the tables and inhaling the helium. In case you are the ultimate dumbass, breathing in helium makes your voice extremely high and crazy, and funny as freak. Brittany was crackin me up doing that and she tried to show me how to do it and I couldn't. I was just being a goon, because I've done it before. Oh man, then Scott Spinelli came up with his voice crazy style and said "dude, you just majorly f**ked up!". Me, Chris, Lauren, and Brittany burst into laughter. The crazy sound of his voice coupled with the "what the f**k" factor of what he said made it freaking extremely funny. It was even funnier because at school we always laugh hysterically at him every time he walks by just because he looks crazy. Oh man, I don't know about anybody else, but I had a good time. On the way out they wouldn't let us leave without taking a sombrero with us, so we were like "sweet, free somberos baby". We didn't have a ride home, so we started walking down A1A (we didn't leave with Lauren, Whitney, and Jaclyn by the way). We didn't fit in with the crowd at all. There were scruffy looking bikers and bikes galore, because of biketoberfest. Then there was us, walking down A1A all dressed up in suits and ties, with sombreros in our hands. It was cool though because we got everybody's attention, they couldn't help looking at us. Some drunk guy walked by us and asked us if we were selling bibles so we wigged out on him. I don't remember what we said to him exactly but it was something like "I'll cut off your balls and sell em on the black market fag". What came next was the complete opposite of what happened before. Some chick in a car yelled at us (ya know like "whooo yeaaa!"). Then she was like "let me have your sombero!" so I was like "alright". They stopped, I caught up to their car, and she got out. I gave my sombrero to her and Chris gave his to some other chick in the car. They were both pretty hot. When I gave her it she was like "you're cute, you can have a hug" and we hugged, but it was one of those sideways hugs and I was expecting a regular one. So my arm was too high up and I just totally grabbed her boob. She either didn't notice or didn't care, because she didn't say anything. After I did it I saw that there were guys in the car, and I was surprised they didn't say anything to me. They were probably scurred, because they drove off without even looking at me funny. 5 seconds later we're walking down the street again and I'm like "dude, I accidentally grabbed that girls boob" and I explained. Chris was like "oh yeaah". Then it hit me. I touched that girls boob. I was like "I just touched that girls boob! That was awesome". We talked about that for awhile before giving up on the whole walking home thing and calling Chris's mom to tell her to come pick us up. And thus, this brought our night to an end, my friend. I remembered something else that we did earlier tonight. We went to Louie's cousin's house in New Symrna. There were a bunch of peeps there, but it wasn't a party, according to them that was just their group. In any case, we got to meet his aunt and cousin, so it was cool. There was a lone black guy hanging out with them, so we figured out it is awesome to have a black kid as your friend and we determined that we need to get one for our gang. That's all that happened so far this weekend folks. But there's always today, Sunday, to make something else happen. On Sundays I usually lay around and do nothing all day, but thats what I did on Saturday, so I'll probably do something today. I do know I'm gonna talk to Jesseca, and that is always fun :) Ya know, at first I didn't think this flame design looked so hot (cheesy pun fully intended), but I'm liking it more and more everyday. I think it's great, I bet everyone else thinks it looks gay. Who the hell cares though, it's 5 o' clock in the morning and I'm sittin here talking about some flames. I'm tired as a mofo, and now it's so early that I'm getting hungry so I'm gonna have to eat something now. I better get to sleep so I can wake up for that nooner.

What is going on again? Oh yeah, it's Tuesday...how exciting. Today when I woke up I told my mom I wasn't going to school because we were taking the PSAT test. I explained in detail why I shouldn't go and told her that the test was useless and a waste of time. After all this she's like "what? why are you telling me this now? you should've told me last night, you're going to school" and I'm like "no i'm not" and shes like "yes you are". So I go in my room and sit around forever. Then when she urges me to get ready I just move all slow and do stupid stuff to make it take longer. Finally she says "are you ready?" and I'm like "yea sure I'm ready motherfu*ker, but i'm just gonna scribble all over that fu*kin test and go to sleep". She didn't say anything to me all the way to school, probably because I had a pissed off look on my face. I get to school like 30 minutes late and i'm like "i'm really late" and she's like "it's better than not coming to school at all" and I just said "no it's not" and got out of the car. At first I didn't even know where to go, then some lady was telling kids to go to their homeroom. So I go there and everyones already taking the test. When I walked in the guy was like "why are you late?" and I'm thinkin what the hell kind of question is that...I just gave him some crazy answer, I forget what I said. Something along the lines of "only the good die young". Then I christmas tree'd the test and went to sleep. As you can tell, I didn't want to be at school, and I was severely pissed off. Later on I was alright though, because it's hard to stay mad forever, especially with all kinds of funny stuff goin on. We didn't do much else all day except talk with our friends and stuff. History was cool though because we had an assignment to draw a political satire, and as you know, I love the political satires. That reminds me, yesterday during first block Tad was fu*kin crackin me up. I'm not sure why I thought it was so funny, but I was laughing a lot . I was laughing so hard I was getting the chills in my feet (yes, in my feet), don't ask me why. Anyways, whenever he dragged his foot across the ground it made a loud ass squeaking noise. He was like "check this out" and repeatedly dragged his foot across the ground, everyone was looking around for the person who did it, but he just kept doing it. Everytime I heard the noise I started laughing hysterically/ crying, basically fu*kin wiggin out, and he did it like a million times, so you can imagine how much I was laughing. I think it was funny because our teacher kept talking like nothing was going on even though there was this crazy noise filling the room every 2 seconds. lol i'm laughing right now just thinking about it. He did this like the whole period, even when people told him to stop, it was the funniest thing ever. I was laughing for almost 90 minutes straight, I can't believe the teacher didn't say anything to me, I was crying all over the place and stuff. Then I wigged out even more because Tad kept touching the kid in front of me on the shoulder and face, making it look like I did it, and I couldn't defend myself because I couldn't talk because I was laughing too hard. It looked like I did it and that made me laugh harder. Oh man, that sh*t was hilarious. Then I came home and watched the news. Which brings me to my next subject: the "sniper" that's been in the news lately. First I have to say that I prophetically predicted this about 2 weeks ago, well sort of. I was talking about how weird it was that we haven't had any serial killers lately, and how we were due for one, pretty weird huh. Chris and I have talked about being able to get away with crimes easily if you're smart like us, (after all, we do it all the time)and this guy is a perfect example. He does exactly what we talked about a long time ago. He kills random people, in random cities, far apart from eachother. He even added the whole shoot them from far away thing, whereas me and Chris just said drive by shoot them. He's already killed 9 people and wounded 2 others without getting caught, and there's like 400 FBI agents on the case, not to mention local and state authorities and every citizen in Maryland and Virginia looking for him. If I were him I would be saying "who's the man?", but also if I were him I would quit while I was ahead. Because if he quits now they will never catch him, and it seems to me like he doesn't want to get caught. I am not by any means saying that what he's doing is good, or even cool. Instead, I'm pointing out a problem with law enforcement: it doesn't work very well. All these people can't catch one guy, and we should feel safe with cops protecting us... All cops do nowadays is waste their time trying to bust kids like me for stupid sh*t like curfew (me and my friends have been pulled over for curfew at least 30 times, no exaggeration), when they should be catching real criminals, like sniper boy over here. Oh wait..they're trying to do that, but it's too hard for them. Cops are trash.... Next, some of these people's theories on the "sniper" are fu*kin stupid. For one, I don't even think he should be called a sniper, that's more of a war term. They should call him a shooter or murderer but not sniper. Second, this guy is NOT a terrorist! These news assholes call everyone that does something bad a terrorist lately. So there is a guy shooting people, people get shot all the time, it isn't terrorism! Third, i've been hearing about people blaming all this crap on video games on the internet, but today I actually saw a guy say it on tv. Now that is the biggest bullsh*t I have ever heard. Some fat dude thinks it is a group of teenagers working together, and he thinks they trained using Doom. He says it's all a "game" to them, it's all just one big "game". I would like to rip his head off and use it for a ball in a "game" of basketball. Shut your mouth fatass, it's not a group of teenagers and you can't train to shoot a gun using video games, so go eat a cheeseburger. This guy acts like there was no serial killers before video games came out, what the hell. I don't know where he got the whole Doom thing either, that game is like 10 years old, and it doesn't involve anything remotely similar to sniping. Unless he's referring to the brand new Doom 3. In that case hes way off again because there are only aliens, monsters, and even the devil himself in that game, but no humans. So how would somebody train to snipe people in that... Now I'm saying it isn't a terrorist and it isn't teenagers, then who is it? I would say it's just some crazy guy, just like any serial killers of the past. I bet he's white, aged 25-35, and either pissed off at the world or crazy. I called it, you can tell me how smart I am when he fits that description. Or you can always make fun of me if i'm wrong and one of those fagets are right. Then there's always the possibility that they don't catch him... It's all good in the sports world, Barry Bonds and the Giants are goin to the World Series. The 49ers, my long time favorite football team (check out my room if you don't believe me), gave the Seahawks the beatdown and are now 4-1. Owens mossed all over that kook, scored a touchdown, pulled a pen out of his sock, and signed the ball. If you saw that game you know what I'm talkin about. How about that Miami vs Denver game sunday night, that was an awesome game, one of the best i've ever seen. It was pretty cool to see the sucessors to Dan Marino and John Elway face off, and it was a close one too. Did you know Kurt Warner has the best QB rating ever? thats crazy...but then comes Steve Young, Joe Montana, and Jeff Garcia. All three played/play for the 49ers, so that makes up for it. Wow, scroll through quickly and look at what you just read, that was a pretty long journal huh. I think so. Definitely the longest I've written, nobody but my most diehard fans will sit through this whole thing, especially since it's about things that most people don't care about. So if you did read this whole thing, you deserve a dollar. That doesn't mean i'll give you a dollar, but if you're a girl you can have a hug :). I should probably go to sleep, because it's already late. But I usually don't go to sleep until like 1-2 am because I take a nap when I get home from school and I'm not tired at night. I'm gonna try to stop this crazy schedule one of these days (not tonight though), because I don't like waking up and it being all dark. I get confused, plus I waste most of the day. ANYWAYS, I think thats quite enough for one day. Goodnight girls.

S-A-T-U-R-D-A-Y NIGHT...S-A-T-U-R-D-A-Y NIGHT.... You know how it goes... If you don't know that song then you are a kook. And if you didn't know that Brent is "The White Supremisist", then you do now...(and yes I know it says it's sunday, but in reality, its late saturday night/ early sunday morning) Ummm the octoberfest was tonight, and I didn't have as much fun as I should have. Everyone I talk to about it said they had a lot of fun, but not me. I mean, it was alright, but it wasn't that cool. Maybe it was because I only rode one ride (the crazy dance baby!), and even though we talked to a bunch of girls we weren't really hanging out with any of them, and I think girls are necessary for me to enjoy myself. I don't like hanging out with a group of guys all night, I think that was my problem. The other thing that pissed me off though was we were waiting in line for The Motherf**ker (the craziest ride ever) for a long time, and when we were about to get on the guy that was running it just walked away and never came back. Apparently they were closing the whole place down because it was 11, but the guy could have told us that, instead he just walks away like an a$$hole. Everyone was yelling stuff at him afterwards though, so it was cool. There were a few good things about tonight though. For one, Zac and Chris were on drugs and it was funny to watch them wig out. Two, I stepped on some old lady's foot and she was like "OOH!". I was cracking up about that for at least an hour. Third, Brent was being funny as hell. First we asked him what he was on and he said "EVERYTHING". Then he repeatedly claimed to be "the white supremisist", and he got me sayin white supremisist all night. Last but not least, I came home with more tickets then I left with, which was awesome. I was given tickets by not one, not two, but three[!] girls. I am one bada$$ pimp if I do say so myself (j/k). It was funny one of the times though because I went up to these girls to ask em to ride The Motherfu*ker with us and they were like "do you want our tickets?" and I was like "do you wanna go on the motherf**ker?" and they were like "what?" and I was like "haha nevermind I'll take em". Aww man that was pretty crazy, I guess I had a good time tonight...On the way home this kid wanted to fight us or somthing and we just kept saying crazy stuff to him and he got all mad, but he didn't do anything. There were four of us and one of him, so he woulda got the beatdown anyways. That was funny though. Some other stuff that happened this weekend...on Friday me and chris went fishing at the park, we caught two fish and 2 frogs. It doesn't sound very exciting, but it's what we did with them that counts. We put the fish in the back of the toilets (you know the part with the top that comes off), one fish in the men's and one in the women's. Then we flushed the big frog down the toilet, he never came back up. The fish got stuck in this little hole when we flushed it too, it was crazy. After that we were left with the little frog, it was actually more toadish, but ya know, we just threw it all far. Me and Chris go fishing like once a year and we never seem to learn that fishing is f*c*ing gay. It takes forever just to catch one fish, its extremely boring. It especially sucks when you're trying to catch brim, at central park, with bread. Because they always just nibble off your bread without actually getting hooked. I swear they do this about 1000 times before you catch one of em. So this time I need to remember for sure, never go fishing again. You know what bothers me everytime I write in this journal? I can never honestly say what I want, it always gets censored or cut down (by me). I mean, if this was a journal that only I read it would have way more. Sometimes I omit things because I don't want people to think I'm crazy, or violent, or this or that. But usually that's not why I take stuff out. Usually I delete things to be nice to one individual person, and if it werent for that person, you would be seeing lots of stuff that you dont see. I'm not talking about anyone in particular either, its case specific. What i'm saying is, I have no problem sharing my thoughts and feelings with everyone. It's just sometimes I dont want to be rude, or alienate somebody and make them feel like I'm not their friend because of something I wrote about them. Whenever I write something really gutsy I get online all late that night or early in the morning and edit it out before anyone reads it. So now at least you know that, so you can try and catch the unedited versions of my journal if you want. All of the stuff I edit out isn't even gutsy, sometimes I just think what I wrote was gay/ stupid and get rid of it. So you can laugh at me for making stupid remarks if you read it. I brought this up because this whole paragraph was about something else, but I deleted it for the aforementioned reasons. I haven't talked to Jesseca in like 4 days :( , that sucks dudes, I miss her. It really sucks because she just got done being grounded for a month and I haven't seen her. I've been doin stuff like all weekend, so I'm not sure if she's called or anything. I was kinda hoping I would see her at the octoberfest, but nope. I saw Amber and I was gonna ask her where the Jessmyster was but I reacted too slow and I couldn't find her. I'm gonna call her tommorow though, I'll ask her if she wants to go to the fest. That'll be cool because I have all these extra tickets and stuff... I'm in the mood to chill out to some Dashboard Confessional, so I'm gonna go, and go to sleep. LaTeR bUdDiEs! p.s. HI JESSECA!

Dahhhhhhhhhhh!!!!! I hope everyone is doing better than me, because if not than the world as a whole is one pissed off sonofab**ch. (haha chris) An obscene amount of trash overwhelmes me right now. I'm feeling very frustrated and pissed off. I should probably explain before I wig out. From the beginning, here's what happened. I sign on in World Chess Network (some online chess thing where you can play people from around the world), the first thing it tells me is that my trial membership ends today, great. That wasn't really a big deal to me because I'm not a chess club kook or anything, no really i'm not. I was doing pretty good up until that point, my rating was pretty high. I even won a couple games when I first started, making me like 6-1 overall. Then I got cocky and challenged some guy that was way better then me, he whooped me. So I challenge some guy who had a way worse rating than me (I emphasize, way worse), and I didn't really pay attention and underestimated him. So he beat me with some crazy maneuver, and he won really fast. I just laughed at this because it was pretty funny, he even said it was pure luck. So then I challenge some kook who is about even with me skill wise. I start off really good, and i'm talking mad trash the whole time, because I think the guy's a moron or somthing because it seemed like I was dominating him. I continued dominating him up until the last 30 seconds. (there is a 20 minute time limit) All the guy had was his queen and his king, and I guess that's all it takes, because he took out every single f**k*ng guy I had, there had to be about 11 of them. One by f*ck*ng one. It was seriously the gayest trash of all time. He checkmated me when there was 5 seconds left until he lost by time. Damn that sucked, and it wasn't so bad that I lost, it's that I talked extreme trash and called him a loser, biotch, insulted him, and told him he was gonna lose repeatedly. He showed me, he even called me weak, even though that might not sound so bad, it pissed me off. But I did learn a couple things from this experience: never talk trash during chess, never challenge people unless they suck really bad, and if you beat me at chess then you are a piece of sh*t a$$hole that has no life. Chess is gay anyways... Now thats not even what I'm mad about, because I'm not even very good at chess. The thing that really made me mad was Mega Man 5, because if I'm losing at some craziness like chess I don't really care. However, if i'm losing at a video game, then i'm gonna be mad because I pride myself at being the master of video games. The game has been pretty hard, and it has given me a harder time than the other preceding Mega Mans, but difficulty I can deal with. In fact, I like games to be a challenge. The thing I cannot deal with is bad design/ programming, commonly seen in crappier games than the Mega Man series. The part I keep dying at isn't hard, it's bad level design, pure and simple. The level is perfect up until this glaring flaw, it is stupid and near impossible to pass. I will spare you the details because it would be crazy to explain this crap in depth. I'm surprised nobody else has mentioned it, it messes up the whole game. I tried it like 15 times and it won't work. If it wasn't a ROM and I had the actual game I would have already thrown the cartridge way the hell down my street, chased it down and slammed it on the ground again, gotten my sledgehammer, and smashed it into a million pieces, and then peed on it. I swear. I am seriously considering throwing this controller through my monitor and destroying my whole computer and/or smashing my Mega Man X cartidge and flushing it down the toilet for consolation. I'm not sure what I'm gonna do right now. I think i'll do what I always do when this happens, play it some other time when i'm happier. Because right now I have the determination, but I just don't think I can do much to help the situation when I'm so pissed off. Now that I have calmed down and thought about it, I have realized that I am really drowsy, tired, hot, and sweaty...and I have a splitting headache. I apologize for writing about this before I noticed I was just in some crazy mood and wiggin out. I know that this entry was poorly written and had the most uninteresting, dorky subject matter of all time. Even so, I'm going to leave it on here (i could delete it you know) just for a laugh. It will also give you a glimpse of how trashy I can be when I'm angry, and how funny it is. I'm gonna take a shower and go to bed, even though its early.(Yes, 10:00 is early for me) Later.

Wow, what a crazy weekend... I spent it hanging out with Chris and Mike, and briefly, Louie. Good times. We were laughing like 75% of the time. Probably because we were tired and crazy the whole weekend. In any case, I haven't had some good laughs like that in a while. Actually thats bullsh*t, I'm just too lazy to take the time and write all of it (They don't pay me enough). Besides, even though it's funny stuff, I don't think anyone wants to sit here forever reading 6 pages about me and my off the wall antics. But if you do, ummm... do... something... else....lol. I hate making a post this small, but I think I'll more than make up for it as soon as I'm not so busy with other stuff. It's not a lack of things to say, it's a lack of will to write it all down. One of these days I'm gonna make the biggest journal entry in the history of the world, so don't fret. I've got one more thing to say before I go: I Love Jesseca.

It's Tuesday, baby, oh yes...(heavy emphasis on sarcasm there). Not much goin on today, and school was so average that nothing even remotely interesting or worth mention happened. Maybe this is the proverbial calm before the storm. The storm being the Dashboard Confessional concert on Thursday night and the long awaited pep rally the following Friday morning. It seems to me like October is a month jam-packed with fun and excitement, for me anyways. With events such as pep rallies, a free day on the 11th, a Dashboard Confessional concert, a Gwar concert (Gwar rocks!!!), the Octoberfest, Halloween Horror Nights, and of course, Halloween itself. Not convinced that October is the coolest month around? Well then you must be gay. I went to the doctor today, they took my blood! Those bastards. As if that weren't enough, they forced me to pee in a cup.(Come on guys, one or the other) Will someone please tell me who thought of making people pee in a little cup in order to run tests on them. For that matter who the hell thought of draining people's blood out of their body. (That stuff doesnt grow back you know, they take your blood and its gone for good) Sounds like some fuc*in vampires or somthin....On second thought, who gives a damn about the guy who invented this crazy sh*t. But hey, if you're reading this, do me a favor and go study some more pee, fag. Now that I got that out, I can tell you about my first blood (kinda like Rambo hehe) experience. First of all, I was completely unaware of the fact that I had to get my blood taken. I thought I was just gonna have to pee in my little cup, and get out of there. Simple enough right? But no, I walk in there and the nurse is like "sit down" and i'm like "alright" but I'm still not for sure whats going on. Then she wraps a armband thing tightly around my bicep like i'm some sort of heroine addict or something, and at this point I realize what she's about to do. So naturally, I start laughing. Because as a very smart man once said "Against the barrage of laughter, nothing can withstand", if you think about it it's true, it's a cool saying, and one of my mottos (the other being "Don't stop, get it get it!"). Anyways, the nurse tells me to squeeze this apple thingy she put in my hand, when I did this my vein got really big and visible, and i'm thinkin "oh god". Man let me tell ya, if you have never had your blood taken, it is crazy. They stick a needle right in that big a$$ vein by your elbow and blood just flows into the container. They don't just put it in there for a couple seconds either, it's more like a minute, and for me, they filled up two containers. The whole time it's going on I was in a state of delirium, half due to the lightheadedness that comes from blood loss, and half being derived from my thoughts of "ahh its not over, geez this is taking forever, whats going on this crazy b**ch is f**kin sucking my blood". Seemingly for extra affect, my nurse was black. So she was all like "put cho arm right chere sucka, squeeze dis fool, hold still while I steal essential parts of your anatomy from you". I'm just kidding, she was pretty cool. Besides the fact that she is a blood and urine thief. How could someone do that for a living anyways?? When we left the doctors office, my dad and I went to the car repair palace to pick up the van. There were lots of stereotypical grease monkeys abound, and plenty of technical car talk for weeks. After the guy gave my dad a full report on the car it was time to take it home. And since it was just me and my dad, I was forced to drive it home. What a bummer... Although technically this was illegal, since I only have my permit (only 10 more months to the day I get my license!!!), who's gonna stop me? So that was pretty fun, it was the first time I've driven a car without my parents in the passenger side. It was rather easy too, not that it would be hard, i'm just sayin. Wow, that's 2 firsts in one day, not bad huh? Not bad at all.

Hey Jesseca, this is for you: Looking into your eyes I see all I want to be, I don't want it to end. If I could only put three words away, I see you. I only know I have an angel with me now. And when I fall asleep you're all that I see. You're in my thoughts and all of my prayers. I wish I could be all that you mean to me. My angel without wings, my angel. I wish you could see all that you mean to me, because I could never find the words to tell you. And when I fall asleep you're all that I see. You're in my thoughts and all of my prayers. I wish I could be all that you mean to me. My angel without wings -Fenix TX (I changed a couple lyrics, as I always do when something doesn't make sense or I don't like it) You should download the song Fenix TX- Your my angel, it will make that sound a whole lot better. Anyways, I'm leavin to go to my aunt Wendy's house in South Carolina in the morning. My entire family is gonna be there pretty much so it should be total madness, like 30 people sleeping in one house, and the house isn't even that big. It's gonna be really fun though, or else I wouldn't be going. So I hope you have an awesome Thanksgiving, I'll be thinking about you, and I'll be back Saturday so it's not even that long. And most importantly, I love you!

Nevermind the date above, today is Wednesday. Some may even call it Hump Day. I know what you may be thinking, why the hell would anyone call it hump day? Well that can mean one of two things. One, if you're a pervert, it's the day that you normally hump some random stranger on the streets. The second and more suitable meaning is this: it's the day in the middle of the week where it's no longer the beginning, and you get over that hump and start counting down the days until the weekend. Pretty spiffy huh, I heard that from the all knowing Mr. Monaghan (my wonderful physics/ chemistry teacher). School was fun today. I learned about the periodic table of elements. Even though I've learned about it before, I didn't completely understand until now. It is actually put together rather brilliantly if you ask me... The Marines were in my second block class, so that was interesting. The Marines seem badass to me. A few things I picked up on while they were talking and during the video they showed us. They are the only branch of the military to guard the president, there aren't that many of them, they carry a friggin sword (how cool is that), they wig out at boot camp(I heard them yelling "kill!" at every command), you must have a tan belt in judo to start out as a Marine, they even did some marching drills in class and it was all synchronized even though the two particular Marines had never trained or practiced together, and most of all, their songs are the most catchy marching/ military songs i've ever heard, they rock, and so do the Marines as a whole. The recruiter was cocky as hell too, which I liked. He was like "I am confident about talking in front of the class for two reasons. One, I'm a Marine. Two, I'm a sniper" then he laughed. He also had a fat ass gold watch on, and he told us about his 3 cars and 2 motorcycles to make sure we knew he was livin large...Speaking of cars, Zac got a new car and he's talking about it nonstop. I can understand that he's excited about it, but come on. Hehe, I say this now, but whenever I get my car i'll probably be talking about it as much as him, probably more. But until then you can't call me a hypocrite. And everyone who talks about their system that they're gonna have(ya know, the one with the big 12's, 15's, 1000 watt amps galore, mids and highs, the works), save it until you have actually purchased everything and it's all installed in your car, ready to play. Then you can brag about it all you want, I won't mind(Hell, I'll even brag with you). Otherwise you just end up lying about a bunch of stuff, changing your mind every couple days, and sounding like an idiot. I think that's enough ranting for now, let me instead enlighten you with my wisdom. In case you didn't already know, sleeping is the cure for all. If I am ever in a bad mood, grumpy, confused, unhappy, indecisive, or any other negative adjective you can think of I can go to sleep and wake up fully refreshed, and happier than Micheal Jackson at a day-care center. This would likely work for other people too, it's just that I know it works for me. I figured it out today, when I took a nap for about 4 hours and awoke in a dancing frenzy. I also discovered that dancing in a hooded sweater or "hoodie" makes me look really thuggish/ cool. You should try it sometime, you won't be dissapointed. Anyways, I danced forever when I woke up, and it was fun. As you may know, I watched Panic Room last night(I didn't watch the Sum of All Fears because I didn't wanna stay up too late). It was good almost the whole time, providing many cheap thrills and tense moments. There is some gore, but not as much as I imagined after my sister told me a guy gets hit in the head with a sledgehammer. It's not that bad really. The only problem with the movie is the ending, which I don't like at all. What kind of movie builds up a very good anti-hero the whole time, having him save the day at the end, but then doesn't let him get away with the crime? Take Fast and the Furious for example. Vin Diesel is the anti-hero and everyone starts to like him even though he's the bad guy, at the end he drives away(albeit without sucessfully completing the highjacking), but he gets away, and thats the way it should be. Panic Room doesn't do that, and it's supposed to be a happy ending. Well i've got news for ya assholes, everyone wanted the black guy to get away with it, therefore it isn't a happy ending! But my complaints are in vain, so I will stop the wiggage... Oh yea, if anyone cares. Jesseca got kicked off last night and couldn't get back on, it wasn't a protesting measure of any kind...That is all. Now I ride out. Peacer, ya greasers.

I think some crazy stuff happened at school today and I know several crazy things happened this weekend, but that doesn't mean I'm going to talk about them. Why not? Because I don't feel like it right now, I am really tired and groggy, and I guess you could say I'm grumpy. I was supposed to do be doing a bunch of stuff today when I got home, I had it all written down and planned out, but I didn't really accomplish anything... I did download a bunch of music videos though! I got some Taking Back Sunday, Ataris, and The Starting Line videos(and concert footage). It was pretty cool for me because I had never seen any of them perform before, and never saw them at all save for crappy pictures at their websites. My first impressions of The Ataris were what the fuck this guy is fat and dorky and fucking gay. It totally ruined my image of them, they were my favorite band too. It was ok though, the more I watched of them, the more I accepted it and now I like them the same as I used to it just came as a shock at first. Although I will admit that they make the worst music videos I have ever seen in my life, it is so amateur, and the lip syncing is so bad, that it's not even funny. No really, its that bad... My impressions of Taking Back Sunday was "wow they're awesome, they rock" from the beginning. No dissapointment here, it's funny how that works though because they were previously my least favorite of the three. Now they seem so much better to me due to their professional looking video and overall coolness while performing. Last but not least we have The Starting Line. They were like the median between the other two, their video was not as good as Taking Back Sunday, but not as bad as The Ataris. The video would have been way better had it not been for this crazy old guy getting all these chicks, dunking the lead singers face in a toilet, being nude, and acting like a jock. One other thing that bothered me was the lead singer looks like a fucking homo, to the extreme. He doesn't look that bad when he's just talking before the song at this concert video I have, only about an 8 out of 10 on the fag scale. It's when he's singing that he turns into a complete and total faget, that's when his gayness reaches a level that is off the fuckin charts. Hehe, but oh well, The Starting Line still owns you and your momma. My conversation with Jesseca today consisted solely of one huge argument about some stupid shit that Katelin wrote about love. I disagreed with it, and she thought it was correct. We probably should've agreed to disagree, but instead we sat there and quarreled about that bullshit for like an hour. Near the end I told her to drop it and she said I was just saying that because I was wrong (which I wasn't), I told her I wasn't wrong and that started some more arguing. She said it was 100% correct, and I proved to her without a shadow of a doubt that it was definitely not 100% correct. Then I put one of those smiley faces with their tongue sticking out. Right after that she signed off without saying anything. Whether or not it was in protest, or if she's mad at me, or anything like that, I'm not sure. It sure seemed like it. In any case, that whole argument was a perfect example why I don't like to start arguing with her about anything. If i'm right and I know it I am going to wig out on you hardcore, I don't care who it is, so I usually try to avoid that kind of situation with Jess. Oh well though, in the immortal words of Justin, that's what happens. I don't feel like doing anything else today, so I'm gonna grab some pizza and coke, sit back, relax, and watch a double header of the enormous blockbuster hits: The Sum of All Fears and Panic Room.

You better set aside some time to read this one, because it's a whopper...John's back! and even though he's only been out for a few days we've already had some good times, times I'll never forget. Don't think John's very exciting? Well he's got enough new jokes(not to mention dances) to entertain an army, well he cracks me up at least. How about these: I, Seven, and personal favorite, You goin to the barbecue? (they say "what barbecue?") My meat in your grill. It's good to have you back John...Veterans Day was today and we had an assembly thingy in the morning with a bunch of teachers/war veterans talked to us. Couldn't hear a word any one of those kooks said. There was some crazy group of juniors behind me and Chris throwing gum into the crowd. They were cracking up because they thought it was the funniest thing, but Chris and I were just laughing at them. I saw a couple funny lookin kids at that thing and laughed, I got a bunch of free breadsticks at lunch(oh yeaaaa), but for school today those were about the most exciting things that happened. That being said, it's time for me to brag and boast about the Seabreeze VICTORY over the Mainland Buc-a-Nerds. HAHAHAHAHAHAHAHA!!!!! EVERYONE AT MAINLAND, I LAUGH AT YOU!!!! Everyone said "Mainland's got the best D in the league, Mainland's undefeated, Mainland this, Mainland that". That was all until you played us, now look at Mainland. They're a bunch of LOSERS!! (all of this stuff doesn't apply to a couple people, you know who you are). 52-20 was the score, Mainland has been officially bitchafied. Now who has the best D? It looked like we had the best D the way we were hittin you queers out there, knocking peoples helmets off and sending kids flying back 10 yards. All while big Xavier was throwing 50 yard passes, and Kenny Scott was running the ball straight up your asses(that rhymed :). Mainland only allowed 1 touchdown all season until they played us, then they gave up 7 in one game. Our offense is unstoppable, they just found out first hand. Hey, at least you have a better band(hehe that rhymed too). Mainland was also number 1 in the state before they played us, and we beat them, now we both have 9-1 records. Wouldn't that make us the best in Florida? I would think so, especially considering the decisiveness of our win. It wasn't a narrow 3 point victory, we totally destroyed Mainland, making us the best. We are in my mind at least. At the game Chris and I were wearing Seabreeze shirts and sitting on the Mainland side. A couple of girls stopped me and were like "Yea Seabreeze!" and I was like "Hell yea!...You go to Seabreeze?" and they're like "no, but you've got some guts". I told em "Yep, I got balls the size of coconuts"(they should start callin me Dr. Suess the way I'm layin down all these rhymes) and walked away. Besides a couple groups of fuckers nobody else said anything really, probably because they were too busy crying. We didn't care though, we danced the mightiest dance ever danced. We busted the various John moves, the Justin, the Dave, the lawnmower, the weedwacker, the edger, the crip walk, the harlem shake, you name it. We danced forever, it was a feeling of euphoria rarely felt during football games. A lot of people left early on the Mainland side, they couldn't handle the defeat. But some were being nice, saying "good game" or "you guys played well" as we walked out, I was kind of surprised that so little people tried to pick a fight. Lucky for them though, because John would have ended up killing about 3,000 Mainlandies. He had our back, and nobody messes with John, he can benchpress 325 pounds and curl all the weights in Chris's weight room with ease. I have on thing left to say to Mainland: Who's the bitch now? Since I'm already speaking of sports, I beat NBA2k2 yesterday(completed season and playoffs), and frankly, I want my 98 hours back. I did finish with the best regular season record ever and went 16-0 in the playoffs, but oftentimes I didn't feel like playing and spent hours just playing it tirelessly to get to the end of the season/ playoffs. Near the end of the road I started gaining enthusiasm, after all I was in the playoffs and had almost won a championship. Whenever I finally finished the game I was expecting a flashy video with celebration, or dunks, or some other craziness. What I got was a stupid one screen deal that said Sacramento Kings: NBA Champions!!! Then the trophy spins up slowly with some crappy sparkle effect in the backround before going back to the menu screen, leaving me horribly dissapointed. I'm like "that's it!!?". That was the most unrewarding game I have ever encountered, I couldn't believe it. I mean, I nearly broke my Dreamcast with some 8-9 hour marathons on that game and this is what I get, well I'm not too happy about it. I will never play through another season on any basketball game for as long as I live.
