Nonetheless, I have a little song about the game: You were lost soldier when I hit you with the crossover, take the baseline, stop-pull-up and I makes mine. When I stick you the stakes high. I'm taking the rock, with this pressure I'm making the stadium lock. It's excitin when you're watchin NBA style clash of the titans. The handles is quicker than the eyes like lightnin and when you gettin dunked on it's frightenin, believe that. What chu need that when you came to get your ball on? I got you sweatin your body fluids till they all gone. I got you hurtin when I'm seein you breath, mad at me when I shut you down with the best D in the league. You couldn't score if I gave you a three, wide open. I'll take you straight to the hoop and leave the baseline smokin. I'm pokin, cuz none of yall can get with me. On a solo fast break I might bust a 360, move quickly. Sweat is better than fame, you might catch me at the three point testin my aim. I'm yellin And 1! every time I step in the lane, that's why Sega's always bringin you the best in the game. In other news, 8 Mile is getting rave reviews. Well at least from my sister, her fiance, my aunt, and my cousin. They all said it was awesome. I was going to see it last weekend, but I never did for one reason or another. It looks like I won't be seeing it this upcoming weekend either because Harry Potter 2 comes out, and that I have to see. Yes, you heard me right, Harry Potter rocks! (I've read all the books and the second is tied with 4 for my favorite) Staying with the subject...I flicked myself in the nuts this weekend and It reminded me just how bad it hurts to get hit in the balls. It has to be the equivalent, painwise, of pushing out a baby for girls. All of the women who have ever said men have it easier because they don't have to go through the pain of giving birth are forgetting one thing, they have never gotten hit in the goenads, it hurts just as bad, if not worse. Ok, I'll admit that I'm exaggerating quite a bit here, but it still hurts like a motherfucker. Alan came over yesterday, that was an unexpected visit. We sat there and talked for like 2 hours, and I was in my boxers the whole time, so that was pretty crazy. Oh yeah Alan, I too, like the awkward situations that occur when you go over people's you haven't talked to in a long time... There is a couple more pressing issues that I must tend to. First, I didn't know we had school today. I was under the impression that since it was veteran's day we wouldn't have to go to school. Apparently I was wrong...that sucks, I wanted the day off so bad. The funny thing about it is I was telling people on Friday not to come Monday because we have no school, and I even made plans to do stuff on Sunday night and Monday afternoon/day. LoL, well my plans were spoiled, to say the least. Second, my family and I are supposed to be going to South Carolina to visit my aunt Wendy for the Thanksgiving holiday, and I'm a little stressed out about it. I always get like this before we take any trips, I feel like I'm going to miss out on something big back home, or miss everyone excessively. I'm usually right though, so I have a reason to be worried. I will probably have fun, and I'm probably over-reacting, but I'm just kinda wiggin about going. I don't think I have a choice though, so I might as well not worry about it. I just hope I don't have to hang out with my uncle's redneck son too much. Adults always think just because two kids are the same age they will get along well. Well there are plenty of kids at my school who are my age that I think are total fagets, including rednecks, so this kid better not try to hang with me too much. Especially since I don't like the country type very much in the first place. Lastly, Justin banned us all and denounced us and sort of disowned us as his friends over some stupid shit a while back, but he never really said why. He repeatedly claimed that he "has had enough of our bullshit". We kind of knew that something was up because we were his only friends in the whole world, so there should be a better reason than that, unless he truly went crazy or somthing. Well the truth has finally revealed itself. It turns out that Justin is moving to Pennsylvania and he stopped hanging out with us because he didn't want to be sad when he moved. This is what Shannon told Chris Justin told her, and she has no reason to lie, so I believe her. Pretty simple explanation for Justin's wiggage, and it came as a shock to some (Chris) but not to me, because I always half expected this. Well Justin you have been my friend for a long ass time, and you always will be. It never changed, even when you banned us and shit, I stuck to my guns. Good luck in PA, and I hope it's better for ya up there. We will meet again, Fat Ju$....Enough with the mushy crap though. I beat Louie in a foot race!!! HAHAHA! I thought it was funny, and very envigorating to beat that dunce. I did it easily too, so I'm definitely the fastest man in the world, yep I'm convinced. You're next Mr. Martin. Yep yep, welp that's it for today ya goobers. It was mighty long, and I hope it was slightly interesting. I don't care though, love it or hate it I'm not gonna change it, because at the moment Dave... must.... sleeeeeeep. Hey Jesseca - Me and you, in your metal bed, ASAP. Haha you have a metal bed.

Put a fork in me, I'm done...Just kidding. Done I am not, and done I never will be. I had to say that, just to reassure everyone. Not to sound like a total geek here, but I was inspired by Nintendo's speech about being here to stay, and all that good stuff. It was pretty good. I'll tell you what was not pretty good though, Halloween. It had to be the worst Halloween ever. My plan to be a Power Ranger fell through, the costume was way too small, it wouldn't even go on my shoulders (well it would but I couldn't move an inch, seriously). Chris and Louie were Power Rangers though, so that was pretty funny. It was humorous watching these two giant Power Rangers walk around with their costumes going way up their ass and nuts, but that was about the only cool thing this Halloween. I didn't get very much candy, and everyone went in way too early, at about 8 there wasn't anyone out except for us. Us = Me, Chris, Lauren, Brittany, Louie, and some crazy slut from Lopez that nobody knew except for Lauren. It was pretty boring, I wish I would have went with Jesseca and her gang, it seemed like they had more fun than I did. For some reason Halloween is on the decline, kids these days don't appreciate it as much as we used to. In addition, there is more parents who are too scared to let their kids go trick or treating because of terrorism, their religion, and such. Or maybe not as many kids have been going because it is on a school night. Well next year we won't have that problem, it's gonna be on friday! Yep, next year should be the best. I'll be 16 and have a car, so there's not much that could make it suck. Nothing that I can foresee anyways. There was one other thing that was pretty cool about Halloween night. When we were riding home Chris stuck his head out the window and yelled at some kids, and they said something back, we were like what the fuck, lets kick these kid's asses. So Louie slammed on the brakes and went after them in reverse. Right when we hit the brakes two out of the three went running into the woods. We were yelling a bunch of crazy threats like "you're gonna die bitches", it was fun. We parked nearby and started yelling at them to come out, but they were being pussies. The kid that didn't run was being a major puss, and it was funny as hell. He was all like "I didn't say nuthin man, they were just playing around, don't kill them". We were like "we're just gonna beat your ass then" and he's like "I didn't say nuthin ahhh". We were acting all mad, and Louie had his brass knuckles on, so I bet we scared the shit out of those kids. Ha Ha Ha. The NBA season has begun and I am happy as a pig in shit. Things are going pretty much as I expected, except for a few suspensions affecting things. Tracy Mcgrady is really surprising me, GO MAGIC! Speaking of basketball and the NBA, I completed my season on NBA2k2. I'm a year late, I know, but it's still a HUGE accomplishment for me. Who else played through the whole season with 8 minute quarters, finishing a league record 73-9, with a 78.4 shooting percentage and a 20 point margin of victory. Not too many people. Now I just have to sweep my way through the playoffs and I'll be happy. First up, the Nuggets. You little nuggets better watch out, because Chris Webber is gonna flush your whole team down the toilet, because he is unstoppable! By the way, Chris Webber was the points leader, defensive player of the year, and MVP. Enough about my NBA2k2 dominance though, as I'm sure nobody knows what the hell I am talking about anyway... I didn't really do much this weekend as far as outside activities go. Well I did go play basketball at Hurst on friday, I did pretty good, but I'm sure it was pure luck. One thing that surprised me was that Hurst is freaking overrun with black people now. I looked like they built a bridge from Africa straight to the basketball courts, there were millions of them. Not that it was a problem, most of them were cool, at least they didn't try to jump us or anything. It's still fun to go there, even though everyone's skill level far exceeds mine since I haven't played in forever. I think as long as I just act like I'm good and make some shots every once and a while they will just think I'm sucking it up that day, and not that I suck completely. I need to start stretching out again so I can dunk, because even fat ass Julian can dunk now... The rest of my weekend was mostly me laying around watching Steven Seagal (the old school badass, he always spits out the cheeseball lines) movies and playing videogames. Louie came to my house at like 10:00pm on saturday asking if he could crash at my place because he punched his dad in the face, so I was like "yea". It's always cool with me when people want to stay the night, I don't care. We didn't talk much because we were both tired, but he did tell me he got some new 15's in his car, sounds cool to me, but I didn't see em yet. Whenever I woke up this morning he was gone, I thought that was kind of funny, especially since he left his hat on my dresser. He came back to get his hat around noon, he said he went surfing, ahhh that explains it. He also said he was gonna come back after he changed out of his surfing gear, but he didn't. It was alright though, I had to play some NBA2k2...Before I finish up I have three quick tidbits. 1)Rumor has it that John is out of jail, but nobody has seen him yet, and nobody has had the guts to call him or go to his house. 2) I went to the mall (and K-Mart) with Amber, Kim, and Jesseca on wednesday of this week. It was fun. 3) The only thing that bothers me about this journal is that it doesnt have a place for people to write comments about what I wrote. But that's ok because I am probably better off not knowing what people think about what I write, that way I won't change. Most of the time people just write mean, unintelligible bullshit in the comments section anyways, so I don't think I'm missing much... Umm I think that's about all that's happened to me recently. I think there hasn't been as much activity going on due to me being in love with Jesseca, and my friends being bored with me talking to her all the time. Sorry guys, we will wig out one of these days to make up for it. In any case, I must go, later yo, I love Jesseca so.

Here we go again...you've heard this all before, I know, but here's my take on the whole new years speech-- Another year has passed by and left us all high and dry. Another New Years Eve spent sitting at home, watching the big ball drop in New York City. The past year has been one with ups and downs, just like any other one. Justin moved to Pennsylvania, Chris moved to Shadow Lakes, Louie got his car, me and Zac became bestest friends, me and Jesseca became bestest lovers. There was a new Star Wars, a new Lord of the Rings, and a new Harry Potter, of all things. At the beginning of the year we were in 9th grade, now we're in 10th, it's all going by so fast. So many things happened this past year, good and bad, happy and sad, some that were great and some that weren't really worth the wait, some things that I hate, some things that I won't remember, and some things that I'll never forget. So much mischief was in the air, so much fun we had, I had my friends and family to spend it with, and for that I'm glad. Goodbye 2002, I had fun, it was rad. I know there was some inconsistencies in that little "poem"(I guess you could call it that), but you'll have to excuse me since I whipped it up rather quickly. Not bad though.... LOL, rad. I was trying not to buy into the hype this year, but what the heck, HAPPY NEW YEAR! On a side note, I've never written two journal entries in one day before, and I won't do it very much in the future, so how's that for doing something special for the occasion?

I had so much great stuff to say and tell about today, it would have been the funniest, most extravagant, exciting, and entertaining journal ever. But would I be writin journals on new years rockin eve ? Well technically I am...but funny, extravagant, exciting, and entertaining ones? HELL NO!

*WARNING: DORK ATTACK COMING UP, LOOK OUT FOR THE BIG/ GEEKY WORD USAGE GALORE*...Wow wow wow wow wowzaaaas. I am so totally amazed and utterly mesmerized right now it's not even funny. It may seem like I am blowing this whole thing out of proportion, and maybe I am, but that is just how I feel right now. No matter what the case, I am still reeling over how much of a profound impact this had on my state of mind, and happiness. It's crazy, ludicrouse even. By now you are certainly wondering what it is that I'm babbling about. Let me tell you what I'm talking about....I am talking about Citizen Kane. It's a movie, a really old movie(1941 is the year it was released, and yes, it is black and white), one that few people have seen, and one that is not very popular among the general public. It is all these things but nonetheless superb. If you want more opinions on this ask a qualified movie buff(I don't think you can be considered one without first watching this movie). I won't even begin to describe what it's about, as that may ruin it for everyone, although nobody will actually watch it, especially since it would seem like I completely overhyped it once they watch it. But I will say that the movie is simply sublime . I also must say that a second viewing is pretty much required, otherwise you will be left with horrendous first impressions, like me when I finished watching it for the first time. At first my thoughts were "what the fuck is this old-ass black and white, boring, trash-bullshit, how could anyone say this is anywhere close to being the best movie of all time!". This lasted a while, then near the end of the movie I started thinking "well this isn't bad, but it still shouldn't be considered the best ever". After the ending I was freakin confused as all hell, I didn't get the point at all. Then when you think about it for a good hour you realize the point of the movie, and it all comes into focus. At this point you should really watch the movie again, and this time through it will be magnificent entertainment, engaging the whole way, and very very interesting. That's how it was for me anyways....One last thing: this movie is brilliant.*THIS SIGNALS THE END OF THE DORKNOCITY* Another movie that I watched in past few days is A Clockwork Orange, it was awesome as hell. This one would appeal to a much larger audience than Citizen Kane, and it is more entertaining the first time you watch it. I recommend this one to everyone, with special emphasis on punkers, teenagers, and anyone who likes sex and violence. How much sex and violence is involved? I'll have you know that this movie was banned in the U.K. until recently(since it's release in 1971) and is still considered a "porno" by many here in the U.S., including my uncle Guy. Rent it. Enough about these silly moobies though, it's Christmas time! Well today is Christmas Eve(albeit very early in the morning) and I am happier than I thought I would be. Up until recently I wasn't too excited about Christmas, but then out of nowhere, earlier on today, I started to be excited about it. It is gonna be so fun opening all my presents, hanging out with my cousins, and rockin around the christmas tree. Okay so I made that last one up, so what? The other two will still be fun. I also left out out the most important thing to me this Christmas season, my sugarpie honeybun: Jesseca. It is because of her that i've been looking forward to Christmas Eve more than Christmas itself because I am going to her house on Christmas Eve and I won't see her on Christmas. I love my Jesseca...and you know how the saying goes: "All I want for christmas is you(doo doot doo)". That's about all I can think of right now since my mind is clogged by all this Citizen Kane nonsense, but normally I would torture you people with a much longer post, consider yourselves lucky. Oh yeah, and on a side note...PARTY AT CHRIS'S DAD'S HOUSE - FRIDAY NIGHT - BE THERE OR BE SQUARE! TALK TO CHRIS FOR THE DETAILS! Besides that though, they call me Charles Foster Kane because i'm outta this joint. (joints are filled with marijuana, I bet nobody knew that ::sticks tongue out::)

I....am....so....pissed...off...mostly because I went to the movies and saw Lord of the Rings today right when I got home from school, the movie was great and all that but it's what happened afterwards that makes me mad. I had no ride home, and Chris's dad came and got Chris but the fucker had the nerve to just leave me and Louie there. He could've at least let us use his cell phone or dropped us off at my street since it was on the way. Especially since I gave him a ride there, not to mention home from school, but "nope". Well next time he needs a ride home from school (which is an everyday basis as of now), that's gonna be my response, "nope". So the movie got out at like 7 o clock and I was walkin around the movie theater/ the surrounding areas for like 2 hours waiting for a ride before me and Louie just decided to walk home. That really burned me up man, it is a such a long ass walk, ahhhh. Plus our shoes got extremely dirty on the way home, we were hungry as hell, and our day and night was ruined by wasting all that time walking(and both of us had plans). Another thing that's kind of angering me, but not as much, is that Nintendo made zero announcements of any kind, nevermind ones of the "megaton" sort. But that's not all, when I get home I hear that Amber was freakin out on Jesseca tellin her to break up with me and shit. For some stupid reasons too, maybe if she had a valid, reasonable point, then I wouldn't care. Here's what I have to say to all of that crud: "Bleh". There was one good thing that came out of the walk home though, and that is WEEZIN THE JUICE!!! That's where you go up to those Coke sprayers (like the ones at fast food restaurants) and put your mouth right on it and drink it. It's awesome doing that, the best thing about it of course would be that it's free...We had final exams today, and guess what? They were easy as hell, I totally wasn't expecting them to be so friggin easy, that's what happens I guess...Ahh I try to change the subject or talk about something else but all I'm really thinking about right now is how much I miss Jesseca. I wish I could go over her house right now and just lay down beside her and go to sleep, that would be awesome. So if you happen to see Jesseca do me a favor and tell her I love her, thankssssss man(heh, Lou)Yeah I'm wiggin out, goodbye.

What's the difference between today and tommorow? It seems to me that they are lightyears apart. Let me explain. Today is a day of mostly sitting and waiting, because tommorow, as it turns out, is when all the action starts. You're probably wondering what action i'm talking about...Well I'll tell ya. First of all, we have final exams in two out of my four classes, Geometry and U.S. History. Neither of those really matter though since my grades are all but locked up. I have an A in History, since that test is gonna be a cakewalk for a History buff like me. Geometry, however, is a whole other story. I have a D in there right now and it's most definitely gonna stay that way because even if I get a 100 on the exam (which is 15% of our grade) I can't raise my grade up to a C. So that just goes to show you how bad I have it with that class, but at least i'm passing. And before you go calling me dumb and all that you need to realize that I have A's and B's in all my other classes, it's just that I fucking hate my geometry teacher, you don't even know how much I do. It just goes to show you how much of a turd she is, making an intelligent kid like me nearly fail her class because of her immature and annoying antics. Enough ranting though, i'm making it seem like I actually care, when I am so far from caring. To finish off this subject, after going to 1st and 2nd block Thursday to take the finals in those classes, school will be done for 2 WEEKS! (two weeks, two weeks?). And it could not have came at a better time, I am so friggin schooled out it's not even funny. I don't know how much longer I could have gone on without a break, ahhh...Back to the main topic, the second thing I am waiting for is The Two Towers of course! This movie is gonna be awesome, the second movie in the Lord of the Rings trilogy, and the first one was probably my favorite movie of all time. I can't wait to see it man, I already read some insane reviews for it, saying it's everything they expected and much more, muahaha. Some gook (coughZACcoughcough) told me that it came out today and got all excited, I was gonna go see it right when I got home, but I realized he was just being dumb. I knew I shouldn't have believed him though, I'm like never wrong and I knew it was coming out on Wednesday, but anyways...it's gonna rock. The third and final thing I am awaiting is Nintendo's upcoming "megaton" announcement. Here's the scoop: A long time ago, about two months or so, there was a report(most likely a rumor) that Nintendo was planning on releasing an announcement of "megaton" proportions sometime in December. The time passed by without any news of it, and now that it's December websites are again reporting that Nintendo will annouce it very soon, as in today. Even CBS/CNN reported on it this time, sort of making it not just a rumor anymore. I've been looking on websites all day for some sort of news but I was told that it won't actually be on any sites until tommorow, because it takes so long to update the sites. So naturally, I am eager to hear what the hell the announcement is about, because "megaton" means frickin HUGE....And yes I'm aware that this list started leaning towards extreme geekiness in the last two things, hehe. But nevertheless, my mood is one of great anticipation, whether it be of my final exams, The Two Towers, the "megaton" announcement, or the massive amounts of fun that i'm going to have over this christmas break. A couple of interesting things did happen today though...There's this large Italian kid that everyone was talking about today who said his dad was in the movie "The Godfather". So me being the hardcore skeptic that I am wigged the fuck out about his dad not being in the Godfather. Besides, what are the chances? I mean, just because the kid is italian doesn't mean his dad was in the Godfather, and I had plenty of reasons to believe he wasn't. Like: That movie is really old and my dad would be like 12 when it came out, so his dad must be pretty old if he was in it. The kid is crazy, and he could just be lying, because that's like saying my grandpa is in fuckin Gone With the Wind or something, its crazy, implausible, ya know? Well it turns out that this motherfucker wasn't lying, his dad really is in the Godfather, I checked the credits and it says his name right on there. He showed me right? That's what you would think, but frankly, I don't give a damn, since I was arguing mostly for the sake of arguing. It was funny anyways, I got a good laugh out of it. From now on I'm gonna tell everyone that my dad is in Scarface, because he's Cuban. Or better yet, my dad is Al Pacino himself, lol....But that's not all folks, I made yet another discovery today: Slayer fuckin rocks!!!! They are about as hardcore as it gets and they know how to rock the fuck out. I had never heard any of their music before and they simply blew me away, blew me out of the water, they can play some of the awesomest guitar riffs i've heard. And I dig their lyrical style, as cheesy as it may be. They sing about "DEATH TO YOUR SOUL, BANISH THE DEVIL BLAHHHHH!!!!", you know what i'm talkin about. If anyone wants to know how to start a hard-core band, they should listen to Slayer, that's all i'm gonna say. Now I'm gonna go finish watching my movie, it's called The Beast Within, or some shit. I rented it on friday but I haven't watched it yet, but it started off pretty cool. So far some chick got raped by a beast, she got pregnant (she thought by her husband), and had a kid. Now she's just finding out, when the kid's all old that the kid is starting to mutate into this beastly creature and murder everyone. That's all that happened so far, and I'm like 5 minutes into it, so it should be tight. You would think I would be studying right now with all these final exams coming up, but nope, my no studying policy remains in place. p.s. I was just thinking about it and I realized this post was long, boring, and pointless. Totally without humor I might add, but meh, I laugh at the fact that it's trash, lol.

Wowee, I haven't written in a long time. I think that's because I've just been telling all my friends my little stories individually instead of writing em on here for everyone to read. One thing's for sure, the reason I haven't been writing isn't due to nothing happening. I've been wigging out every day and night. Take the last two days for example. Last night we stole 3 eggs out of my refrigerator to go egg Brain Beard's house, we did it, but then we ended up going to 7-11 and buying three more cartons of eggs, one for each of us (Me, Zac, and Louie). We egged so many freakin houses, along with countless cars, including 2 cop cars. Then we went to the movies and chilled there for a long ass time, what we were doing there was beyond me, I was just goin with the flow. Everything was closed, save for a couple movies that were still running, so we talked to the movie theater folk and bullshitted with the cop that was there. This one guy was the man at this one arcade game, he knew like every shortcut and he was the owner of every high score on the machine. After a while John came out and was threatening Louie because he owed him money or something, I don't really know what was going on though. He gave him half of the money (five dollars, whoopdedoo), and John went back into his movie. Even later Chris and Shannon came out, Chris left, Shannon stayed, and Louie and Zac went in and talked to Shannon for a little while. I of course stayed in the car for this duration of time due to my hatred of Shannon. After that we went home I believe. I don't remember too much after that, maybe we watched one of the six movies we rented, or maybe we didn't, even though every single one of them was shitty. Today, which is Saturday(despite what the journal nazi may tell you), was fun too. First we went and hung out at the mall for a few hours, we originally went there to see Jesseca, but we ended up wiggin out too. It took us forever to find the Jessmyster and when we did they were about to go so my time spent with her was minimal. But she did have some crazy nigger with her that she didn't know, and she was wiggin out, but she did say I was hot (for a white boy) so I can't diss her too much. Jill was there too and she was really high, so she was freakin out. She had some cut/ bruise on her eye and she claimed she fell repeatedly although it was obvious that she didn't fall. Eventually she admitted that she got in a fight with some black girl, I laughed at that, haha. After Jesseca left Louie, Zac and I kooked out at the mall some more. We got into a little scuffle with a group of niggers, I don't know if you could call it that, since it was just trash talking back and forth and such, no actual fighting. It was funny as hell though because Zac kept messing with this one and he was like "man don't touch me" and he rubbed his bald head. The little nig didn't do anything though, he was acting like a real puss. The closest it came to a fight was out in front of the food court entrance. The kid was like "construction worker motherfucker, look like ::mumble munble::" and Zac said "these boots are awesome, they're lugs you wish you had em". We were walking away at the time so the kid goes "come back here and say it to my face" so Zac turns around, holds out his hand to stop oncoming cars, goes up to the kid's face and goes "these are lugs". There was pushing and shit but nobody got hit. Zac didn't wanna swing on the little nigger because there was a big nigger right beside him backin him up, and another one just standin around. He shoulda though because if that big nigger jumped in I woulda knocked him the fuck out, I was behind him and ready to pounce, he wouldn't have seen it comin. I'm sure Louie woulda helped me out too, not that I needed it. Those kooks avoided a hardcore beatdown, that's all I know...After that incident we spent the next hour or so riding around screaming at people out of the car window. If you have never done that, take my word for it when I say it's one of the funniest things ever. Especially when you come up behind them and scream at the top of your lungs so they get all scared and jump. Oh man, thats good stuff....I went to Jesseca's house for the rest of the night, and that was fun. Her sister's crazy ass boyfriend drove me home in his old school Firebird(I think that's what it was, haha), so that was funny. My life is pretty damn good right now, I've been havin a lot of fun lately and I'm happy as your grandpappy, so hahaha.

It's Thursday once again, it came faster than I expected. Things are moving along nicely. It seems to be getting progressively warmer as the year goes on, which is good thing. The cold was fun while it lasted(not that it's over yet), but it's starting to get old now. Besides, it does weird things to me when i'm tired, like making my legs feel weird, and as a result making me walk around school like some kind of retard. Retards, now that I mention them, are hilarious. I sometimes see them walking(or rolling in weelchairs) through the halls and everytime I wonder what the hell are these kooks doing here? It's obvious that they are retarded, so why are they even at school? I guess so people like me can laugh at them. If you ever look at them, specifically the down syndrome ones, they all look the same and it cracks me up every freakin time. I don't know what it is, maybe they just look crazy by nature, but it cracks me up. I usually don't laugh at the older ones for some reason, just the youngins. Maybe it's because I tend to respect my elders, even if they are crazy lookin motherfuckers. Disorganization is a very bad thing, I learn that every six months or so when I have to clean out my backpack or room, but still I make no effort to organize things in advance. Like I used to say, there is "no need." I'm not sure what is going on right now in my programming class. I'm just sitting here typing this, blatantly off task, and nobody else seems to be doing work either. I suppose it is a free day. Sweet! My English teacher Mr. Phillips would never allow this. He works us to the bone, but that's the way I like it. All work and no play makes Dave a smart boy. I have to do so much homework tonight for that class, I have to write two essays, do six pages of homework, and type up one other essay. I brought it upon myself though, I had a week to do it but I procrastinate and it finally caught up to me. It should be alright though, I had nothing better to do today. General Robert E. Lee of the Civil War was once quoted for saying "Duty is the most sublime word in the English dictionary", and in most respects I agree with him. Spanish class is next and it's pretty cool. I have learned to like Senor Gamache, even if he does enforce the dress code on girls who wear small articles of clothing, which leads me to believe he's gay, but is probably just his Christianism. Besides that he's really cool and I think he's a good teacher. Much better than my eighth grade Spanish teacher Mrs. Shideler, who couldn't speak English for shit. I have learned more at this point in Gamache's class than I did in a whole year in Shideler's. It is a good thing he changed our seats around yesterday, because there was this fuckin nasty ass girl that sat next to me and if I had to look at her one more time I would have puked, and that is an understatement. She had a freckly face, extremely small head, nappy hair, mole covered body, the whole nine yards. Oh my god it disgusts me just thinking about her. I didn't even care if it was an attractive girl that got moved next to me, a guy would be fine, just move that ugly ass bitch! So now a guy sits next to me, which is a huge improvement. A couple days ago, in Spanish, this kid suddenly started crying. At first I felt sorry for him because he has cancer and he's going bald from the kemo, so I thought he had a breakdown and started thinking about dying or something. Everyone was looking at him like awww. So Mr. Gamache goes up to him and is like "What's up?", but he just keeps crying. So he's like "What's wrong?", the kid says nothing. Gamache asked him a couple other questions until, at length, he said "You don't know how to do the work?", and the kid shook his head yes. After that, me and the rest of the unsympathetic people in the class started laughing at him. It was funny because the people next to him were trying not to laugh after they heard that, so they were all turning around and letting out their compressed laughter. I would have none of that, I was openly pointing and laughing at this kook. Cancer or not, why would you cry about not knowing how to do something? It is nothing to cry about, and that would do no good. All I have to say is, what a wuss. I just noticed that I have a stain on my pants. It's in a weird place too, like the inside of my leg, how crazy. It is also an odd color, some type of light brown, it looks like rust or something. Oh yeah, it's from that Yoohoo I drank this morning, I spilled it all over myself. It's cool though, the milk stain combined with my crazy hair makes for an interesting and stylish ensemble. On an unrelated note, what is with all these people(Ricky, Dan, the Werewolf Kid) defending Stuart? Are they not aware that he is a major league cakeboy? Come on man he is like the star player. Everytime Louie, backed up by me, tries to tell them that he's a fagety fucker they always respond with "no he's not gay, he has a girlfriend, he has a Z, he's awesome, he's the pimp." Alright you queers, why must you do this? Do you normally defend homosexuals or are have you recently came out of the closet? In any case you should stop because it doesn't look very cool. I mean WAKE UP AND SMELL THE COFFEE, STUART IS A FAG BITCH. Anyone in their right mind who has seen him cannot deny that. Nevertheless, I will adress and dismiss the statements that were made in his defense individually. He has a girlfriend? Well she's fat and ugly, a possible reason of why he went gay in the first place. "He has a Z, so he's the man in my book." Ok, well not in mine. For one, he didn't pay for that car, he got it from his richy rich parents. So that doesn't even count. If anything it makes him even more of a worthless booger, and a spoiled brat. For two, Zs are not cool. I don't think so anyway. If he wants to be a big shot why didn't he get a Ferrari or a Viper, or some other sort of luxury car. Zs aren't shit compared to anything like that. Lastly, he's in wrestling, and he reportedly sticks his finger up peoples asses. Now if that ain't gay then I don't know what is. As for the question of what i'm doing this weekend, the answer much more fullfilling than last week. On Friday, once again, it is undecided. I think I have some stuff to do if nothing else arises, like get to sleep early so i'm rested up for the activities of the next day. Saturday is a whole different story. The plan is to get up around 10, gather the troops, and head to Hurst fairly early. We usually have a hard time getting there early, but if all goes right then saturday will be different. We have a great dicathlon planned, basketball and football. It may not sound so great, but it is going to be the shit. It's gonna be Alan, Chris, Zac, Mike, Louie and I, and every one of us is hyped about it. I for one can't wait. Hopefully the day will live up to all our expectations and will be fun as hell. The dicathlon won't be the end of it either, afterwards Chris and I are going to the movies to see Darkness Falls, which should scare the crap out of us, but probably won't. Then we will go back to my house and party the night away(most likely play video games/ Magic). I don't know what i'm doing Sunday, but sometime this weekend, Friday or Sunday, I have a few things to do. Among them are going to the flea market to purchase various videogame related materials, hanging out with Jesseca, and going to the card shop to participate in a MTG tournament, and win. LoL! This fatty just fell backwards in her chair and now everyone is laughing at her histerically, including myself. With that to keep in mind, i'm leavin.
Concerning the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, they're still a bunch of turds. Now they're just World Champion turds. Go figure.

Matt: What is in this drink? Chris: Splurk! Dave: Pits! Hahaha. Oh man that was hilarious...I didn't write yesterday, ruining my streak of 5 days in a row, and combined with today's post it would have been the first time I ever wrote every day for a week. Not this time though, maybe the next. Yesterday was pretty cool, but we(we = me, Zac, Mike, Chris, and Alan) didn't do much, and if we did I forgot. All I remember is we went to Hurst pretty late, around 5 I guess, and nobody was there. We went there with only a football because our basketball was flat, so were hoping the Hursties would be there with a ball, but they weren't. When we got there and noticed that there was nobody was there we just decided to stay and play football. I think it was an awesome decision. I had a lot of fun playing football, I haven't done it in forever. The teams were me and Chris vs all and we beat them, of course. I was QB throwin the passes of perfection and runnin it like a madman at will, and Chris was the reciever and mossed all over everyone. The second game it was Chris and I vs Alan and Mike. They actually put up more of a fight without Zac, so that was cool. Third me and Chris played everyone again, we scored once then Zac quit so we just stopped playing. I think everyone had fun, except for Zac(he's more of a soccer dude) and maybe Mike. I only wish we had some better competition, or at least one more player so we could play 3 on 3, that would make it more interesting for sure. Last night we played Magic(:The Gathering) until like 3 in the morning, and we've been playing all day up until this time(me and Alan anyways), I had a blast. It was fun to play that again. It rekindled my love for the game and it has me thinking about it even now. I made some trades with Alan and improved my deck significantly, it is pretty damn good now, and it was already kick-ass before. And all you bitches at the cardshop are goin down one of these days, i'm gonna compete in a tournament, and i'm gonna kick allllllll yo asses!! Just to clear something up for you suckas who think we're dorks for playing Magic. We are not dorks. It's that simple. We used to go to the cardshop in sixth grade(I think it was, maybe seventh and eigth a little bit), and even then we could tell everyone there was dorks. We didn't fit in because we weren't dorky enough for them, we weren't one of the regulars. So the whole time we've played Magic we've just kind of laughed at the dorky types who play and dominate them, all while avoiding the negative stigmatism of being called dorks. If you still think we are then you can bite my dong because that is not the case. I know this was kind of short and sucky today, but you can't expect too much on Super Bowl Sunday. Right now i'm gonna get in the shower, eat a shitload of food, and get ready to watch the game. I cannot wait for this one, it's gonna be awesome!

Bleh, I was trying to write one of my traditional, long, in-depth journals, but after repeated failed attempts, I gave up. It looks like this time, that just won't cut the mustard. So as an alternative i've decided to just straight up tell you what happened today, as if I was talking to you. The day started off with Chris and I at my house. It was pretty boring actually, we were just sitting around doing nothing. Then Jesseca called and just plain infuriated me. She shouldn't have even called if she was just going to tell me that she isn't doing anything with me this weekend, and instead she's just going to hang out with Amber and Beau(I think that's how you spell it, although I could give two shits how it's spelled since it is the gayest name ever, and yes it is a boy). What good could possibly come from telling me this? None. Then she tells me that i'm probably not gonna be able to come with Amber and them to the movies(even though I sort of just assumed I could go with them, it's not that outrageous of a thing to think. but alas, assuming makes an ass out of you and me), because it's Amber's birthday. I don't see what difference that makes, this is not kindergarten anymore, you don't have to baby the fucking birthday girl. Thanks for ruining my plans. And what the hell is going on with this Beau kid? Doesn't he have better things to do than hang out with my girlfriend? Supposedly he has a girlfriend, but where the hell is she at... I am convinced that he is a rapist fag, but hey, it could just be me. I don't care what anybody says, there are no guys in the world that hang out with friends that are girls on the weekends with purely platonic intentions, there are zero , nada , none . You may say "but this" and "but that." But nothing, it just doesn't happen. I think I would know how a guy's mind works... If it did somehow happen then there are two possibilities: either the guy is gay, or really fuckin weird. If he's gay, then that is, well, gay. If he's really fuckin weird then what the hell are you doing hanging out with him in the first place. I forget what I'm trying to say here, but the moral of the story is this Beau character is a girlfriend steal attemptin male-whore loser who needs to get some friends that aren't females, and especially that aren't my girlfriend, anyone but her and i'm fine with the fag. After I listened to some Taking Back Sunday and supressed my anger (not got rid of it), Louie came over. We didn't have anything to do so we were kind of confused at first, then we went to Frank's. There was some sort of drug deal going on, but since i'm not a narc I won't disclose the parties involved or any sort of details like that. I will disclose this though: Frank is the craziest kid ever. He's all calm one minute and concentrating on rolling a blunt, or whatever it is he does, and then in a split second he'll yell some craziness and then laugh the most insane laugh I have ever heard. He seriously sounds like a psycho, I swear. I kinda dug his room though, it is kind of like Alan's old room, with Magic cards laying all over the place and toys and gadgets from the past scattered throughout. For example, there was a stop sign, a construction cone, and one of those circular things from the road work areas that have that flashing yellow light on the top. Pretty cool stuff. The plan was for Louie and I to go to find out what time Darkness Falls starts, then come back. Instead we just went driving around and left Chris at Frank's to fend for himself. At first we were just randomly cruisin around town, with no real goal in mind. We even went to some broken ass drive through restaurant called Gary's something or other and it was so old and crazy it was funny, I was like "what the fuck is this man?". After some time Louie distracted me by telling me some joke and I was so busy laughing at it I didn't even realize it when we had arrived at Emily Vulpi's house. What a surprise. We usually end up there whenever we drive around, but she has never been home when I was there, but today she was. We went in there and chilled with her for a little bit. It was cool to see her again, I haven't done that in a long time, but we've known eachother for many years. The time we spent with her was entertaining because she had a lot of stuff to say and stories to tell and stuff, she's just really outgoing. I think she's one of those people that would get annoying after a while, but she's ultra cool in limited doses. She wanted to go to her friend's house in Port Orange, and because time was not a factor and we had nothing better to do, we gave her a ride there. The ride there was pretty fun. Louie's mom's car was our vehicle for the day, and the speaker is blown in that mutha, so that kinda sucks but eh, it still works. When we got to Port Orange we met this kid named John that was with her friend, and we went in his house while the girls went to put their stuff at the girl's house. This kid John seemed pretty cool. He was the total thug type, which is fine by me. The funniest thing about this situation though, I will explain now...sometime in the past week John Nealon and his gang of Ormond Beach thugs(Adam Wagner and the like) all went to some Port Orange party(a 50+ person double kegger) with baseball bats and tried to beat everyone down. What happened though, was the opposite. The mob of over 50 kids immediately saw them, ran out of the house, chased them down, and beat the living shit out of them. This wasn't no pussy beatdown either, these kids got annhilated. Some of them ended up with broken noses, bruised ribs, and more injuries i'm sure that put them in the hospital. They got humiliated too, the Port Orangies trashed their van to the extreme, stripped them of their clothes, and threw them in some gutters. The funny thing is, this kid John that we just met was involved in the beating, and was one of the Port Orangies, and the event occured right down the street from his house, that we were at. I don't know about you, and I doubt anybody knows what i'm talking about, but I thought that was really crazy. After the girls came back we just sat around John's room for a while before getting sick of it and leaving. Once again we were driving around with no purpose or destination. Until we decided to go to Morgan's, we figured why not, it was sort of in the neighborhood. Before we got there I started having second thoughts about it, I was thinking about how weird it would be to see her after not seeing her for like a year or so. It wasn't seeing her that bothered me the most, I especially didn't want her mom and dad, they might wig out on me or something. I didn't want to go in, but Louie pretty much forced me to. The encounter lived up to all expectations as far as awkwardness goes, everyone in the house was giving us blank stares the whole time we were there. All the while I was smiling and laughing at the craziness that was currently taking place. Actually I think I did get a smile or two out of them, well Morgan and her mom at least, mostly because I didn't stop smiling. She showed us around her house, which was cool because I hadn't seen it since it was just concrete and wood, when it was first being built. I have to admit that I was impressed, it turned out pretty damn nice, it didn't look like much when it was under construction, but now it was lookin grand. I probably shouldn't be surprised though, her mom is an architect. There was a bunch of stuff around the house that would lead you to believe that she's rich(new Sony TVs for example), but I know otherwise. When we were done with the little tour we just hung around the kitchen talking about a bunch of boring stuff. The situation seemed kind of tense, but I wasn't feeling that way at all, I wish everybody would have loosened up a little. Didn't happen though, and I was kind of dissapointed that we didn't get to talk about anything interesting. I guess that's what ya get when people aren't used to foreign intruders from the past invading their house. Looks wise, Morgan looked different than I remembered her in the face, but only at first. Then I realized she hadn't changed much at all, not only in the face but everywhere else. I would still say she's hot, and I still have a small amount of attraction towards her, but it is nothing I would act on. Not only because I love Jesseca, but also because she's simply a lost cause that I gave up on a long time ago. When we left Morgan's it was sudden and abrupt, not to mention impolite, and neither of us got hugs or anything, which is usually a given with the female friendlies. Oh well, I think that just made it even more odd, and therefore funnier. By that time it was like 8:30-9:00 and we weren't ready to quit yet, but we had no other options. We tried to call Chris and some other people, but nobody answered, so we eventually packed it up and called it a night. I went to my house, and Louie went to his. Leaving the mystery of where Chris was unsolved. At the present time I have learned the whereabouts of Chris, and what he did all day while we were gone, but that's not a worthy enough story to be told. The main source of comedy for today, in the form of prank calls to just about everyone, was the joke that Louie told me. It is one funny ass joke, but I won't reveal it just yet. Probably tommorow it will have a post all for itself. That approach will build more anticipation[in theory, but I don't think anyone could care less]. In conclusion, today was a day of unexpected events galore, and more fun than I imagined. It also took my mind off of Jesseca at a time when I am feeling sort of pissy towards her, which was why I liked it. My mood now stands in such stark comparison to the one I was in at the beginning of the day. When I got off the phone with Jesseca I felt like crackin some skulls, now I feel like catchin some zzzzz's. This day can be summed up by something the famous writer Charles Dickens once said, "It was the best of times, It was the worst of times."

It's one of those days where if the work's not easy, or I am the least bit confused as to what I am supposed to do, I simply won't do it. That's why i'm sitting here in computer class doing nothing, she didn't make it clear what I had to do, so now she pays the price. She just came by and asked me "how is it coming along David?" and i'm like "uhh I don't know." I guess I fooled her with my brilliant tactics of switching back and forth between the internet and Qbasic. She underestimates my sneakiness. If you are wondering who the hell i'm talking about with all this "she" business, I am referring to the beast of a woman that goes by the name of Mrs. Parlade. I did do some work in English today, but it was easy, we just had to draw a scene from one of the short stories that we read. Now I can at least be comfortable in the fact that I got something accomplished. I have been messing around with my blog template and HTML the rest of the time. It boggles my mind, I don't understand it very much, but I figured out a couple things. I must say I am slightly intrigued by it; it would be cool to actually know how to use it, but no such luck. I am sad to report that the advertisement at the top cannot be changed. It sucks, I know, but you have to actually pay money to get rid of things like that. There are no tricks to avoid it. Few things annoy me more than things that require money on the internet... my dad already pays like $50 a month for the ISP. Isn't that enough for you greedy bastards!? That money adds up you freakin computer geeks. Basically, fuck the corporate world biatch! In other news, using my overwhelming intelligence, I have managed to change the sample links into actual links. I now have Louie's Blog, My Website, and Anti's Blog. Anti is a guy that I don't actually know. I haven't even chatted with him on the internet, let alone in real life. But I stumbled upon his blog and he seems like a really cool guy, and if nothing else, he makes me laugh. So you should check out those links, and there will be more in the future. The possibilities are endless with these links, soon there will probably be around ten or so. I just wish more of my friends(coughchriscough) would get journals or a blog, and preferably a website. That would be cool, then I would have more links and it would be like a network of friends. After that we could take over the world!!!Muahahahahaha!!! Actually that is not an option, I got a little carried away... I hope you like the cliche "turn into maniac for a few seconds, talk about taking over the world, laugh like a mad scientist, then get control of self and act like nothing happened" routine, I think I have it down pat. Since i'm done writing and it still isn't time to go it's time for some random jibberish. "Yeah Jibberish!" PaT mE oN tHe BaCk AnD yOu WiLl ReCiEvE a BiG oLe StEeRiNg WhEeL sTrAiGhT fRoM mY gArAgE...tHe GaRaGe Of DeAtH. dA sHaTtErEd PeNiSeS aRe At HaNd, RuN fOr YoUr LiVeS!!! Okay... that was lame.

Good television? I have been watching it. I just watched Joe Millionaire and Man Vs. Beast back to back, and let me tell ya, those are some quality TV shows. Whoever came up with the ideas for these shows is brilliant. I had never seen either of them before and they were much better than I expected, and I usually don't even watch TV at all, except for sports. When I was watching Joe Millionaire all I could think of was how each of these girls were going to react when he told them his secret at the end. It's not like it's something small either, they are gonna wig out man, I predict they won't still like him after they find out he's not rich. The final show is gonna be a must see for everyone who walks on two legs, and even the ones who don't. Man Vs. Beast was also a very interesting and entertaining show, i'm not sure if it was a one time special type thing or a regular series, but it was awesome. A monkey beat a sumo wrestler in tug-o-war, a sprinter beat a giraffe in a 100 meter race but lost to a zebra in that same format, a champion food eater lost to a gigantic bear in a speed hot dog eating contest, 40 midgets lost in a race to pull a jet-liner across the finish line to an elephant, and finally, a Navy SEAL beat a chimpanzee in a race through a military obstacle course. Every one of the competitions were fascinating, and some of them were amazing. If they are still deciding whether or not to make another show in the series, my vote is yes. Last night I saw some cool stuff as well. The new American Idol competition is shaping up nicely, and if none of the people have any talent, at least they were funny to watch. Some of the craziest people ever were at the tryouts, and it was funny as hell. I wonder why these morons go to the auditions when they know they can't sing, I don't think they know or something. I'm not sure how that happens though because it is glaringly obvious... The funniest thing about it is the people think they are doing good, and they're smiling from ear to ear, and it seems like the judges are digging it(but for real they are just smiling because it's crazy/funny that these kooks cannot sing for shit), and they stop and they're like "thank you." Then Simon says something like "that was amazing" so the people get all excited and happy and start smiling and laughing and stuff, then he goes "...amazingly dreadful, you are the worst singer in the world." Oh man that Simon comes up with some of the best insults i've ever heard, and I can't tell if he is improvising or what, but for the caliber of them it seems like he stays up at night thinking of good insults to say to contestants. If that is so, I don't mind, because they still crack me up. On a more negative note, I watched the movie XXX(pronounced "ex-ex-ex", not "triple x" ) last night. I won't beat around the bush on this one, and I won't even waste my time to think of cool sounding adjectives to describe the suckiness of this movie. I will however, say this: it is really, really bad. The best way to explain this movie is to cut off your balls, nail them to a wall, and stare at them. The feeling of immense pain and the thoughts of "what the hell is going on here" that you experience will replicate exactly the feelings I felt while watching this movie. If you're a girl you could sit on a nail to get the same effect, and as the nail pierces through your buttcheek, you'll know what I mean. I know what you're thinking, and oh yes, it really is that bad. All this talk of various forms of entertainment and you think I would get bored of it, but nope, I just keep on goin. All of the previous things I mentioned are all in the past, and now i'm looking towards the future, a future that looks very promising(the near future anyways). I am so majorly pumped about a new movie that's coming out, you may have heard of it, it's called Darkness Falls. It looks like it's going to be one of the scariest movies in a long time. I saw a long trailer of it on XXX that got me so excited about it, before that I had no knowledge of it besides seeing short TV spots. If you are debating whether or not to go see it you should take my word for it and go, because everyone that I know that knows about it wants to see it really bad. The only two movies that I can think of that truly scared the crap out of me(I even had nightmares!)in this day and age are The Mothman Prophecies and The Blair Witch Project 2: Book of Shadows. Those are a couple of good movies, and I recommend them if you want to be scared; hopefully I can add Darkness Falls onto that list. I'll find out when I go to see it saturday afternoon with my girly girl Jesseca and her gang of munchkins. I can't wait. I am equally pumped about the Super Bowl. I have plenty of things left to say about it concerning pre-game analysis, but i'll spare you because I now know that none of that matters come game time. Both teams have a fair chance to win, the only thing that will determine who does is who comes to play and who wants it more. I will be rooting for the Raiders all the way, and i've been a closet fan of them for about 2 years now, I like the coach, I like the stadium/fans(nobody likes going to the black hole), and more than anything else, I like Jerry Rice. I want them to win so badly, because I hate all these fuckin Tampa Bay fans, all of them! When I see these bastards walking around school with TB hats on it makes me cringe. I love yelling "Raiders baby oohh yeahhh" in the manliest voice possible at them, it's great fun. Even more than the fans, I hate the team of Tampa Bay. Fuck Warren Sapp, he's a fat turd. Fuck Derrick Brooks, he's a tall skinny turd. Fuck John Lynch, he's a white turd. Fuck Keyshawn Johnson especially, he is the biggest turd of them all. That errogant faget, he has nothing to be arrogant about, he sucks big donkey dick. Pardon my french there, but damn they are gay. Nobody else on that team deserves any sort of recognition, even me calling them turds would be overdoing it, they are pure monkey doodoo. Now that i'm done ranting about Tampa Bay's trashlike nature, I am clear to make fun of other people: people who emphasize the T in TV, as oppose to the V. What is up with that? I think these people are just uncultured or something, everyone I have ever known has always said T V , not T V, but eh. I can't wig out on them as much as I would like to because they are normal in every way besides saying TV wrong, I just think it's kind of weird and had to bring it to the attention of all. The two people that i'm talking about in particular are Jesseca and Morgan, those are the only people i've ever heard say it that way, and it's crazy, but what are ya gonna do, it's not that big of a deal...I don't mean to sound like a weatherman here, but it is going to be cold as hell tommorow morning, and it's not going to get any better heading into the night-time hours and saturday morning. So everyone should be wearing warm clothes right? That is right, but there are always those couple idiots who go to school in shorts and a t-shirt and claim they're not cold. How in the world could you not be cold? Oh that's right(ha Jess), you're just lying about being not cold to seem cool, when in reality you're just sounding like a hardcore dumbass and you know you're freezing your ass off. I mean, i'm from Michigan, and I don't mind the cold as much as some other people. I even like it somewhat because it wakes me up and reminds me of my childhood, and as bad as it gets down here, I have always seen worse. Even so, I still have the sense to wear pants and a sweater(or a jacket would do fine, maybe better)when the temperature drops below 40 degrees. I hate people like that. The same thing goes with people who walk right by the fire alarm when it's going off and don't cover their ears or flinch at all...what the fuck is wrong with you people!? That shit is loud ! You ain't foolin nobody when you act like it doesn't hurt your ears, you're just damaging your hearing in the long run, and for that I laugh at you. No for real, I am laughing right now at the thought of these kooks. They're like robots man, what the hell. Ah man I feel very motivated right now, I want to do something extroardinary, I want to be challenged...Basically, I feel great. Admittedly, a lot of that comes from me taking a nap earlier, even though I only got about 2 hours of sleep at the most, it energized me to the max. The rest of it comes from the excitement that I have towards the upcoming weekend, after all it is thursday night, soon to be friday. Woohoo! All I have to do is get through school tommorow and I'm done for the week, sounds good to me. So i'm going to see Darkness Falls with Jesseca on saturday, which will be awesome whether the movie is good or bad, and hopefully i'll spend the remainder of the day with her. Sunday I have the biggest sporting event of all in store for me, the Super Bowl, that too should be phenomenal. The only thing I have to worry about is friday, I have nothing planned, so i'm hoping something unexpected and fun comes up, if not I might have to resort to using extreme prejudice and egging people's houses. In a more current time frame I am looking forward to taking a shower, doing my homework(most likely I will fall asleep before that happens, but I think I should make an attempt to do it and not be a slacker for once), and going to bed. I should probably study for my spanish test too, just for good measure, but I don't think that will be necessary because I am already confident that I will do well on it(not that you care)...There should be some sort of statistics tracker on this beast, that would be cool, because i'm always wondering how many words are in my posts, and which one of them is the longest, and stuff like that. Like this one, it pretty damn long, but thanks to these uninventful kooks I will never know exactly how long it is[you could go on to call me unresourceful for not using another program like Microsoft Word to figure this information out, but you would be mistaken, that can be attributed to my fine example of genuine laziness]. And damnit, I would like to know. Two more factoids for those who haven't fallen asleep yet: my parents are getting it on(I know because I hear them) and I, Bib Fortuna, am wigging out.

Goodie goodie, after minutes of deep contemplation I have finally nailed down the template that I am going to use(NOTE: It's right in front of your eyes, check it out). I dig the black backround and white writing and the psychadelic shiny ball [that kind of goes with the name], the orange is even cool. Nevertheless i'm gonna try to fiddle around with some stuff and maybe i'll be able to figure out how to do it on my own. Either that or I will mess up the interface beyond repair and cause every computer that trys to bring it up to crash. I'm not too worried about the latter though, because that would be cool. Also, if you check the time on some of my recent posts you will notice that I have been in 2nd block writing them, that includes this one. The bell just rang, so i'm outta here...Like the guy on my desktop always says "You're a homo."

Stop! Hammer Time! (insert moans and groans of backup singing black men here) You know what I think of all those flames that I used to have on this thing? I'VE HAD ENOUGH!!!! Flip Mode is the greatest!(that's not to say that this trashy template is final, because it assuredly is not) Also, I have been reading lots and lots of interesting blogger names that make mine look miniscule and dull in comparison, so that too, I switched on them. Word yo. Lastly, things on this journal have been taking on more of a serious tone as of late, and I think to continue writing that way would be taking a turn for the worst. So I will end this now and start employing a more fresh, comedic approach to things. So bring on the craziness!

I look at all the lovely people! The Beatles are such a great band dude, and they are more popular than Jesus Christ(quoteth the late but great John Lennon), so eat that one. Today I was totally uninterested in school, so I didn't even make an attempt to do my work, I just went to sleep. That lack of motivation carried over whenever I got home too, I was walking around in a daze forever. Until Jesseca called that is, because I laughed forever on the phone with her and it woke me up. Here's the dialogue of the thing that got me...she was like "Oh I hope Hunter is ok" and I said "Who is Hunter?" and she's like "Oh he's just some kid from my work that went to the hospital yesterday" and i'm like "oh I see...I have a kid named Hunter in my butt." There was a slight pause, then she goes "What are you in fifth grade", and I laughed for a long time. It was really funny at the time, and I'm still chuckling to myself, you probably had to hear it though. A little later we got off the phone because her mom had to use it, and we just didn't call eachother back, haha...kinda crazy but that's what happened. The rest of the night, up until about a half an hour ago I've been playing Shenmue II. I just started today so I was takin care of business and trying to get a good chunk of the game complete. I think I succeeded in that respect, I played for around 8 hours(I don't know for sure how long, probably more than that), and I moved swiftly the entire time. My goal to beat it is Thursday, so my weekend doesn't get clogged up with these nonsense video games. Why do I have a feeling that somewhere there is a little twelve year old kook reading this saying, "You're nonsense!!!" ? I have a very important assignment for all of you nimrods out there who are reading this: Picture yourself in a boat on a river, with tangerine trees and marmalade skies. Somebody calls you, you answer quite slowly, a girl with kaleidoscope eyyyyyes. Cellaphane flowers of yellow and green, towering over your heeeeead. Look for the girl with the sun in her eyes and she's gone. *LUCY IN THE SKYYY WITH DIIIAMONDS*... *LUCY IN THE SKYYY WITH DIIIAMONDS*...*LUCY IN THE SKYYY WITH DIIIAMONDS!*

Hahaha! I'm in 2nd block Computer Programming Class! Mrs. Parlade is wiggin out, tellin me to do a bunch of work...FUCK THAT SHIT! Lunch is in a few minutes, and I forgot my ID, so I have nothing better to do than hang out with Mr. Hillman in ISS. Oh well, at least I have some homework I can do. In addition, I am the lonely swedish and my bum is all alone.
