Moreover, there is a bucktoothed mongolian ass-slapper(a dorky bitch with big teeth, a small head, and a crazy hat) eyeballing me, so I'm fickin to ride out. One last snippet for you bosshog worshippers: Chongissimo is[undoubtedly] the plural of Chongy.

*Start Gangsta Rap Beat* It's not the East or the West side. (No it's not) It's not the North or the South side. (No it's not) It's the Dark Side. (You are correct) You can't front on the Empire, to all you Vader haters out there: We'll blow your planet up. *Imperial March kicks in, in addition to Gangsta Rap Beat* What is thy bidding thy masta? It's a disasta, Skywalker we're after. What if he could be turned to the Dark Side? Yes! He would be a powerful ally, another dark Jedi. He will join us or die! We got Death Star, We got Dark Star...(Repeat x5) That was just a little bit of Star Wars flava to kick things off for all you seventies dorks out there. I've been putting this journal off for long enough, so I guess I have to finally write in this biotch... Well, it's Nigger Day(quote my uncle Gino) today, so you know what that means... no school. That didn't work out to my favor very much today, it was a pretty hellacious day. I mean, the weather was nice and everything, but eh, I fuckin ruined it. I woke up expecting nothing to happen, I thought it was just gonna be one of those lazy sit around the house days, but it turned out even worse(not that those are so bad). Chris and Alan came over fairly early, right after I woke up, at around 12 or so. I wouldn't care about that normally... but not too much later Jesseca calls and is like "i'm gonna come pick you up alright" and I was all surprised so I was like "whaaat?" and she's like "we're gonna go to the park with my sister"...or something like that, I dunno. Well being the idiot that I am I say no, because I had just made plans to go to Hurst and play basketball with the friends, and I had already got dressed and stuff(it seemed pretty sensible at the time). So I get to Hurst and shoot around for about ten minutes when I realized I had just made the stupidest decision ever. What the fuck was I thinking man? Basketball is not even that cool (and we didn't even play it really), what did I think this was "bros before hos" or something? I wanna know who originated that saying so I can go to his house and kick him in the fucking head, seriously. That is one of the most queerlike remarks a person could possibly think of... BUT, I won't let it phase me because yesterday I had an awesome time, and enough fun for two days. So I think I'm gonna kick this shit in reverse chronological order, since variety is the spice of life. I don't know how to begin, perhaps by mentioning that Mike's mom claimed that somebody was "the salt of the earth", hahaha that's classic. Currently, my sister(the one who is 21 years of age) is running around the house in a rage, getting ready to kick some little kid's asses. You see, a bunch of little kids who are in some way or the other associated with my little sister(11) and her boyfriend(12), have been calling my house and leaving obscene messages on my answering machine and saying bastardly things to me and the rest of my family. So she's gonna go over there and kick their asses. She's gone now so i'll update you on the situation later. I also learned that Jesseca spent the day driving around with a couple of boys that were new to the neighborhood, so she had to show them around. She said they were kooks, so that sucks for her, and it confirms that we both had trashy days without eachother. That pretty much does it for today, because I already told my story about the great Hurst/ Jesseca fiasco. Sunday...what a glorious day. I had so much fun on Sunday, it was awesome. First Jesseca, her mom, her dad, her sister, and I went to see the movie Kangaroo Jack. I must say that it was quite(lol Jess) good, despite what you may hear about it. Then we went to J-Dawgs house to watch the football game. Tampa Bay won it unfortunately, but hey, they deserved it. Now they only have one challenge left before I can accept them as being a good team...The Oakland Raiders! Have fun defending against the number one offense in the league, which consists of Rich Gannon(league MVP), Tim Brown(the seasoned vet), Charlie Garner(the young pimp), and Jerry motherfuckin Rice(i'll give you a cookie if you can name one receiving record he doesnt own), who just happens to be the best receiver ever. It should be a good Super Bowl though, #1 defense Vs #1 offense. Back on subject, I had tons of fun at Jesseca's house, I love her so much... I won't dwell on this, but I have been officially challenged. So thanks for the motivation, now Kingdom Hearts will be beaten in about 2 seconds flat. On saturday nothing happened really, just some basketball games that I lost, but I take no responsibility for that, it wasn't my fault. Friday was a cool day though, some funny stuff happened at school...I got to school late, and as a result I got yet another lunch detention, but it was cool because I was treated to a hilarious sight. This girl was running to class full speed because the bell was about to ring, and she had high heels on, I was looking at her thinking "yeah she's gonna fall...". So I tells her this, I says "uhh you should slow down, you're not gonna make it anyways". But the bitch ignores me and keeps on runnin. Sure enough, a few seconds later she tripped on the sidewalk and landed right on her face. It was kind of crazy at first because her face was bleeding and stuff, but then I just started laughing at her, while everyone else was all concerned, haha. It was almost as funny as when Amber Ashton tripped over the big black pillow in my room.... Nothing cool happened in class until fourth block, when Chris and I were partners for this project in math that involved lots of M&M eating and a slinky, and even that wasn't outrageously cool. It wasn't until after school ended that the real fun began. Me and Chris were walking down the walkway over by the portables after leaving fourth block, and we were all happy about the three day weekend, so we were horseplaying and whatnot. So we come up by Jenna Webb and I decide to throw a balled up piece of paper at her friend. I threw it around Chris's back and it hit her right in the head(this was Jenna's friend mind you), afterwards we were both laughing histerically and we still had the task of walking by them at hand so I quickly pointed the finger at Chris. At this point Chris was like "man you're gonna get our asses kicked". A couple seconds later Matt Tower (Jenna's boyfriend, the resident "badass", and the man some people say I look like) comes up to Chris and says "Did you just throw a piece of paper at my girlfriend" and I was like "uh that was me, and it didn't even come close to your girlfriend, bitch". He's like "fuck you man, go apologize to her", like a pimp, I respond with "apologize for THIS!" and gave him a quick elbow to the chin, followed up by a swift knee to the chest and a powerful right handed blast to the face, sending him to the ground crying in a heap. But I wasn't done with him yet, I jumped on top of him and beat him within an inch of his life with my hard-as-steel fists, all while Chris gave him repeated kicks to the groin. When I was done I made him get up onto his knees and beg for mercy, and he didn't hesitate to kiss Chris's shoe and lick the dirt off the bottom of my boot. When we were done humiliating him in front of his girlfriend, and the entire school, I told him whats up. I says "apologize for that, bitch!" and we walked away while the wolfpack theme music played in the backround....Needless to say, that didn't happen, but everyone already knew the story so I had to spice it up. And now, my friends, I am really in for an ass kicking, lol. Which reminds me of the wrestling match that we had at school on Wednesday. It was one of the most blatant displays of homosexuality I've ever seen, but besides that I enjoyed it more than I thought I would. TP slammed some little moogle into the mat like a dominator, some retard on the other team slipped on a sponge type object and got laughed at by the whole crowd, and a bunch of kooks got their nuts grabbed and their asses humped, those were the funniest things that occured. We did lose though, since we forfeited twice because we didn't have people to match their weight classes, that's how it goes I guess. It was still funny, especially when it was Stuarts turn and he got the smack down layed on him by a Deland turd. I even heard a story about him pulling a knife on his girlfriend when she told him she cheated on him, and I laughed because he's gay, and what does he care. Russel Dukes himself even wrestled, too bad he got whooped by some fatty...There was one more thing that happened on friday that's worth mentioning. As we waited for my mom to pick us up, me, Chris, Louie, and Zac were playing with a slinky. By that time the slinky had already been broken up into several little pieces so we each one. All of the sudden, out of nowhere, Louie is like "check this out guys!" and runs up to this kid Gibby and fuckin whips him in the face with the slinky. There is a slight delay in time where there is nothing but silence, then Gibby pounces on Louie, puts him in a headlock and yells crazy incomprehensible stuff into his ear. Louie then gets mad, breaks free and proceeds to hardcore insult Gibby. He called him a big headed fucker(which he is), and made fun of his richie rich, think he is better than anyone attitude(which he deserved, even though Louie did whip him in the face for no reason). In any case, it was funny as all hell. Ah well I'm not really done, but my sister is telling me to get out of her room because she is trying to sleep, so I will finish quickly. An update for all you Cambodian asslickers who still care: my sister couldn't find the kids house, so in her words "it must be his lucky day." I'm gonna go watch Blue Crush now, it's probably gonna suck but meh...and for your information, i'm aware that the quality of my journal has been on the decline as of late, and i'm not too happy about it. But I dont think I can help it...my writing skills as a whole have been declining as well. So you'll just have to deal with it!

I started my day off on the wrong foot when I woke up late this morning, as usual. At least I had a good reason today, but i'll get to that later. When I arrived at school I had to get me a tardy pass before I could go to class, and the line was long as ever, its amazing how many people get to school late everyday, kids these days... It was my third time being late this nine weeks and second time in two days, and it's only the beginning of the semester. Luckily all I got was "the tardy talk"... and lunch detention tommorow. The guy sounded pretty serious about us showing up too, he sounded like he would kill us or something if we didn't. And for those of you who don't know Mr/Coach Hillman, he's a rather intimidating guy, like one of those body builder types who can crush coconuts with their bare hands. So being the badass that I am I'm just gonna skip lunch detention as a direct challenge to his authority and power. Now that I'm done talking about being late for a half hour I should probably tell what happened at school when I was actually in my classes; but we all know that's no fun, so I'll save that for a more boring day. Today however, was far from boring. Why you ask? Because I BEAT SPLINTER CELL TODAY!!! (well it was around 3 in the morning but that still counts as today, and the excitement from it remains even to this hour, so why not claim it was today) That is such an awesome game. The graphics are better than any game before it and the gameplay is unlike anything i've experienced and truly lives up to its title of Stealth Combat Redefined. The action is intense, the sound flows perfectly and does its job well. The situations the game puts you in will make you bite your nails with nervous tension and can sometimes be downright scary(scary in a surprising kind of way). Another thing that made this game so cool was that it kept you thinking about it even when you weren't playing it. I often found myself at school looking up into the ceiling of the walkway and bathrooms for pipes that I could climb on and secret entrances into buildings. Few games can do that to you, off the top of my head Tetris and Shenmue are the only ones that can make you feel like that. All these things are great but the thing that stuck out the most about this game was the challenge and difficulty level. I won't lie, it was hard, and that's a rare thing for me to say about a game. In fact i'm having second thoughts about saying it right now, i'm questioning how hard it really was, and i've decided that it was difficult enough to at least warrant me saying it was "hard". There were four or five times in the game where I was stuck at one checkpoint for hours at a time, and it was frustrating, but I know this: I certainly wouldn't have enjoyed it as much as I did if it was easy. As much cussing at the TV screen, beating up my pillows with my bat, and other frustration evoked behavior as there was, when I finally did beat the game it was all worth it because I felt a feeling of accomplishment I rarely feel in real life. The sad thing is a lot of people have never felt this great feeling, and they never will until they complete an awesome videogame like Splinter Cell, which for most people will not happen. Nonetheless this is what playing video games is all about my friends. In case you haven't figured it out yet, this is the reason I was late for school today, I was up really late beating Splinter Cell. It was funny near the end of the game too, because I wasn't supposed to kill the main enemy/ terrorist guy, not before I used his eyes for the retinal scanner anyways. So I had him in a chokehold and I accidentally hit R and punched him in the back of the head (in effect killing him) and the colonel guy who commands you during the mission goes "What are you doing!?!?" and Sam (the hero) says "I killed Kombayne Nikoladze" in a crazy voice, like it was some sort of joke. Oh man it may not sound so funny put into words but that cracked me up so much. It literally made me laugh out loud, which is crazy because there I was sitting in my room alone at 3 in the morning just laughing. Then later on when the credits rolled it played that song Calling All Freaks (now that is good development right there), how brilliant of them. Because if there was anything I wanted to do at that time it was dance, and dance I did for about 10 minutes straight. When it was all said and done I decided that Splinter Cell was right up there with Halo: Combat Evolved(oh god it's funny writing out the complete subtitles of things), and tied for best game on X-Box. That is saying a lot since Halo is a virtual tour de force of non-stop heart pounding, adrenaline pumping(i'm fuckin wigging out actually) action, not to mention a modern masterpiece. Daaaamn I talk about crazy shit forever, lol. Oh my god there is massive amounts of snot coming out of my nose!...I'm your typical snot nosed punk. Ah yes, speaking of punks, Simple Plan sucks. I listened to every one of their songs and they suck, except for the two singles they have out now. Those are the only songs that don't suffer from the monotonous bashing of drums and cymbals, un-melodic playing of untuned guitars, while the pre-pubescent lead singer ruins good lyrics with his stunning lack of emotion and feeling as well as with his over punkish, annoying voice...Wow that was some pretty hardcore bashing, I think I insulted them so much because they dissapointed me. I wanted them to be as good as some other emo bands that I like, and they had so much potential...oh well, maybe their next album will be better. Taking Back Sunday on the other hand, is awesome. If you do happen to take my word for it and listen to them be aware that it will probably sound weird at first, and that I didn't like them at all at first. The more I listened to them, the more I liked them, so just let it be known that they are definitely an aquired taste. I only have one more thing to complain about before I end this madness. I've been reading a lot of other people's journals lately and I have seen a lot of stuff that I don't like. Grammar mistakes, word over usage, misspelled stuff galore, short posts, song lyrics, and long ass surveys are all things that i'm not too fond of, but all except for the latter I am guilty of myself at one time or another, so they don't bother me too much. But there is one thing that I cannot tolerate: people who write "I having nothing to say/write" in their journals. That is the stupidest thing I have ever heard, isn't that what journals are for? I could freak out so much more about this, but i've already wasted more than enough of my time on the computer today when I should be doing something more productive. So I only have one question to ask these people: If you have nothing to write, THEN WHAT THE FUCK ARE YOU WRITING FOR? Is it not clear to these people that when you have nothing to write you can simply not write anything and save people the time of reading through your horrible post that came into being as a result of you not having anything interesting to say so you just wrote a shitload of mindless jabber off the top of your head? If you comprehended that last sentence and can answer it correctly then you are on your own because I, the one who wrote it, can't even fully understand it, I keep getting lost right near the end... Well kids that's it for today, check back next time for some more inspiring and entertaining psychobabble with the everlasting enigma that is the Davemyster. That was a pretty long one there wasn't it Uncle Ronnie? " That's Right ". Ok...that was gay. I'll leave you with something even more homosexual: an old school yo mama joke. Yo mama's so big, fat and clumsy, when she tried to get to Wal*Mart she stumbled over K-Mart and landed on Target.

At the moment I should probably be bitching and complaining, seeing as my favorite football team, the San Fransisco 49ers just got the defensive beatdown of their lives, dominated by the recievers of Tampa Bay, and sent home for the season. I am also being tormented emotionally by the fact that my girlfriend said I could come over this weekend and then later said I couldn't, for whatever reason this happened not once, but twice. Instead of being a pussy and sitting around and doing nothing about it i'm gonna take the loss like a man. I'm gonna transform all that anger (and there is plenty of it), and change it into positive, kick-ass energy, into motivation as I take out everyone in Splinter Cell. That's what i'm hoping for anyway...but in my extensive videogame experience rage has never gone a long way and is usually associated with frustration. Since i'm literally shaking with anger (I have no idea why i'm so mad now that I think about it), i'll most likely end up bashing my stereo with my baseball bat, i've been waiting for a good time to do that anyways. I think I just need to chill out though. It would be a great time to talk about my crazy ass weekend, which was full of exciting events, so that I will do. My weekend actually started on Thursday this week because that was the day that Jesseca, Louie, Amber, Kim, and I were to hang out. It was pretty cool, we went to Mainland to do some extra credit stuff that Jesseca and Amber had to do but we ended up making fun of some kook named Winkleman, being told by some girl that she knew us when she didn't, and meeting this black kid who later called me "hard"(hey it's better than being called soft). The next night (Friday) we went to Regal to see the movie Just Married. The movie was pretty funny and we otherwise just had a good old time, i'll leave out the details. Saturday was one of the crazier days i've had in my life. Originally I was supposed to spend the day at Jesseca's house, leaving Louie at my house to do whatever he wanted, but when I found out she was mad at me (the reason I would rather not mention since it doesn't matter anymore) I was forced to stay at my house all day. What happened after that I didn't have much control over. As I sat in my room playing Splinter Cell my friends all sat around and discussed various plans for the day, eventually deciding that they wanted to get drunk and wig out. Before I knew it Chris and Zac were running around in a drunken daze while Alan(who was drunk himself but had himself under control and was acting more mature than anyone) and Chasity were trying to keep them under control. Me, Louie, and Mike were sober but we were just watching to see what kind of madness ensued. At one point in the histeria everyone ended up in the front yard because Chris and Zac were going to box. Zac gave Chris a hardcore beatdown, but it didn't matter because Chris didn't even know he was being punched or even that the match had started or what in the hell was going on, I bet if you asked Chris his name at that time he wouldn't know it. After that Chris and Alan "boxed", but the boxing match merely consisted of Alan, with one glove on, punching Chris in the face once (not even very hard) and Chris flying really far into the ground in an odd manner. After that it was clear to me that Chris had too much to drink, as if that couldn't have already been detected by his nonstop maniacal laughter throughout his boxing match with Zac, even while he was getting the shit beat out of him. So there were more attempts for people to box Chris, but it was apparent that they were just trying to take advantage of him in his drunken state, which to me was very cowardly. Once everyone calmed down again I went on the computer for a while to get away from the insanity that was going on. I stayed there until Alan and Louie informed me that Zac and Chris were crying, I didn't know why the hell they were crying but I had to see it. I waited a while, but when I went in there I saw Chris crying and it was crazy, I never actually saw Zac crying but I don't know why they would lie. Finally at around 4 Chris and Zac fell asleep(but not before puking all over my room), Mike and Louie went home, and Alan went to James's house. It was calm for a few hours while I watched the football game, then at 8 the kooks woke up and it was funny because Chris didn't remember doing anything, not boxing, not nothing. Soon after I started feeling really tired and fell asleep. During that time Chris and Alan left, leaving Zac as the sole survivor at my house. That brings me to today...Zac left early and I was glad because I was sick of having all those people at my house. At 1 I watched the 49ers game as the phone rang off the hook and I ignored it, getting incrementally madder as the 49ers fell further and further behind. I was extremely pissed off by the end of the game, and I stayed pissed off until very recently, as recent as the beginning of this post when I started writing. I cooled off fairly fast though, and I owe that to my beautiful girlfriend Jesseca, I love you baby. I also found solace in the hope that Philadelphia will crush the Bucs next week and exact revenge for my 49ers loss. So you Tampa Bay Fucks better come to play because you're gonna be facing big McNabb, the Nest of Death, the team that knocked you out of the playoffs two years in a row, and the biggest obstacle, 26 degree weather. So I'm much happier now than I was when I started writing this journal, and that is cool. The only thing that sucks now is I have a bunch of homework to do, but then again I probably won't do it. So hopefully I will get past this difficult part in Splinter Cell that i'm currently stuck at, but that's probably not gonna happen either. In any case I had a good week at school and I hope to duplicate that sucess this week when I head back there (I hate to admit that I have to go to school, but it is inevitable), starting tommorow. Later on cheeky boys and girls, I'm out.

I went to the doctor today, apparently they found traces of protein in my urine. Oh man, that's too bad. It might be worse if I actually knew what that is supposed to mean, and how it's affects me...I dunno, they explained it to me but I still don't understand. Something about my liver and kidneys, seems like no big deal to me. Even if it is, I don't give a damn because I feel just fine. Anyways, school started yesterday, which makes today the second day of school...and it's already over! Hell yeah, 2 down, and umm a lot to go. I got off to one hell of a start. I didn't sleep on Sunday (as in zero hours) so my first day back to school i'm walkin around in an extreme daze of exhaustion. I was stumbling around losing my footing and shit. At some point I even thought I was going blind because my eyesight kept getting blurry for extended periods of time, but no such luck, that's what you get when you deprive yourself of sleep I guess. Now that school's back in full swing it's prime time for me to discuss the current situation with my classes and teachers. Don't panic though, I'll make it short. It goes like this: Same shit, Different year. Onto something more important, like football. You heard it here first: (well probably not, I just wanted to say that) the Miami Hurricanes were cheated out of the title . That was bullshit, they definitely need to employ a replay system in college football like the one they have in the NFL, maybe then undeserving faggets like the Fuckeyes will be prevented from getting cheat victories. That pissed me off, especially since it was the Championship, that was ridiculous. I forgot about that pretty quickly though, due to the victories of the Michigan WOLVERINES, Atlanta Falcons(oh my god, what a surprise... ATL HO, ATL HO), and my San Fran 49ers. Which leads me to my next subject, the wonderful 49ers/ Giants game. It was one of the most exciting and tension filled football games i've ever witnessed, not to mention the second biggest comeback in playoff history. It was a tough one for my Niners, but in the end it came down to Jeff Garcia and Terrell Owens showin all those motherfuckers how it's done. Even if they lose and go home empty handed next week(a good possibility considering they're playing Tampa Bay), I'll be happy with that one game, it was that good. Alright my freaks, that's about it. I'm still too tired to think of anything else, but I know i'm forgetting something. Oh yeah, my sister just got back from England. She told me all about it, she has some funny ass stories dudes, and now because of her i'll always think of England as one messed up place. I will end this with a brilliant joke brought to you by Jesseca's dad: *he lets out a rip-roarin fart*, "Oh my god, did you hear what that asshole just said?"

My mood has skyrocketed from my last post, which was only 40 minutes ago, but it was still a different day. I have that song "I'm With You" by Avril Lavigne stuck in my head, it's such a great song, I love it. I've listened to it about 5 times in a row now. There's nobody online this late, well there's a lot of people on, but they're just the usual suspects, no real standouts here my friends. I would actually like to talk to Shannon right now, that would be pretty interesting. I have a few things to say, and she's on, but there's the whole fued thing going on between us. I don't even know what the hell that is all about, I just remember that I told myself that I don't like her, but I don't remember why. I should probably just give it up and talk to her, but I'm too stubborn to do that. Oh well, maybe someday... All of that was improvised, and it veered me away from my original plan to post this thing that I read that cracked me up. But never fear, Dave Man is here, and he has brought you the humorous material. So without further adeui(what a weird fuckin word), I present it: my mom: hey erin... me: yea my mom: how do u catch a unique rabbit? me:uh..i dunno. my mom: UNIQUE up on it. me: you're funny. my mom: hey erin.... me: yes dear... my mom: how do you catch a tame rabbit? me: uh..i dunno.... my mom: tame way, unique up on it... me: you are outta control. my mom: hey erin.... me: unique up on it.... my mom: uh, no. what does a fish say when it hits a cement wall? me: i dunno.... my mom: dam. me: you're funny mommy. Wahahahahahahahaha!!! That is comedy! I got that off this chick's journal/ webcam thingy. Oh man she is outta control, lol. So funny...

I didn't do anything useful today. I woke up at 3, called Jesseca, she said she would call me back. So I fooled around for about an hour until she called. Then I got mad when she said I couldn't come over, clammed up, and got off the phone shortly after. I layed down on my bed for a couple hours deciding whether or not to bash my cd player and cd holder with my new bat. Ultimately I decided I would save that for a time when I had a better reason. I got online at like 6 (I think) and I thought I had cooled off, but I ended up wiggin out and having to get off before I started bitching at Jesseca, something I didn't want to do because I would only do it out of anger. I tried to think of something to do that would cheer me up but I ended up just sitting and thinking about it for like an hour. Then a movie came on Lifetime (it just happened to be on that channel), so naturally I watched it. It seemed dumb at first, but then it got really good, and then it winded back down again to the ending, which sucked. Oh well though, that took my mind off of things for a couple hours. I went in my room and passed out after that. I woke up at 11 something facing the wrong way with my head aching, wishing I would have slept through to the morning. But no such luck, because here I am, wide awake on the computer typing this journal. My day was far from perfect, but it's almost over now so that's good, things can only get better whenever they're this bad. I just hope I didn't piss Jesseca off too much, because I was never mad at her, but I may have made it seem like I was, and that's what I'm worried about...For now I'm just gonna try and burn a couple CDs so my day wasn't completely unproductive, and I should probably get to sleep fairly early(I'm shootin for 3am) so I don't wake up extremely late again. So that's my day, it was pretty gay, but hey, I coulda been shovelin hay.

When the moon hits your eye like a big pizza pie, That's Amore . When the world seems to shine like you've had too much wine, That's Amore . When the stars make you drool just like pasta fazul, That's Amore .When you dance down the street with a cloud at your feet you're in love. When you walk in a dream but you know you're not dreamin senore, back in old Napoli, That's Amore . It's the last day I will ever see in February of the year 2003, it is an event to be celebrated! For the grand finale I am gonna do something spectacular, something amazing, something unbelievable, and something you will never expect... I'm gonna go to sleep , yipee.

Oh my god, did you hear that Mr. Rogers died? That sucks! He was awesome, I watched that show all the time. But if you think about it it's not that big of a surprise, considering the guy was already like 86 years old when I was in kindergarten... Rest In Peace Mr. Rogers, and have fun singing "Won't you be my neighbor"... IN HELL! In other news, I have managed to write in my blog every day of this week. This marks the first time I have ever accomplished such a feat. It wasn't that big of a thing though since they were mostly short ones, but still, it's kind of cool. I just got my grade print-out for Business Computer Programming 1(coincidentally the class that i'm in right now) and it turns out that I have a whopping 34 missing assignments a.k.a. thirty four zeros. There must be some sort of mistake! I'm gonna go complain to her right this instant!
King Kong has a rubber ding dong.

You see, I have this little problem... I recieved a note a little while ago from the administration of Seabreeze High School telling me to go to the office for - well i'll just type up what the note actually says since it's a formal type thing anyway. Here's a transcript of the message: Your presence is requested for registration for the 2003/2004 school year. Please come prepared at the time specified above to the guidance office. Remember to bring your Program of Studies with your chosen electives . There are a multitude of problems with this request... 1) The time I was supposed to come is 10:15 and it is now 10:16 and counting. 2) I don't know where the guidance office is. 3) It specifically says to come prepared and prepared I definitely am not. 4) I don't have my Program of Studies with me, and even if I did, it is littered with obscene and profane drawings and other random forms of graffiti. 5) I have not chosen my electives, and I have no idea what ones I want to take. 6) I don't know what the hell they are talking about. So i'm not going anywhere.

Don't you think it's about time for an extremely long journal like entry to this beast? I do, it's been long enough. The question is - when will it come, tomorrow perhaps? Only time will tell. Until then I will be in my room meditating while listening to We Thuggin (Weezer).

What's this? We have work to do? Ah man for a while there I thought it was a free day. Wait a minute, I don't do my work anyway... There was another crazy note exchange between myself and Louis Garafolo today. I currently have the note in my possession, so I'm gonna take a page out of the "Fro Cat" book and put it on here for all to read. Now watch as Louie does the same thing and makes us both look bad for posting the same thing: Louie wrote this: Dear David, On this day (May(5) 9th, 2020) [5/9/20], I bequief my Justin, my John ligament, and a foot... to you. I hope you decide to take action (wack-off) to forego my actions. If you have a problem with this, call my dad "Daner" and Justin will recede from Gettysburg. Yours Truleyly (Fro brisketssss is the pronunciation) Arnold B. Funkified P.s. I wrote it in "English" this time Alek Parker I wrote the following back to the bastard: My Dearest Dink, Send my regards to Daina Beninati (Daner's sister). I accept the queif and in return I will bequeath my nigger upon you. Your mom still owes me ten dollars from last night [because I am a male hooker], so be sure to tell her. Lastly, unleash hell onto your inner nipple. With pee in a bag, Mr. Pink P.S. "The shit has officially hit the fan" - Quoteth Paul Orndorff Pretty funny stuff huh? Well maybe not considering there are a lot of inside jokes, and some craziness that nobody can or should understand besides us... Nevertheless my new favorite band is Queer As Folk . (Yes that is a band, and no they are not my favorite)

I have joined the Habitat for Humanity club, it's awesome. I started hanging out with those guys only yesterday and I have learned so much already that it blows my mind! Habitat for Humanity rocks! They have influenced me in a positive way and now I want to get my life back on track. I'm gonna start going to church every Sunday and Wednesday to pay back my debts to the lord. I have even decided to dedicate myself to abstinence, and I am not going to have sex until i'm married. I also refuse to use curse words or masturbate from here on out because they are sins and I will go to hell for doing them. Don't try to sway me on any of these things, I have already made up my mind and you won't be able to change that. I just read Louie's blog. Nothing new, but it's funny/ crazy enough to read again. I like the direction he's taking with it, some crazy ass shit. I dig. I've got the 'use hoody to hide the fact that i'm wearing headphones' thing goin on, it works quite well. It's funny as hell because I have to turn a full 180 degrees to see behind me(due to the hoody blocking my peripheral vision). So i'm spinning around in my chair every two seconds to see if the teacher is coming. I'm scared she's gonna wig out on me for not doing my work. If that happened I would be so screwed, not to mention confused. I don't know what the hell is going on right now because all i've been doin is listenin to da music. I'm kind of dissapointed that I forgot my cd case at home because it had some more cds that I could listen to. As it is i'm stuck listening to Sublime all day. That's not so bad though, because Sublime rocks the shit out of Justin on a cold Sunday afternoon. This listening to music during school has got to be the coolest thing ever done. You can ignore your teachers and have fun at the same time. It has replaced sleep as the #1 in school time waster. I don't know about anybody else, but I liked it . Lovin is what I got Lovin, is what I got Lovin, is what I got, I said remember that Before I go I must admit that the stuff in the first paragraph of this post is pure bullshit (as if it weren't obvious). I don't even know what the hell Habitat for Humanity is. I think Chris said something about joining it and I thought it had a funny name. But anyways, the whole thing was an attempt to be funny. I'm guessin it didn't work. I'll tell you what though, this kid that sits two seats down from me looks exactly like Jesseca's dad. My question is, why isn't he farting and asking me "Did you hear what that asshole just said?"

I wish I wrote this song, because it describes my situation perfectly right now. Well almost perfectly. The only problem is I don't smoke and my mom doesn't tell me to do anything. Besides that, I can relate. Sit around and watch the tube, but nothing's on. Change the channels for an hour or two. Twiddle my thumbs just for a bit, I'm sick of all the same old shit. In a house with unlocked doors, and I'm fucking lazy... Bite my lip and close my eyes, take me away to paradise. I'm so damn bored I'm going blind, and I smell like shit... Peel me off this velcro seat and get me moving, I sure as hell can't do it by myself. I'm feeling like a dog in heat, barred indoors from the summer street. I locked the door to my own cell, and I lost the key... I got no motivation. Where is my motivation? No time for motivation. Smoking my inspiration. Sit around and watch the phone, but no one's calling. Call me pathetic, call me what you will. My mother says to get a job, but she don't like the one SHE'S got. When masturbation's lost its fun you're fucking breaking... Bite my lip and close my eyes, take me away to paradise. I'm so damn BORED i'm going blind, and loneliness has to suffice. Bite my lip and close my eyes, slipping away to Paradise. Some say, "Quit or I'll go blind", but It's just a myth... -Green Day: Long View

Chris and I went to some crazy party in New Symrna last night. I don't really know what to say about it, besides that it was the craziest night of my life. I have also came to the conclusion that Jesseca is the best kisser in the world, hands down . I am not even exaggerating here, she amazes me every time. I love it, and I love her.

I was gonna write a really long post yesterday, but then I fell asleep... Don't feel bad though, I didn't do my homework either. Today is Friday and I am happier than Steven Seagal in the kitchen of a cruise ship. I have a couple options of things to do tonight, and that's the way I like it. I'm not sure what i'm going to do at the moment, but I do know that I have a boner right now . I don't have one for any specific reason, it's just one of those times. This sort of thing happens a lot. I once heard a guy say "I get a hard-on when the wind blows." I feel sorry for that guy.

If all else fails write Fro Briskets 5, 7, 8, 9, 20 times on a log of shit. Louie just gave me some crazy note during the tornado drill. It was written in cursive, and I can't read that form of writing (as far as i'm concerned it isn't English), so i'm not sure what the note said. The only thing I could decipher was the last line, and what you see above this paragraph is what it said. Judging by the contents of this line I can guess that the whole thing was crazy as fuck and most likely funny as hell. It's ok though, I cracked up when I first read that. The log of shit part gets me everytime. Yeah, so I walked home from school yesterday. During lunch I asked if anyone if they could give me a ride and they all said no so I was like "alright i'm leavin" and left. It was actually kind of hard to get off campus since they have that gate closed in the front now, but I just went out the back towards The Olive Garden and all that. It was a pretty long walk and I only got lost once, so it was cool. I actually had fun while walking home. I kept finding quarters and dimes in the road, messing around with dogs that barked at me (there must have been like 500 of em near beachside), and sneaking past people who were mowing/ watering their lawns. Whenever I got to the bridge I was like "oh yeaaaa" because the river looked really nice to my eyes for some reason, maybe I was sick of seeing all those bastard dogs and crazy houses. I sat down at that park under the bridge for a little while and overheard some girls talking about Joe Millionaire, that show by the way didn't surprise me because I already guessed the ending. Checking out the river I realized I could easily swim across it, so one of these days i'm gonna have to do that on film. After that I went over the bridge and picked up the pace from that point on. Don't ever let anyone tell ya that walking the Granada bridge is hard, because I did it without even breathing hard, with a backpack on. While I was going up, some crazy Jamaican nigger with dreds came flying past me on a bike. I gave him the nod and he nodded back, but he looked all scared and I laughed forever. The other side of the bridge didn't seem as far as the previous, although in reality it was probably farther. Not paying attention to much, just thinking about random stuff, I got home pretty quickly. Before I knew it I was home and I explained the situation to everyone, and they didn't really care, so it was sweet, and I am smooth. Now, who are these motherfuckers that keep messing with Jesseca and asking for her number and all that kind of shit. I heard they touch her and hit her and flirt with her and basically act like idiots. Who are these kooks and what is their problem? Do they not know how to treat girls or are they just a bunch of fagets? Nobody I know ever touches girls or anything like that, because I don't hang out with assholes. I probably can't say that because there are exceptions, like Dan. Most of the time though, that is a very niggerish thing to do, the only people I see touching or hitting girls is black trash. So I conclude that anyone who does this is a nigger, plain and simple. I might even be able to see this if she was single, but she's not, obviously. So I have one thing to say to these queers: GET YOUR OWN...SUCKAAAAAAAAAA. I know they wouldn't try any of this crap if I was around either, so why do they do it when i'm not? Because they're pussies, and if they ever try anything around me, I don't care how many of them there are, they will die. I'm probably making it sound like I care way more than I really do. It doesn't even bother me much at all, because I know they are a bunch of fags. Oh man these kids are arguing over the funniness of the chinese rap in CKY and its crackin me up. The conversation is going like this That shit aint funny and hes like You must be thinking of something else, because this shit is funny as fuckin shit dawg. He talks about slapping you in your shit with his little ass dick, now tell me that isnt funny That sounds gay to me dawg No way motherfucker, its funny as fuck that CKY is, he talks about soy sauce and rice and shit whoooooooooooo these kids are too much for me. It's already Wednesday but this week still seems like it's going to take forever to end. That's fine, but no more school for me please . In the meantime somebody should really buy me the Labrynth DVD. I've wanted it so bad for a long time, but I just haven't bought it yet. What a messed up day it is today. After all, it is the first day of school after a four day weekend, so that's to be expected... Everything's going normal right, I wake up and get ready for school as usual. Except today i'm not tired in the least, so it's even better than most days. Since i'm up and going before schedule I have time to eat breakfast, which of course is pizza and soda. I get to school early, and I have plenty of time to get to class, now that is a miracle. I get out of the car and start walking to first block when I hear my dad yell my name from back inside the truck..."oh shit" I think, "what's wrong?" My dad then informs me that i've forgotten my backpack. I was relieved, that is no big deal. So I look around the truck and my backpack is nowhere to be found, I laugh and tell him that I left it at home. He laughs in return, but it's more of a forced one. I get in the truck expecting to have to go all the way back home to get my backpack, but my dad says otherwise. He tells me to just go to class and he'll bring it in a few minutes. It was kind of a weird suggestion, but it made no difference to me. Either way I was doing no work, so I was just like alright. It crossed my mind that he might have a hard time finding my backpack, but I dismissed it as a small problem. I was right, if only for a second. I get to class and basically just sit there for the first thirty minutes, pretending to do my work. And if you're anything like me, you know that acting like you're doing your work is a very funny/ crazy thing to do. I've never gotten caught doing this, but if you did what would you say? "Uhhh, i'm just moving my hand across my paper as if I was writing something with a pencil, but nothing is actually being written because I have no pencil." According to my calculations, I believe that would make you about a 900 out of 55 on the kook scale. During my time without my backpack, I realized how much I take having the right materials for school for granted. You never fully appreciate a pencil or a piece of paper until you don't have one. This is reminiscent of the 1980's rock hit "You don't know what you got, till it's gone" by the great hair band Cinderella . After about a half an hour of doubtful waiting, that seemed like forever, some crazy lookin lady walks in carrying my backpack. I don't even have time to celebrate before I realize that my dad has brought me the wrong backpack. This lady was carrying my Magic backpack. At this time, it felt like I had just entered the craziest, most awkward situation ever. So now I have a bunch of Magic cards...not really what I needed, but thanks. Does anyone else feel sorry for my dad, because I do. The poor guy had to deal with my bullshit and go all the way back to our house to retrieve my backpack, he still has to go to work mind you. Then he picks up the wrong one and brings me my Magic cards. That really sucks. He's lucky i'm not an asshole, or I might bitch him out for bringing me the wrong thing. Enough about my dad though, i'm the one that's screwed here. On top of having a backpack full of Magic cards and the fact that I don't like to admit that I play Magic, I just found a knife in the front pocket of my backpack, greaaaaaaaat. Besides that potential mess of trouble, what am I supposed to do the rest of the day without my stuff? Nothing? For the rest of this class I guess i'm just gonna sit here and do just that. Beyond that though, there are two possibilities. I am either getting a ride home from Louie or Zac, or i'm walking home. I'm leaning more towards walking home. Not only because it's likely that no one will want to drive me that far, but also because it will be fun. I didn't want to go to school today anyway, and now I can just play some games or something. There is one thing that is tempting me to come back to school after I go home: I am wearing a crazy/ cool outfit today and I want to show it off. I have on my usual O' Niell sweater on, which is always cool. Then I have these green punkerish jeans on that I think are pretty cool but I never wear. I also have a white shirt on underneath my sweater, but I consider that a small detail since I don't plan on taking my sweater off anytime soon. I have this little heart bracelet on my wrist that I stole from my sister's friend. That's obviously one of the funnier things about my ensemble, and I wanted to see what people said to this girliness/gayness. The funniest thing of all, perhaps, is the chain wallet that hangs from my belt buckle and rests in my side pocket. I haven't worn one of these since like fourth grade, and to tell the truth it feels kind of cool. This is probably due to the fact that nobody wears these anymore besides crazy punkers, and I like doing things that nobody else does. The wallet is pretty funny too, it's one of those three fold ones and my money barely fits in it so it's all fat and I laugh. Plus nothing beats the combination of chains and leather(in case I didn't mention it before, the wallet is leather). Now the random ass fucker busts in with his two cents: "ACTUALLY EVERYTHING BEATS THE COMBINATION OF CHAINS AND LEATHER YOU FAGET BITCH!!!!!!!"

I love it how I can go to 2nd block anytime I like. You can come in here an hour and ten minutes late and Mrs. Parlade won't say a word to ya. It's crazy. You would think there was some sort of restrictions or rules regarding tardiness, but apparently the school only cares when you're late for 1st or 3rd block. That's only because that's the beginning of school and lunch, any other time they don't do anything to you if you're late. To me that's obsurd, but also very cool. I know some people who won't take shits in public bathrooms, at gas stations, at school, or at other people's houses. I don't see what the big deal is. I'll poop anywhere, or pee anywhere for that matter, as my friends know. Of course there's always the chance that you clog up the toilet at someone else's house, but that would be hilarious. In that case I would do two things - laugh at the fools who have to clean up that overflowing mess, and leave the house immediately, out the window if necessary. Some people are scared to sit on the seat, even when it has nothing on it. I can see if there's some shit or piss, I wouldn't sit down either. But in public restrooms, whether it be at 7-11, some random ran-down gas station, or school I don't see why it matters to anyone if there's nothing visible on the seat. I could care less if there's some germs getting on my butt and bottom of my upper legs region, that's a shoe in already. And so what if you run the risk of getting aids while sitting on the public John? I already have a backup plan for that... ...It's real simple: I get aids, no matter what the source, and I go on a massive killing spree. I will get ahold of a rocket launcher, a couple machine guns, some grenades, and a bomb or some anthrax or something because if I have aids and i'm gonna die, i'm gonna take at least 200 of you motherfuckers down with me. First i'd launch a missile straight into one of those stupid Arab stores, I have always hated those guys anyways. After that I would go to the ghetto and shoot up a bunch of niggers, as many as possible. Forcibly entering houses is an option if the situation calls for it. The method to my madness being to avenge my grandfather, who was attacked by a bunch of nigs at the beach in his early twenties. The attack fucked him up mentally for the rest of his life and now he's an asshole to everyone. So if given the chance to get the blackies back, I would take it. Then I would steal a car from someone at gunpoint, drive over to Brain Beard's, and throw a grenade into his house, blowing it to shreds. Why you ask? Well his name is Brain Beard... The showdown would last a little longer as I hide in the cargo area of a commercial jetliner, guns and all, on my trip to New York (or wherever China Town is). You don't think I would be able to pull that off? Well I probably couldn't, but in this story, anything goes. Upon my entry into China Town I would kick it up a notch and just start shooting everyone in sight, since they're all chinks anyway, it wouldn't matter. Grenades would be thrown, guns would be slanged, and the missiles from my "launcha" would be eagerly trying to catch up to every mass of running people, and suceeding. It would all end with a Matrix style battle/shootout with the police, there would be hundreds of them, and I would be doing cartwheels across the barrier of cars, machine guns blazin. After I took out the initial 100 or so officers there would be a reinforcement of about 300, plus the National Guard, plus the Army. The battle would rage on for about 10 more minutes as I mowed down all those pigs. Eventually I would get sniped by a rooftop sharpshooter and fall to the ground, not getting killed instantly. As everyone approached me to see if I was dead I would say "I don't care, I have aids anyways you fags" in a clear voice so all could hear. I would then open my hand to reveal a live grenade, with the clip off, and before they could run it would blow everyone, including myself, 10 feet into the air... Just like in The Professional . You will notice the gratuitous violence involved in my little story, that is because I have been watching ultraviolent, Rated R movies since a very young age. By this time I am desensitized to violence, so I can't help it. Also, if you thought that last paragraph was "horribly racist" or "ignorant" or something of that nature, you must realize that I am only joking, and it's all in fun. So chill out, fool. ...

Hey Jesseca, read the bold shit from left to right for a special message... [and oh yes, I know every single person that reads this is going to read what the bold font says. even when i only gave Jesseca permission to do so, assholes...] Oh my god I miss Jesseca... I don't know why, but all day I have had an extreme longing to be w ith, or see, or t a lk to her. It was n 't so bad un t il recently, but it's really strong like right now, and y es it sucks. I really wish I c o uld see her tommorow, since it's Valentines Day and all, b u t I won't get my hopes up on that one. So after reading all this i'm feeling very inspired and want to write something. Something long, engaging, funny and fun. The problem is it's really late and I still have to take a shower, and I have to go to bed sometime because I have school tommorow. My first idea is to just say to hell with school and stay up, something I normally wouldn't do (well actually I probably would, but you know what I mean), but since it's Friday tommorow I don't think it matters whether i'm awake in class or not. I think that's kind of fucked up though because I should probably be trying to do good tommorow in order to have some padding for when I don't do shit next week. In the end I don't think this decision will matter much in the grand scheme of things, and my mind has wandered off to thoughts of Jesseca again, making me lose my place in my thought process that was helping me decipher what the hell I was talking about, so i'm done talking about this shit. I want a digital camera more than anyone. I think it would be so freakin badass to have one, I can't even start to explain how much fun I would have with it. Maybe I am just an egomaniac, but I love taking pictures of myself. The fun doesn't stop with snapshots of me, I can also take pictures of everyone, and everything, else. Did I mention that digital cameras give you the ability to look at the pictures like you would on a computer monitor, arrange them however you like, delete the bad ones, organize them to your liking, and bring them up on your computer and put them on the internet or show your friends. That is so awesome man, I envy everyone who has one of these things. If anyone were to buy me one of these I would be overjoyed and that would be the coolest thing anyone has done for me, ever (well maybe not but i'm trying to be enthusiastic here). So come on my friends and help me out, buy me a digital camera for no reason, you will go to heaven for it. If anyone seriously does this it better be a Sony or I will yell at you, because I am really picky about that sort of thing. Mainly because that's the only kind that will plug into my computer, you know how that goes... Man I don't have much else to say, I tried pretty hard to write something cool but i'm sorry i'm just like zoned out and stuff. There was this really cool analogy that I was gonna put on here. The best and most creative analogy i've ever heard in my life actually, so it sucks that it kind of went with a picture, and I can't put pictures on this shit. Did I mention that I didn't do a bunch of homework that I was supposed to do tonight? Well yeah it's true... and that's too bad because i'm going to sleep now.

No hat + No gel + Shower in the morning without brushing hair afterwards = I HAVE CRAZY ASS HAIR. Luckily I was able to solve my hair problem by flattening it down with the hood of my sweater (oh the genius). I'm actually in a good mood today, I suppose it's because I feel much more awake than usual. Pretty cool huh? I have this song on my mind and I think the only way to get it off would be to sing every word I know(or think I know), let me see if it works: You remind me of the babe. What babe? The babe with the power. What power? The power of voodoo. You do. Do what? You remind me of the babe...I saw my baby, crying hard as babe could cry. What could I do? Complete with David Bowie dancing around in tight ass spandex-ish pants in a sucessful attempt to show off his dong to the world. Oh my god it cracks me up just thinking about it. I can't believe it's already Thursday. Tommorow is gonna be Friday, and also Valentines Day, but after that we have Monday off (yes!). So it's gonna be a three day weekend, and we all know there's plenty of fun to be had in a three day weekend. It should be the shiznit, my niggers. I don't really care though, since i'm not one of those crazy political minded anarchists. The bigger problem is Jesseca is grounded so there is a 95% chance I won't even see her tommorow. In any case, i'm not sure if I should buy her something...I guess I should because it's better to be safe then sorry, but then again it's not that big of a deal. So we will see, but chances are I won't buy anything, not that it matters. And Jesseca, if you're reading this - I Love You . Yesterday when we were at the card shop Louie brought up a good point. He told me that we could easily beat the crap out of any one of the fags in there. I had never really thought about it that way, but he's right. I looked around and saw a bunch of extreme geeks who were either skinny as shit or fat as fuck. After sizing them up I realized that none of them, with no exceptions, could stand a chance against either of us. Every one of em had really skinny fingers and thin ass hands, they were really soft and delicate, and they barely even touched my hand. I felt like I was shaking hands with my grandma. If we really wanted to we could just beat them down and steal their cards... but that's no fun. So if it ever comes down to it, we could kick allllllll their asses, and that is a reassuring thought. Joe Millionaire was on Monday, and if you saw it you would know that they've been touting this surprising twist at the end as something spectacular and unexpected. For the uninformed, i'm not talking about him telling the girl he's isn't a millionaire, there's something else. Well I think I know what the surprise is going to be, and i'm so confident about this that I would probably bet on it. I think that after he tells the girl he's not a millionaire, and after she cries and all that, whether she says she still wants to be with him or not, the producers of the show are gonna give him a million dollars for real. That will be the twist at the end. This makes sense on so many levels...If you really think about it, the ending would be kind of dull if he just told the girl he wasn't a millionaire, but now that they give him money and make it so he really is a millionaire it will be a happy ending and it will all be good. The only thing i'm not sure of is how much money they will give him, but I don't think it makes any difference, most likely it will be either 1 million or 50 million, but the latter would surprise me. As far as my pick for the girl, i'm pretty sure he's gonna pick Sarah, but you never know. We'll see how it pans out next Monday, the finale is gonna be awesome, and you know the ratings are gonna be through the roof. You wanna hear a joke? Business Computer Programming I. I hate this class, it is seriously a joke. Don't get me wrong, i'm a fan of the books as well (the new one comes out in June baby), but I don't spend my free time surfing the Harry Potter website and chatting in the Harry Potter themed message boards. So let's recap. I have an old geezer to my left, Readhead McUgly to my right, and it smells like King Kong took a shit in our ventilation system. Having fun yet? Then there's the kid who plays the same Red Hot Chili Peppers song non-stop(literally) all fucking day. He plays it so loud too, and the funny thing is the teacher has told him every day this year to get headphones but he never does, he's such an ignorant asshole. I don't even know which kid it is, or else I would have broken the speaker over his head by now. All I know is it comes from the top left portion of the classroom and it is very, very annoying. First Alan and now me, what the hell is going on around here? This one goes out to everyone at the cardshop, who's the bitch now? Now that i've won the tournament I would like to say just 2 things: I am one badass motherfucker, and of course, "Dave wins."

I know that I should be the sleeping... but there is an event that calls for recognition. Every dog has his day, or so they say, and today was Alan's day (2/10/2003!). After a long hiatus he returns and reigns victorious. This event will go down in history, in my mind anyways. Long live king Alan.

What the hell is going on around here? The answer nobody knows. Well maybe somebody does, but I sure don't. This weekend was alright until today. There was some football, a little basketball, and a ton of Magic played. That was all yesterday and the day before however, and today, in stark contrast, nothing has gotten done. I have been sitting around my house doing literally nothing. Not eating, not watching tv, not reading, not playing games, and barely thinking, just sitting around here. I feel like I can't come up with anything creative or clever right now. I am probably just tired, if my experience in these matters has taught me anything. The problem is I don't feel tired, I don't want to go to sleep, and I want a diversion. I've been trying to listen various types of music and nothing sounds good. I've tried to read stuff on the computer, but that proved to be very boring. I've tried to talk to people online as well, but nobody really has anything to say. Well not positive things anyway. The only other things that I can think of are 1)try to find something good on tv and 2) try to play some video games or 3)try to watch a movie. The first thing is pretty much impossible since my cable is unhooked in my room and the living room tv is being occupied by the rest of my family. The second idea just might work, but the only thing I can play is Shenmue II since the only system that's hooked up is my X-Box. So if Shenmue II gets boring fast then i'm screwed. My third option seems like the best of the three, if I can find the right movie to watch. I'm not sure what kind of movie I want to see. Whether it is a nostalgic movie that makes me think of the past, a fantasy that makes me think about it's world, or a comedy that just makes me laugh, it has to be something that engrosses me into the movie and lets me escape from reality, even if it's just for an hour or two. If a movie happened to do this that would be great, then I could go to bed a satisfied man. That's about it for today. There's not much to it, but you must understand it is a sunday, the worst day of the week. It was a gloomy and rainy sunday at that. My closing thoughts are about Jesseca telling me she's been grounded for two weeks...I won't actually explain my thoughts but I will say that i'm worried about the implications.

So much to say and so little time to say it in. That's the story of my journal as of right now. I have been busy with schoolwork and videogames for a few days now. I don't even have time to sleep, so you can imagine how much time I have to write in this, not much. That said, it should be known that I am biting a chunk out of my precious Shenmue II playing time to bring you this very special edition of Jareth's Little Ball That He Throws Crazily . The main reason I am doing this is not so much that I want to appease my loyal fans who have been dissapointed by my lack of interesting updates these past couple days. It is more a matter of needing to get some stuff off my chest. The first thing I must adress, since it has been bothering me for four days now, is the crashing and burning of the space shuttle Columbia. It seems like everyone in the world and every news channel on tv is wigging out about this. I guess they have a good reason, NASA probably spent (and lost) a ton of money on this mission, and of course, seven astronauts lost their lives in this "tragedy". To me however, this was not a big deal AT ALL. I'm puzzled as to why normal people care even a smidgen about these astronauts, I sure as hell don't care about them, and why should I? I don't know them, nobody that I know knows them, so why should I care about them? To me they are nothing. People die all the time, millions every day, and nobody says anything about them. Dying sucks, yes, but it happens to everyone . So I refuse to say anything about these astronauts deaths as if they were more special than anyone else. Another thing- astronauts are dumb for going into space in the first place, it is an extremely dangerous thing to do, but they want to be the big heroes, well we all see where that got 'em. Some people just don't get the big picture. There is nothing cool in space, so what do they expect when they go up there? It's cold as fuck, there's no oxygen (which is required to sustain human life, in case these kooks didn't know), and there is nothing there, just a bunch of sattelites. Wow! Isn't space fun?! Umm, not exactly. I'll take a break from my ranting for a moment to talk about how school's going. It's kind of funny how the situation is developing. Instead of doing bad in math, like I was last time, i'm doing freaking abysmal in computers. I have so many zeros in there i'm too scared to count, and every day it gets worse because she assigns us like five things a day and I do maybe one of them, if i'm in the mood. I know what i'm getting in there on my interim...a big fat F. Ouch. Nevertheless, there is some good news to this dreary story. In my other three classes Algebra 2, English 2, and Spanish 1 I am doing great. I have a solid B+ in English, and every day it moves closer to an A. I have either a high B or low A in Spanish, which is awesome. In math I am even doing good, unlike the previous two semesters this year (last year I got 2 A's), so that is a great feeling. The cool thing about all of this is I am actually starting to enjoy school now that i've been doing my homework every time it is assigned and getting good grades. I sometimes look forward to school as well, which has always been a rare occurance throughout my educational career. Peachy. The subject of my weekend has been avoided thus far but will no longer be able to escape my storytelling clutches. I don't know what to tell ya, besides this one was a weird one folks. It was so far out that at one point I seriously thought I was dreaming, but that might have beeen my psychosis acting up again. In any case, I had some considerable fun this weekend and I kept the boredom to a minimum. On friday night Chris and Louie came by my house unexpectedly, and a little later we made a surprise appearance at, of all places, the card shop. It was really crazy and cool at the same time to be back there, mindblowing really. Practically everyone that I remember from the card shop when it moved a couple years ago was there friday, that really surprised me. The coolest thing of all is that Twitch now runs the joint. He has always been one of the coolest guys there and one that was always nice and helpful to Chris and I even though we didn't quite fit in with the regulars. It is awesome to have the cardshop back in business right near us, and even better is the fact that there is a tournament nearly every day of the week, not to mention for a cheaper price and bigger payoff. The Magic community seems to be bigger and stronger than ever too, as dorky as these people might be, that's nice to know. The coming of the card shop couldn't have came at a better time either, right when we start to get back into the game we are told that the cardshop just recently moved back near us, score. Since the new card shop not only lived up to my expectations but also exceeded them I look forward to going there and hangin with the old school geeks and beating their ass at a good old game of M:TG. Back on focus, nothing big happened on this particular night, it was more of a time to get reaquainted with the whole experience. Since we missed the tournament Chris and I just played a couple games amongst ourselves and left. We got a ride home from his mom and almost directly after arriving at his house we left to go to Eric Leb's. We were going there to watch the Kings Vs. Lakers game. On the way there it was really foggy and we were trying to navigate ourselves through a long ass path through the trails. It was at this time when I began to feel like I was dreaming. For one I couldn't believe I had just been to the card shop and for two, I couldn't see shit, thus making it seem like a dream. Being at Eric's house for the first time in my life didn't help matters much. That was an odd experience, it was late at night and Chris was falling asleep, leaving me to fend for myself with Eric, whom I don't know very well at all. Luckily it wasn't that bad because Chris was talking in his sleep, saying crazy shit and making weird noises, so that made it very easy to communicate, and laugh, with the Lebmyster. We were scheduled to go back to Chris's that night (this is still friday people) to go to sleep, but since Chris had already been dozing off and probably wouldn't make it home in the dark, Eric let us stay at his house. This turned out to be a crazy situation in the morning, when we woke up in this foreign bedroom (we were in some guestroom, while Eric was in his), wondering where the hell we were. After sneaking around for a bit, ya know, to avoid the parentals, we found Eric downstairs and ate some breakfast. McDonalds for those who are wondering, that's what you get for breakfast when you make 10 billion dollars a year. Later we went home and were dissapointed to find that nobody was living up to their plans to go to hurst and play the mighty dicathlon of sports. Eventually, at around four, we got everyone except for Zac up there to play. It wasn't quite as fun as I anticipated, but it would have sucked a whole lot worse if me and Louie hadn't beaten Chris and Mike at Grunge Match style football with a last minute fumble return for a touchdown. Oh Yeahhh!! Ok, so Chris's previously injured leg did wig out on the play, but that doesn't matter, because like Shaq once said "the only stat that counts is the W." I admit it, I have omitted some rather integral parts of my weekend. Like the whole movies mishap, not mentioned whatsoever. And the part about Jocelyn and the whitey-blackey-lover-girl overhearing our devious plans(easily one of the more embarassing things I have ever been through), not included. However, I would consider these things minor, and not worth mentioning because they are either A) Boring or B) Too lengthy for my lazy ass to explain. The two very last major events that occured this weekend are the following: I purchased 3 DVDs(I was gonna get 5 DVDs but I had to put two of them back because they were rated R and Wal-Mart, being the blistering hemroids that they are, wouldn't let me buy them) and a game, and my tv blew up. My tv had been spazzing out, making loud noises and going blurry, every so often for about the last month. It reached its limit this weekend and just shut off, and wouldn't turn back on. My initial reaction was "oh well, i'll just get another one", but when my dad said I would have to wait at least 2 weeks to get a new one I took things into my own hands. I unplugged everything from the entertainment center, loosely organized the cords and controllers on my ground, and arranged a makeshift setup using my dresser as the tv stand. It works quite well, and now I can play games in comfort, on my bed. Where before I used to always have to sit in awkward positions and permanently jack up my spine. Oh yeah, in case you didn't catch it, I fixed my tv now and it's all good. Very cool. Before I stop writing this overly long, rushed, dullness filled journal entry I figure I will make it longer and even more unbearable with a few more of my complaints...You know something that pisses me off? When people don't flush the toilet. At school or otherwise, this is unacceptable behavior, plain and simple. Why the hell would you not flush the toilet? Because you are a nasty ass bitch is why. I always find myself flushing 4 or 5 urinals a day when I see that the person before didn't flush it, this sickens me. I can't believe these disgusting assholes. This can definitely be considered a pet peeve of mine. So if you are one of the dirty, homo-erotic individuals who does this sort of thing you better not let me see you do it or I am gonna personally slam your head into the urinal and flush your gay ass down the drain. You have been warned. The next group to stand up to the podium of shame are the people who wear board shorts to school, elementary kid lookalikes that go to my high school, and people with a lisp. Ahhh... you kooks who wear boardshorts (another name for the surfer style swimming trunks) to school, how I loathe thee. I will not insult and make fun of you in a lengthy manner, I will only point and laugh. For real though, what's is up with these dumbasses? It doesn't look cool to dress like this at school, it is not cool to be a surfer, and this is not the beach . As for the young looking kids who populate the halls of Seabreeze High School whom I laugh ever so wildy at - what the fuck happened to you? I'm not even joking on this one, what is wrong with these bastards? I know preschoolers who look older than them. If you go to my school and have no idea what i'm talking about take one look at Joey Sorocco and you will see the light. Finally I come to people with a lisp, to these people I have nothing to say...besides that having a lisp is the most outrageously crazy and gay thing that can happen to a person, and I am so glad I don't have a speech impediment. At this point I am feeling pretty uninspired, and with good reason, you wouldn't feel like writing anymore either after you finished typing six million words. Despite feeling very tired I know how much a good conclusion can help a journal, so I won't let ya down. I will end this with that excellent Louie joke that I mentioned in an entry about a week back, it goes a little somethin like this: Louie: Hey my mom wants to know if you'll help her plant tulips sometime next week for a hundred bucks an hour. Random Girl: Really? A hundred bucks an hour? Wow! Yeah, i'll do it. Louie: Yeah it's cool ain't it, my mom's crazy like that. All you have to do is plant tulips. Random Girl: That's awesome, I can't wait. So when is it exactly? Louie: Umm next week sometime, i'll tell you the day tommorow or something, I have to ask her. Random Girl: (now exuberant with excitement and enthusiasm) Oh. That's really cool though! Louie: Yep, it's gonna be me, you, and my mom, it'll be fun. Random Girl: I know I know, and we're gonna make a hundred bucks an hour! Louie: Yep, so aren't you even gonna ask where you're doing this at? Random Girl: Where? Louie: Well...You're gonna plant tulips, but the only place you're plant two-lips is on my dick!!! (hardy har har)

I've been waking up a very tired little boy lately. On sunday I stayed up until 1 o clock playing Shenmue II, getting about halfway through(i'm hopelessly addicted to this game). I think it was well worth it, even if I did wake up in the morning feeling like a lethargic lunatic. Last night was the same story, only a little worse. I got my new EGM magazine yesterday, and I read the whole thing, every word, in one day. It probably wasn't the smartest thing to do, considering that it kept me up until a little after 3 in the morning, but I simply couldn't put it down. At the end of the 10 hour (give or take a few) reading fest I still felt enthralled and I desperately wanted to read something else, or write a story, or play a game, but I was too damn tired to do anything of the sort. This morning I felt the worst I have felt in a long time after awakening from my slumber. In my early morning blur of exhaustion I denounced school and even called it The Neverending Assault On The Well Being Of Millions Of Teenagers Across America and The Sleeping Man's Bane . I came up with vaguely philosophical questions and statements like "What the hell is school's problem, waking me up at 6:30 in the [fucking!] morning? If any person ever tried to wake me up at this time I would be like 'Hey asshole, turn off the light, i'm going back to sleep!' But school gets away with it every single day, now what is up with that?" Shortly afterwards my mom broke in with "Get up and get ready, it's 8:05 already", squandering my hopes of staying home from school. Although I had no specific reason of staying home, besides being tired, I was sorely dissapointed. It turned out for the better though, because now I am feeling wide awake, and I even had fun in 1st block. The old saying goes "mama knows best", and today, that saying was true. We had to read our fellow classmates' essays in English today as a "peer review". Soon after doing this I realized that there is no end to human stupidity. Some of the shit(literally) that I read was so unbelievably idiotic that you would have to read it to believe it. It was insane! I don't understand how a person could be that dumb. It sounded like something a kindergartener would write. I have one question to ask Cliff Mitchell(the kid who not only wrote the worst essay I have ever read in my life but also the craziest looking motherfucker this side of the Mississippi). Where the hell were you the last nine years of English class!?!? Much more is on the mind of brilliance that is my own, but I must go, for the bell has rung, signaling the end of class.

Time for me to shoot straight from the hip, or something like that... Oh no i'm feeling sick, this isn't good.
