Chris, however, only has one thing on his mind - his newest cd, aptly named "The Potato Famine", a title I thought of myself. What a crazy name for a cd, but it is fitting, for the cd is equally maniacal. If you listen to it you might just go stark raving mad. Not really, I just wanted to use the phrase "stark raving mad"...

Damn it's cold out today. It's the kind of day that puts scientists to shame for talking about "Global warming" and "The green house effect." I would like you to explain this one, you brainiacs. There's nothing interesting online today either, but somehow I keep myself busy. I want to go home and watch Donnie Darko one more time so I can fully understand it, or at least form my own opinions about what it's about, regardless if they're correct. I was going to do a mini review of 8 Mile, but that movie pales in comparison to the depth of Donnie Darko and its Sundance Film Festival artsyness. I guess I could still do it though, for those who care. 8 Mile - **SPOILER ALERT** DONT READ THIS IF YOU HAVEN'T SEEN THE MOVIE AND DON'T WANT TO KNOW WHAT HAPPENS IN IT. After all the good things I heard about this movie, I didn't expect much. I spent the first ten minutes thinking it had been overhyped too much by Zac and my sister for me to enjoy it, but I eventually got into it. I liked the movie a lot immediately after it ended. I liked how it built up from the slow moving start to the excellent ending. Overall the movie was pretty good, especially the last free style battle scene, that was really the highlight of the film. After (and during) it I was on my feet because I was so excited about it. The things he says will make you go "yeah!", it's a very good scene. I do have a few complaints though. There were a lot of things in the plot that were never really wrapped up and some things that weren't handled well. You could blame that on the director though, I think he was a loser. I base that on the fact that there were no shots that impressed me all that much, and how the movie ended (i'm talking about the very end, when he walks down the alley back to work). The movie ended too soon if you ask me and left the storyline about his girlfriend and his mom and sister hanging. I also think they could have fleshed out his relationship with Brittany Murphy a lot more. It didn't even seem like they were together, or even hooked up at any time except for their one sex scene. I don't know if it was supposed to be like that or what, but if so then I don't know why he would be so mad when he caught the black dude with her... All in all, it could have been better, but I like it how it is anyway, mostly because of the final free style scene.
Back off, i'll take you on. Head strong to take on anyone. I know that you are wrong, and this is not where you belong! I don't care what Matt says, that song is awesome.

I had never seen those things before but my sister says they are all the rage at her school. She said kids sell them at her school for small sums of money and she pops them over people's heads all the time. I'm just gonna have to bring the fad to high school, it will be awesome. I dunno though, I remember one time I tried to bring back yo-yos in like 8th grade, let's just say it didn't catch on too well. But these things are much cooler than traditional yo-yos. They are like a bigger version of those little gooey things you get in those machines for a quarter. Except they aren't sticky, and they have a water filled ball at the end that's fun to squeeze, giving them a second function as a stress reliever, but that's not all. Get this - the ball of water has sparkles in it, and the sparkles are shiny! oooooh, ahhhh. All of this for only a dollar at Wal-Mart, and there is plenty of them available. Now go out and buy one. *Wink* Guess what today is? My mom's birthday! I bet you thought I was gonna say something like "It's Saddam Hussein's Deathday!" or "The beginning of the end of the world!", but nope. It is kind of weird that my mother's birthday is on the same day as the start of the U.S. invasion of Iraq . It's pretty cool actually. Hopefully everything goes to plan and we don't miscalculate anything major, if that is the case then this war will be a real joke. It's clear that our military is superior to Iraq's in pretty much every way. We should take advantage of this and make it a quick war, then we'll laugh about it later. I think the only thing we should worry about is those crazy terrorists trying to destroy U.S. monuments and large buildings and such. There is, however, an easy way of preventing this from happening - If you know any Arabic people, whether you think they are good or bad, beat the crap out of them right now . Then we'll see how much they help ol' Saddam. Happy Birthday to my motha, and to the U.S. Troops over in Iraq: Go forth and kick ass.
I've decided that my one and only goal in life is to slay Medusa . It might be difficult, but if I can't do it than baby it can't be done .

Mr. Phillips gave a long speech about a lot of things today and he convinced me that it's time to perform well in school. So i'm going to attempt to get straight A's this nine weeks and end this school year on a positive note. It should be easy enough, I just need to start paying attention and doing all my work, that means even my homework. It kind of sucks, but I have plenty of free time anyways. On the good side of things, we have an unusually long summer this year. If what I heard is right, we get out on May 28th and come back August 24th. That's a little under three months off. I can't wait for that...and I mean that literally. Oh man...I wrote a bunch of shit after that paragraph about basketball and the Holly Hill rec and stuff, but it didn't publish, and right after the first paragraph is the last time I saved. Oh golly gee, that stinks.

Whoooo what is with all these bastard asses making these crazy websites where it's song lyrics and singing scrolling across the screen and then all of the sudden it changes to a grisly image of a dead person accompanied by loud screaming and such? You know what i'm talkin about don't ya? Yeaahhh I hate those fuckin things, they scare the bejeesus out of me everytime. Even when I know it's comin. Maybe i'm just a scaredy cat. I just saw one of those things, that's why i'm wigging out about it. To make up for it though, I saw some uber radical robot dancing craziness a minute ago. It was a video of this kid busting out these insane robotic dance moves and it simply must be seen to be believed! It's outrageous man! It's worth coming over my house just to watch it, that's how good it is. It's great. In case you were wondering, my mom woke up late this morning so neither me or my sister went to school today. I missed the FCAT testing, and as you know that is required to graduate... i'm not too worried about it though. It did mean I got to spend the day getting some stuff done around here. My dad hooked up the desk for the computer in my living room and moved it into his abode, letting me take the entertainment center and set it up in my room. I spent pretty much the entire day hooking up my systems and rearranging my room. Speaking of which, my room is now the ultimate paradise . I especially like how my new tv looks in there (it's 32 inches, old school, and sexy) and to add to the excitement, my new game console layout is amazing... I should seriously get a job installing video game systems because I love doing it, I live for that kind of shit. Too bad that's not a job, and if it is, it definitely pays too low for my tastes. Oh well, there's always the wide-open field of bike repair... Today my mind is really a mixed bag of thoughts, so I will be changing subjects like mad. Just lettin you know so you have some sort of preparation... Since last night the flood of family members and their friends has started pouring in, and my house has already been transformed into the party zone of the nation . It has been a crazy house all day long. Maybe it's because everyone is excited about the good weather we had. Nahhh that's just because everybody is drunk. For real though, it's the first time the sun has been out for weeks, the bikers must be happy, my dad and his compadres included. It must have been the hottest day of the year so far. I was sweatin my ass off, that's for sure. The crazy thing is, we ain't seen nuthin yet. I went and hung out with Jesseca and her gang (Katelin and the rest of the family) yesterday. The plan was to go to Hooters but that place was packed to the brim with rowdy bikers. We figured we would let them have their fun, we weren't gonna wait 2 hours to get our food. After discovering that the Winghouse was packed as well, we decided to just go back to her house and order pizza & wings. It turned out pretty fun in the end, I thought so anyways. Did I mention that Jesseca is so pretty she makes all the other girls look bad ? Well that is true. It's also the lovely one's birthday today, so Happy Birthday Jessie! I Love You! Oh man I went to Denny's today and had the Grand Slam for breakfast/lunch (or "brunch", for people who like to use short ugly abbrieviations for two words put together), it was good as hell. It's black with dual exhaust and John style wooden interior, it's even got the rain blocker window thingys. I also dig the old school knobs and stuff. As you might be able to tell, I don't know much about the inner workings of cars or anything like that, but it looks (and sounds) cool to me. Good job Louis . (Now watch everyone at school tell her about this and before I know it i'll have this stinky nig in my face, lol. Oh well, that's what happens.) Man what a long weekend...and I mean that in the best way possible. It seemed like it was summertime to me, maybe because I had a lot of fun and didn't think about school at all. My hair is crazy as hell today so i'm gonna download a virus onto this shit. That will teach it. Dashboard Confessional is awesome. The songs are all so extremely cynical, it's great if you're into hating the world and stuff. And I know how you people love hating the world. Don't believe it? Then check this out - The Good Fight Consider the odds, consider the obvious. The martyr is meaningless, the campaign has died. In the planning stages and the fallen faces are the singular proof that it was ever alive. This purchased rebellion has been outdated, denounced and rescinded and left to die championless. I begged you not to go. I begged you, I pleaded. Claimed you as my only hope and watched the floor as you retreated. Hope has sprung a perfect dive a perfect day, a perfect lie. A slowly crafted monologue conceding your defeat. Does it comfort you to know you fought the good fight? Basking in your victory, hollow and alone to boast your bitter bragging rights to anyone who'll listen. While you're left with nothing tangible to gain. See, Chris Carabba is the man. His middle name is Ender too, so one of these days he will probably get fed up with this shit and end everyone's life. Ya know, because he's the ender.

Man I want Jesseca's bod, but she has an eye appointment tomorrow so I won't be able to go see her. I will see her as soon as I can though, maybe Wednesday if i'm lucky. "Are you a good witch, or a bad witch?" Anyone remember that from Wizard of Oz? Hahaha I do. Don't ask me why the hell I thought of that either, because I have no idea. I take back what I said in my last post about everyone and everything kicking ass. I meant everything except school. This crap needs to hurry up and get over with, because I wanna rock and roll all night and party every day, but school is holding me back and not letting me reach that goal. I'm tired as all get out right now but i'm forced to make 15 CDs for big Dan the handy man (my sister's boyfriend/ fiance). It's cool with me though because i'm getting some fast cash in the deal. 5 dollars down and then 10 more when I finish them all. Add that shit up and it equals a cool 15 dollas for the Davemyster. If anyone else wants to give me some easy money then they are free to do so. I'll even make you a CD. Or you can C- Dees nuts in yo mouth, your choice. I did so much stuff this weekend and i'm so tired from it I don't know if I even want to talk about it. Oh well, I will make it "brief". On Friday I went to Jesseca's and hung out there pretty much all day. It was very fun as usual. I just wish we could've hung out longer, because even though we were together for a lot of hours, I just can't get enough of miss Jesse. On Saturday I had plans with Colleen so I didn't go anywhere all day and I ended up being by myself throughout it because she didn't call. Being alone isn't such a bad thing for me though as i've stated before, so it was alright. She finally ended up calling me at like 10:30 at night and telling me that her and Stephanie were coming. I was pretty surprised by it, but you know me, i'm down for whatever. I had to give them directions on the phone and it was pretty hard because my voice is too deep for em, but they got here eventually. We were supposed to hang out with Louie and Chris but they made other plans and pretty much screwed over Colleen and Steph after they drove 30 minutes from NSB. They were mad and stuff but I guess it was alright in the end because they figured out never to come down here again for those kids. Us three came to my house and chilled in my computer room for an hour and a half or so. It turned out pretty fun since they were both cool and funny. Today was Sunday and I slept in till 2. I found out from Jesseca soon after that church was canceled. Imagine that, one of the only times I was actually looking forward to it they don't have it. I still wanted to hang out with Jesseca badly, but she informed me that Louie and company were coming over to wig out on me or whatever and they arrived like two seconds later so that was the last time i've talked to her. Me, Alan, Chris, Louie, and Kelly hung out all freakin day today filming skits and messing around. It was so much fun, I had a blast. We did some fuckin radical skits too and I am so overjoyed by the way things are going skitwise. Everyone worked together and we agreed with eachother a lot. I don't even think there was one argument the whole day. We also started editing the final tape today and it is going extremely well like everything else. Our tape is going to be so montrously awesome when we're done with it that nobody will know what to do about it. It rocks. Ah well i'm done writing now because i'm too excited for this boringness. I've been writing forever and if I keep this up i'll be sitting here all night just rambling. I just want to say that I am really happy with life and how things are going right now. In my mind everybody and everything kicks ass. I hope it stays like this for a long time to come. Peace my niggas.

I Love You Jesseca!

This trick is mindblowing though, you gotta believe me. It seems like a pretty big occasion also, so I think I should get her something. The only problem is I only have 10-15 dollars at most. I'll still go looking for something, but I dunno, that ain't much. We'll see what I can do. The NBA playoffs are shaping up quite nicely. The two 8 seeds have already taken home court advantage from the #1 teams. The Kings have gone up 2-0 on the Jazz while everyone else has failed to do the same. Expect the Lakers to put the same deficit on the Timberwolves tonight. In the East my pick has already gone wrong, as Orlando looks like they will get an upset series win over Detroit, but ya never know. And even though Sacremento had an impressive game last night against Utah, I have yet to see any evidence that anyone can beat the Lakers. Did you see game 1 against Minnesota? It was a complete joke. That's all I have to say about this, but an SI.com writer put it best when he said "Anybody who doubts the Lakers now probably also believes in the Easter Bunny."

Oh no, Easter is over, what is a boy to do? Eat all this SUGAARRR!!!! So I have come to the conclusion that Louie likes night clubs...a lot. That's all he talks about these days is those damned night clubs. He even called me tonight and tried to get me to go to 600 North with him. I abstained [courteously] because I was watching Road to Perdition. And besides, what the hell would I do at a night club!? Nothin that's what. For one, I have a girlfriend (who I love so very much), so I wouldn't be doing any grinding on all the female club-goers. Two... well there is no two because that's the only reason people go to clubs anyway, to dance with the opposite sex in a sexual manner. So instead of going to 600 North you can go 600 miles south to Cuba and get butt raped by Fidel Castro, and all of you can take your Fuel and put it in my mother's big blue Chevy Astro van. Haha. Nah i'm just messin with ya Louie, whatever floats your boat, or wets your whistle... is cool with me. Jesseca is such a hottie.

I went to my aunt Jennifer's house today, as planned. She talked about opening up her midget strip club, as usual, and this time she even added a little rhetoric about how black people from the Carribean Islands are not considered niggers. My uncle Guy argued that niggers are niggers no matter where they come from, and I agree with him, with no disrespect to my dawgs of course. My cousin Vinny is still an asshole and my cousin Leo is still fat. They called me a pothead (I fucking hate that by the way because I don't smoke), and they said I sucked at videogames repeatedly. I got them both back though. When I insulted this crazy videogame that they were playing Vincent got all mad and said some stuff about how I sucked at videogames. I don't know about you, but when somebody says something like that to me I take that as a challenge. And if you know me, I don't even need to be challenged or pissed off to beat the crap out of somebody at a videogame, I do that just for fun. So a little while later when we were playing a game that we actually competed against eachother in (Timesplitters 2, a sub-par first person shooter for the uninformed), I took that as an opportunity to show him who sucks at videogames. Naturally, I whooped both of their asses in nearly every single round of play. Then Vin got all mad and tryed to hit me with a pillow but I easily blocked it. I find it funny when people try to take out their frustration on me in the real world, it just shows how much I got to them. They eventually got sick of my relentless assault and shut off the game... Then I said "Who sucks now you fuck?" and walked out. I am fresh off the recliner from viewing the film Road to Perdition . I can't say enough about how good this movie is. Among other things, my grandmother called it "Spellbounding." I like that word, so that will do. I especially liked the last few scenes at the beach and the aunt's house, they had such wonderful directing and beautiful imagery, it was fantastic. Oh yeah and mad props to the fashion/ wardrobe manager of that movie, the costumes were great. The rain scenes were also magnificent looking. As you can see the movie is very aesthetically pleasing, but that is not all it has to offer, the story is pretty good too. Enough of my babbling though, I think you should just watch it because it's most definitely worth your time. Where oh where could my baby be? It is her that I want to see.

"Y'all don't know what it's like being male, middle class, and white." Well, I just gave Jesseca a ringaling and she didn't answer her phone. I must have missed her. I didn't really expect her to be home since I woke up like 4 hours too late because that's how it goes. I suppose she's off hanging out with whoever, so you know what that means... it's Zelda time for Dave. That's one of the many things I love about videogames, you don't have to worry about them leaving you to go off and do something else, they will always be there for ya. I will go return the favor. In the meantime, everyone should download Ben Folds Five - Rockin The Suburbs and listen to it immediately. He rocks the suburbs just like Micheal Jackson did, except that he was talented.

Last night was kind of weird. It was Friday, of course, but I didn't do anything. I was supposed to go over Jesseca's house but her mom went crazy and said that she had to babysit 2 kids, and I couldn't come over because she wouldn't pay attention to them if I was there. I guess that's true, but why is she babysitting people on Friday anyway? Beats me. My backup plan was to go with Louie to Orlando to see House of 1000 Corpses, but that was kind of a longshot because he called and told me that we were going on Wednesday and I didn't talk to him at all Thursday. In any case, Louie never called, and I don't even know his number... so yeah, I didn't do that. I ended up staying home and playing Zelda. This was not a problem really, the game is wonderful. The crazy thing is I played it nonstop last night, for too long probably (i'm thinking around 14 hours...), and I didn't beat it. I am impressed by the length of the game because I have played the hell out of it and i'm not even near the end yet. I don't know when i'll have time to finish it! Here's the plan for the rest of the break though: I'm going to hang out with Jesseca all day today most likely, but then she has to babysit at night so at that time i'm gonna go get a badly needed haircut. When I get home i'll find something to do, like get to the end of, or finish The Legend of Zelda: The Wind Waker . If you're wondering what i'm doing tommorow; I am being forced to spend Easter Sunday at my aunt Jennifer's house. Oh how I hate that place, nobody knows. It wouldn't be bad if somebody would murder my bastardly cousin Vincent because he is the cause of all my troubles. I don't just mean at my aunt Jennifer's house, I refer to my life in general. I do hear that my "good" cousin Leo will be there this time. So maybe i'll have a tag partner in the wrestling matches that the evil one sets up, and just maybe he will bail me out of all those goddamned headlocks that Vin- Diesel puts me in. Someone please end that asshole's life! On another note, I don't know what is happening on Monday. I'm thinking if I don't hang out with Jesseca the Beautiful and i've already beaten Zelda then I will spend two hours walking to Best Buy in order to purchase the motion picture Donnie Darko and the rest of the day I will spend watching it over and over until I fall asleep. After that, on Tuesday, is school. Oh my, we all know that ain't good...

You know what I think? I think that Jesseca Wales is the best girl in the whole world . I have come to a point in Zelda where I can accurately judge how good it is. I could talk for hours about how much the game rocks my socks and how fun it is, but I will only say this: "I Loooove it" - Snoop Dogg style. The NBA Regular season has come to a close at last. I thought there were some pretty surprising playoff pairings, but that's just me. However, it is time to take your picks for who will win their respective conferences. Here are mine: In the West we have the L.A. Lakers. This should come as no surprise to anyone who read what I wrote about the Lakers a little while back... and in the East I will take the Detroit Pistons. The Pistons were more of a hometown favoritism thing, but hey, it's not like it will matter who wins the East anyways. I predict the Lakers will win it all of course. Man it is going to be so funny if the Lakers lose... In other news - Mother 1 + 2 and Mother 3 have been officially announced to be in development for Game Boy Advance. Hold on let me let that sink in for a minute before I explain... OK. Translation: The best game ever made [Earthbound in the US, Mother 2 in Japan], which also happens to be my favorite game since I was 8 years old, and its prequel [Mother, never before released in the U.S.] will be ported, on the same cartridge, onto the GBA on June 20th (in Japan). As if that weren't enough good news for one day, or even a year, the long awaited sequel (that was "canceled" a long time ago), Mother 3/ Earthbound 2, has also been revealed to be in development for the GBA. You do not know how much joy this brings me, and I won't even try to explain because it would sound too dorky, but to quote Coach Skipper - "This is awesome folks, awesome." That's not all of the surprise announcements I have up my sleeve... How about this one. Bad Karma [or in this case "Good Karma"] is back in production! This comes after probably a year or more of not doing anything skit related, how cool. I can't reveal any of the actual skits that were done on here because we're only showing the tape to trusted friends this time around, but trust me, they are crazy. If you don't believe me then take John's word for it and BELIEVE THIS : On day one, we go to the park, we get stopped by the cops. Almost directly after we go to Shadow Lakes, the cops wig out on us, again (same ones too lol). To sum it up, we've been filming for about 6 hours at most and we've already been hassled by the man twice, now what does that tell ya? It tells me that there's plenty more where that came from. I've watched 4 movies in the last 3 days, so it's time to give my little mini review of them all. If you're not into movies or whatever then you can stop reading now because there's gonna be nothing else past this point. If this applies to you, see you later, movie hater. For the rest of you [normal] people, let's begin... Silent Night Deadly Night 3: I honestly wasn't expecting much from this movie, seeing as the first two in the series blew large balls when realistically considered as films. Although I will admit that they were great for laughs. So how does this movie size up to its predecessors? It was much, much worse. I can't believe the higher ups at this company would allow anyone to release such a catastrophe! The acting was horrible, the story didn't make sense, and there were like 5 lines of dialogue in the whole movie. The one good thing about this movie is that it's so stupid it's funny. Please watch this movie only if you're an asshole. Silent Night Deadly Night 4: The "continuation" of the movie I just talked about, the only problem is the two have nothing to do with eachother whatsoever. This is definitely the Halloween 3 of the series. In lamans terms, the black sheep. Just when you thought a movie couldn't get worse, this sucker rolls around the corner and slaps you in the face. Clint Howard has a starring role in it for god's sake, what more do I have to say? Oh, how about it's gross (not in a good way by any means), has an ugly girl getting nude in it, depicts a man getting jabbed in the stomach with the stick end of a broom, and involves cultish lesbian ceremonies where bugs get spewed out of people's mouths. Now that is trash. This movie isn't funny at all either, so don't even think about redeeming qualities. Silent Night Deadly Night 5: Do you see a pattern here? This one is actually a little better than the other two, but not by much. The plot revolves around a maniacal toy maker, humorously named "Joe Petto", who creates his own killer toys and sends them out to little boys and girls at christmas time. It does sound kind of cool, and that's why it was better than 3 & 4, but sadly, when compared to practically any other movie in existence, it is a bad joke. With that in mind, i'll humor myself and judge it as if it weren't a piece of trash. There was a cool twist at the end where something happens and you don't think it will... ahhh who am I kidding - just take my advice and never watch this movie ever. The Ring: No jokes here, this was a good movie. One thing I noticed was that the directing and cinematography were pretty good, almost to the point where it seemed like a Sundance movie, but not quite. That's alright though, because this movie does what it sets out to do, and that is to scare the crap out of you. It sets the mood very early and keeps you interested until the very end. There is only one cheap "SURPRISE!" scare to speak of, and the rest of the terror comes from the film's ability to get into your mind and freak you out. It does a good job of that...until the end. Let me try to say this without spoiling anything. One of the best things the movie has going for it is its mystery, because let's face it, there is no director in the world that could think of more stuff that freaks you out than your own brain. When your imagination goes on its own course and thinks of all these horrific things on its own, there is nothing scarier. If the people who made it would realize this then the movie would probably be a lot better. As it is though, the only thing wrong is that the end explains why the people died or didn't die, and it's a stupid reason (I thought), and would be better left unsaid. Besides that, this is a solid and very scary movie. Despite my minor grievances, it's definitely a good one to bring home from the movie store because it is entertaining, and overall, it is a good flick. And now I go to sleep.

It's 1:00 in the morning and I just ran all the way to Chris's house (approximately 3 miles from here), threw a couple rocks at his window, stole his bike, and came back home. Somewhere in between that time I ended up Splinter Celling past (not one, not two, but...) 3 cop cars, knocking over a bunch of cones, and breaking a beer bottle in the road for no apparent reason. Now my ass is in severe pain from Chris's P.O.S. bike, i'm cold as shyte, and I have a stomach cramp from hell... too much damn physical activity for only having 3 total hours of sleep within the last two days. In other words, i'm going to sleep.

Yeah so it took me a while, but I finally got over what happened on friday. Mainly because I listened to the sound clip of Arnold Swarzchenegger saying "STOP BEING SUCH A PUSSY!" over and over. Haha no I didn't. Here's a quick recap of the past couple days since I don't really feel like writing too much. I spent most of friday fiddling with my website. There's a fair amount of new crap on there. It's probably the biggest update i've done ever, so be sure to take a gander at that. Just be aware that it's crazy. I beat FF7 yesterday. I'm kind of proud of that because Zac and Louie both talked about how they got near the end and quit. I don't know if it was too hard for them, too long or what but it seemed exceptionally short and easy to me, probably 'cause i'm Dave... I also started Zelda: The Wind Waker , but it's too early to tell whether it's good or not. Time will tell. I hung out with Louie quite a bit these last two days. We had a blast prank calling people using the Ahnuld soundboard. We recorded some of the calls but they were bad quality so we just deleted them. That was ok though because we had our fun. Whenever we went to the Hess station for breakfast the guy gave me a pepperoni pizza and a drink for the same price as a cheese pizza. It was awesome, I was all amazed, that guy made my day. We were gonna take a road trip to Orlando to see House of 1000 Corpses after we found out that was the only place it was playing within a 80 mile radius. We looked up a map and everything, but we realized it would take like 20 dollars to do that, and we didn't have 20 dollars. Good thing I was able to find it on Kazaa... So it finished dowloading and I am about to watch it. I'm not even five minutes into it and the phone rings (this is like 2:00 am mind you). I pick it up and it's Jesseca. What a surprise. Most of the time she never stays up past 9, 10 if i'm lucky. So it's crazy that she's even up this late, but awesome nevertheless. I am so glad she called me because I was getting really bored and I had just started thinking about her. It was cool as hell basically. She sounded like she was having fun at the party (or whatever it was), and that's good, i'm happy for her. She had to go because the cell phone was running out of batteries, but that's alright because i'll be seeing her tomorrow (well ya know, unless something goes terribly wrong). That brings me up to right this moment, it's 3:13 in the morning and i'm gonna try to watch House of 1000 Corpses. This should be good because whenever you watch scary movies while falling asleep your psyche is extra sensitive and these horrific images get burned into your brain; in your delirious exhaustion filled state you confuse your reality with the movie's reality and it seems like this stuff is really happening, and it makes the experience all the more terrifying. I may be scarred for life and not be able to watch horror movies anymore, but hey, that's what happens.
What the FUCK is THIS BULLSHIT! ?

How does a 10 day weekend sound to you? Because it sounds great to me. I'm so happy and excited about this that i'm wide awake even though I stayed up till 2:30 last night, and i'm not hungry even though I didn't eat anything this morning. What a glorious day. Whatever man (or woman) came up with Spring Break deserves a cookie, or even better, a donut. A Very Special Sports Report, Nobody Can Stop The Lakers: If I had any doubt that the Lakers would win the [NBA] championship for the fourth time in a row, it was completely erased last night when they beat the Sacramento Kings, they're supposed biggest rival, decisively. I have been convinced. I have seen the light. Unlike the last three years, if the Lakers don't win it all, I will be shocked and awed. When it comes down to it and you give up all your futile hopes of your favorite team winning a championship you will realize that Shaq and Kobe, and the rest of the Lakers, are simply unstoppable. Shaq is clearly the X- Factor in the NBA that no other team can even come close to. There is an equal to Kobe Bryant, at least talent wise, in the form of Tracy Mcgrady, but nobody (and I mean nobody on the face of the earth) can even come close to playing the same level of basketball as Shaquille O Neal. He is the dominator. He will dunk it on anyone in the league, and for the times when he gets double or triple teamed, he can just shoot it (and make it). His free throws have even been improved to an impressive level. Normally I would be the last person to admit this, but there can be no argument about it. Shaq can't lose. Not only do the Lakers have Shaq and Kobe, who could beat everybody on their merits alone, but everyone else on the team is good too. Many might not think so, but these people are winners. Derek Fisher, Rick Fox, Devean George, Robert Horry, and even Mark Madsen, they all know what it takes to win games, and what is most important - championships. They do their best to do their jobs to help their team, and that's more than what a lot of guys could say. Putting it all together, we have Phil Jackson as the coach and mastermind behind the whole operation. How insanely ridiculous is that? Phil Jackson, a well proven winner and the man who coached the Chicago Bulls to not one, but six NBA championships, is coaching the Lakers. Now that has to be one of the most absurd things i've ever heard of. Taking this all into consideration I would put the Laker's chances of winning it all this year at 99%. That means that everyone else has only a 1% chance of winning, combined. I am not even exaggerating here. If the Lakers played the best that they could every game of the regular season then they wouldn't lose 1 game, not even 1. Instead they like to toy with everyone else and lose a few games to get their hopes up. This season they took an even greater risk by falling far behind .500 in order to make it more exciting, they made it seem like the other teams have a chance. But let's face it, no other team has a chance, unless you consider 1% a good chance. I don't see why anybody even cheers for other teams in the NBA. It's a joke, everyone else is just there for entertainment, but nobody can compete with the Lakers. You may say "But oh, Tim Duncan...", "No, Kevin Garnett...", "Hey, Tracy Mcgrady..." What people who say stuff like that fail to realize is that those guys are good players, but they aren't winners. They may seem pretty good most of the time, but when it comes down to crunch time in the NBA finals they won't be the ones to make the game winning shot, Shaq and Kobe will. One could argue that those guy's stats are much better than either Shaq or Kobe, and they score more points, or they get more rebounds, or maybe even that they are the MVP of the league. Well MVP is just a fancy title that they give to these losers who have no hope of beating the untouchable Lakers, and Shaq said it all when he said "the only stat that counts is the W." Period. And no, I don't care about the Sacramento Queens. I can be very convincing can't I? Well there's something I learned from school - how to write a persuasive essay... I've kind of worn myself out with all that talk about basketball so I will resort to citing two more things I found on the EGM message boards. They aren't as funny this time, but I thought they were still cool, or at the least something to make you go hmm. "Extending the war into Iraq would have incurred incalculable human and political costs. We would have been forced to occupy Baghdad and, in effect, rule Iraq...Exceeding the U.N.'s mandate would have destroyed the precedent of international response to aggression we hoped to establish. Had we gone the invasion route, the U.S. could still be an occupying power in a bitterly hostile land." -George Bush Senior said this back when he was president about the Gulf War, it was in an issue of Time Magazine- I have been "Playing with Power", then "Super Power", then I "Got Into It". I did "Get N or Get Out" too, and as I speak I am "Born to play", as well as "Living in my world, and playing in Sony's." -Some kid making a joke about the past slogans for various game consoles- The first one is ironic because what he said is exactly what is happening today, and I dunno, it's kind of funny. The second one is probably only cool if you have been playing video games for your whole life, like me. Although it is missing some major ones that I can't think of at the moment, it does bring back the memories for more than a few people. There's a substitute teacher up in here and she is wigging out on us because we're playing rap music out loud and playing the Arnold Schwarzenegger sound clips over the speakers. It's funny as hell. First Arnold goes "I hope you left room for my fist because I am going to ram it into your stomach!" and she's like "I'm going to write everyone in the class up if you guys keep doing this." Then he's like "You sonofabitch!" and she's like "Oop, I warned ya, now you're all in big trouble." So we distract her by playing some rap music all loud and she goes "I will not tolerate this bologny. Rap music has to be the biggest disgrace to music in...centuries!" Then, here's the good part, an Arnold clip plays where he says "Stop whining!" Oh how I laugh at the craziness that is going on in this biotch. I will end this with the funniest thing i've heard in a long while. Jesseca was telling me about how she was watching Sorority/ Fraternity Life the other night, that's where I got this. There's a guy on the show that is a virgin and on one of the episodes he gets lucky with the stripper and has sex for the first time, and (get this) in the backround they play the song from the Jeffersons where it goes "I finally got a piece of the piiiiiie!" L O freakin L man, that is brilliant.

I have come to discover that I must be some kind of mutant, because my peripheral vision is off the charts! I can even see behind me if I turn my head ever so slightly, it's very cool. What a weird thing to talk about right off the bat... I was like totally falling asleep during first block. I usually stop myself from doing that at all costs because I like that class, but i'm just tired so I try to stay awake and pay attention. I just gave up today though and quit trying to feign consciousness. I was all laying there with my face in my book wiggin out (hardcore sleeping). I'm surprised nobody noticed, or maybe they did, because I would have no way of knowing. I slept for the rest of the period and it was really crazy when I walked out of there because I was still half asleep, I must've looked like death warmed over. I don't know why I was so tired, I didn't even go to sleep late last night. Maybe it was because Mr. Phillips wasn't there (he's on his honeymoon), and Mrs. Applebee is ugly and boring. Yeah, that's probably it. So let's see, what has happened to me recently? I had late night conversation with Justin the other night, it was like three in the morning, but it was cool. I went and saw Phone Booth with Jesseca on Friday. I didn't think I liked the movie when we were leaving the theater, but the more I think about it, the better it seemed. So I dunno, it was pretty good. I heard from a reliable source that some kid said he was gonna beat another man's shit. Now that is hilarious, think about it. "Hey! I'm gonna beat your shit!" Hardy har har. Now for a couple of interesting/ funny (I thought) quotes that I found while surfing the EGM message boards: Fear can sometimes be a useful emotion. For instance, let's say you're an astronaught on the moon and you fear that your partner has been turned into Dracula. The next time he goes out for the moon pieces, wham!, you just slam the door behind him and blast off. He might call you on the radio and say he's not Dracula, but you just say, "Think again, bat man." -Jack Handy- I can just feel my I.Q. go down 20 points each time I start up the disk and it's not exactly a good feeling. But hey, if you like football you should be able to stand it, but that's just my opinion. I don't know why I feel stupider playing the game. Maybe it has something to do with people running around smashing into each other and yelling at the other team who can run into the other team better and make grunts and clicking sounds reverting to their primal instincts of yelling, grunting, and beating the pulp out of the opposition, then making a franchise out of it with stupid people who smear colored paint all over their bodies and tip cars over and beat the pulp out of each other and so on and so on... I just don't find that entertaining, or any video games based off this activity entertaining. Each game feels the same and is the same to me. -Some kid talking Madden 2003 and other sports games- I laughed my ass off when I first read those, i'm not sure why but they just struck me funny I guess. Especially the second one. And i'm spent.

I find it kind of funny, I find it kind of sad, the dreams in which i'm dying are the best i've ever had. No i'm not going to kill myself or anything, that's a line from a song that I like. Whether that means i'm crazy or not is up for debate, but I don't think so, I just like the song... What's my story for today? Hmm, it's pretty easy. I came, I saw, I slept. I went to school in an awkward mood because I stayed up until three in the morning the night before playing Final Fantasy 7 . Cool game by the way, i'm almost done with it. Anyways, I was stumbling around school and laughing at everyone and everything. This has come to be a familiar routine for me, I think i've had just about enough of school for one year. Chris and Mike came home with me today. We fooled around with some playing cards and laughed at small stupid things for an hour or so, then Chris's mom picked them up. Jesseca called me soon after and we talked forever, like an hour and a half. It was a pretty good conversation I thought, even though it was about some odd things at times. It's always like that, and I never cease to enjoy it. After that my memory fails me, but I think I fell asleep not too much later. I slept until like 10:30 at night. I woke up, walked to the kitchen, and listened to my mom tell me how she's been waiting all day for me to wake up so I could eat. She also told me not to stay up too late and to take a shower, I did neither. So I ate the scraps they saved for me, 2 fish patties and some mashed potatoes. Then I talked to my sister in the kitchen for a long time about some kids at her school. We went to my room because she wanted to look in my yearbook for some people she knew. We ended up looking at the yearbook for about 30 minutes. She laughed at a picture of someone crazy looking or pointed out someone that was pretty, and I explained that I knew them, and told her their story. That's how it went pretty much the whole time. That brings me to right about now. It's 12:30 am and i'm sitting here writing in my journal and listening to music. I'm in a weird mood so all i'm listening to is either sad songs or love songs because both kinds are usually slow and heartfelt, which is the kind of stuff i'm in the mood for. I downloaded that song on Ricky's journal Goodnight Elizabeth by the Counting Crows, it's pretty good. I like it when people put songs that they've been listening to on their journals because then I get to hear some of their favorite songs and I usually end up liking them as well. The good news is that's not the only good song i've discovered tonight. No no, the real treat was found in the traffic section of Kazaa, freshly downloaded (by my sister assumedly). It's a badass country song by Blake Shelton called Austin I Still Love You . To be honest, i've never heard of the guy or the song in my life. So I didn't really know what to expect when I started listening to it, but it turned out pretty darn good. I loved it actually, everyone should listen to it. I don't know if this is a popular or well liked song among the country music circles, but I sure like it. It might even be a little old, and if so people will probably be like "man that song's old", but I don't care about how old a song is. It's new to me you farts. Now it is time for me to listen to more music and then go to bed, goodnight pals.
What's so funny you have to wake me up at five o clock in the morning? I'm gonna find yo bloodtype.
Guess what? No, not chicken butt. My dad said i'm gonna turn into a Pizza Roll if I keep eating them all the time. That's crazy huh! Laugh!

There is little that annoys me more than casual gamers and people that play stupid rap music during class, and this class has an overabundance of both. I guess that's why everyone in here calls me Papa Dock The Taskmaster... Ah i'm just rambling so go to my website, it's funny.

Mmmm, i'm hungry, what shall I eat? Let's see here, we have Pepperoni Pizza Rolls, Pepperoni Flavored Hot Pockets, or microwaveable Pepperoni Pizzas. What a selection. I swear that's all we have to eat in this house, lol. I stayed home from school today for the third day in a row. Yes Jesseca, I didn't go to school. The funny thing is i'm not sick. I was totally expecting to go to school, but instead I went to the doctor. Hey, no complaints here. I know i'm gonna be royally screwed when I go back to school tomorrow, but meh, that's not until tomorrow. So I went to the doctor for no reason and I was kind of worried that she would just be like "uh...you're not sick..." and that's pretty much what she said, except she said it in doctor terms. It was funny. I always feel weird going to the doctor anyways because I still go to the kid doctor and when I go there's always like six little toddlers running around in the play area, and there I am all large, they're probably thinking "what is this kid doing here?" Oh well, those little kids can bite the big one for all I care. I have a whole free day ahead of me and I have a couple of things I need to do. For one I need to finish reading A Man Like Mac , a book that Chris threw at me when I was leaving his house one day. From the back of the book it sounded kind of interesting so I decided I would read it. I started it last night at like 12:30 and I read for like three hours. I'm more than halfway through it right now, so I should be able to finish it up in about 3 more hours. I'll save judgement on it until then, but right now it's not looking very promising. It's either shorter than I thought or I can read faster than I used to be able to. Probably the latter because it's a three hundred pager. It is a little small in dimensions though, so I dunno (but I also don't care). After I finish reading that book I think I might take the time and update my website with some links and crazy writings of mine, like "Da Script" 1 & 2. It's about time. About my journal yesterday, the part about the S-10: I don't know when everyone started hating S-10s with a passion, but damn, a lot of people wigged out about me not getting one. I would rather get an F-150 for sure, but I don't know if i'll be able to because of money. The main reason I would get an S-10 is because it's the only thing in a first car price range that is a little cool - that I can think of. I didn't want to say Ranger because Louie already has one, so I figured I would get the Chevy counterpart. Plus I saw some really sweet ones on cardomain.com directly before writing the journal, so that influenced me greatly, along with my urge to quote the kid who once said "pure chevy power." I would really like to get a Corolla, but I don't know if I can do that either. If you guys really care that much, you can choose my car for me, because I don't like anything besides Vipers, Ferraris, F-350s, Dakotas, Lancer Evolutions (which they don't have in America, so you must import them for around 50,000 dollars), Bentlys, and other stuff like that. Give me some suggestions, and if it's cool i'll force my parents to get it. That is all.

It's awesome rocking the hoodie sweatshirt on a warm day. You can't even argue about that one. I have discovered the secret to success: owning a Chevy S-10. Pimped out or not, those things are the shiznit. I won't say i'm definitely getting one for fear of being one of those assholes that say they're getting a certain type of car and talk about it all the time then change their mind at the last minute, but I will say that it is the car (or truck I should say) I hope to get. Everyone loves trucks, and after careful study I have determined that S-10's are the ones that people like the most. For me it's not a follow the crowd sort of thing, it's more of a S-10's kick all kinds of ass kind of thing. The main benefit of having an S-10 is being able to say "pure Chevy power" all the time, I look forward to it.

I'm sick, again. And I stayed home from school, again. It's not all bad though, I did get to beat the wonderful Jak and Daxter . One last thing before I end this tiny, tiny journal. I'm lovin all the April Fools jokes that everyone on the internet (and elsewhere) came up with. I remember last year's very well and I didn't think anyone would try to compete with them because they were so good, but they did. My thanks go to all the people who like to celebrate the great April Fools day, it's one of my faves as well.
I have now officially come down with the sickness. It's gay. Whoever invented diseases can suck a fuck.

What a goofy day... Good thing I know that loneliness can be fun; otherwise I would be wiggin out. There's nobody here but me. My parents rode out on the hog and Amber and Chas are with Karley and Dan, respectively. I'm just chillin out / making a cd with the Bittersweet Symphony on it, because I love that song. I do miss Jesseca, but I called her three times at 4, so I don't know what she's doin. I fixed my Kazaa (yes!), and as a result I am revitalized through the joy of music. I don't even know if that made sense... It doesn't matter either way, because i'm leavin. Goodbye.

"I hate loosing," that's what i've been saying over and over for these last 10 minutes. Not really, but you can imagine what it would be like if I did... I've been playing this tard-ass hockey game all morning and I went like 4-10-1 for the season so I just gave up. The difficulty was set on medium and I still got my ass handed to me very badly. Now I guess i'm forced to put the difficulty level down one notch to "easy," and absolutely destroy every single team that stands in my way. I can personally guarantee that I won't lose one game. Not that that's cool or anything (I know I suck at the game), it will just make me feel better. Compared to today, last night was crazy as a freakatron. Actually, compared to any day last night was weird. I hung out with Louie all day and we had a bunch of misadventures. I'm not sure where to begin really, since it's hard to remember how the day started out, but i'll try. Oh yeah, and I will bar out all the boring stuff, because, well, it is boring... We started off the day doing some skits for CRYK; the likes of which include dancing around a fire and putting a hot knife through butter. Before I knew it, Jesseca called me from work and we made plans to hang out after she got off of work (in about an hour). So Louie and I went to his house to get some money, plus it would burn some time. Afterwards we went to Tony's and rented some movies, because I told Jesseca I was going to do so. I ended up walking out with Hellraiser II , Footloose , and Crouching Tiger Hidden Dragon in hand. A pretty good selection I thought. When I got home I called Jesseca and nobody answered. I waited like 20 minutes until I tried again. This time her little sister picked up and wouldn't let me talk to her. I got all mad after that so Louie called twice claiming to be different people and one of the times her mom picked up and said she got in trouble for backtalking or something. I didn't really buy it, but whatever. Even if nobody wants to give me an explanation as to why I can't hang out with my girlfriend after we made plans already, there was not much else I could do about it. I got over that pretty quickly because I figured there was no use dwelling over the unfortunate. As the alternative to my prior plans, I ventured with Louie out to Cody's house in OBC. I'm still not sure who this Cody girl is, I guess it's some 8th or 9th grade chick who's sister was getting her system wired up by Louie. In any case, it ranked pretty high in the craziness factor. The tall skinny Brandon Smith was there along with some other queefnob, and they were both wiggin out. They asked if Louie's system was loud and he said "louder than you can handle." Louie then took one of the little gweets for a ride around the block to show him how loud it was and when the kid came back he was wiggin out about how sweet Louie's car was. He also thought Louie had NOS, and I laughed at that. I laughed at them some more and stole a knife from that girl's car and then we left. We were getting some gas at the Valero gas station when Louie started talking to some random kooks. They said they were looking for girls, so Louie made fun of them for looking in this part of town. He then offered to show them to a place where they could find some -- Oceanwalk. The kid's car was a souped up Honda Prelude, and it was admittedly badass. Besides that though, the duo had nothing going for them. They were wearing faded clothes, bobo shoes, and frankly, they were crazy looking. Not that I am an authority on fashion or anything, but come on, they were wiggin. Perhaps worst of all, they were from Chicago. Actually it's not that bad there, that was just a lame attempt to make one of those things they call jokes. But anyway, the drive to Oceanwalk was a fun one. Mostly because we saw Jose (the Angela Chieppa lover), and he tried to race us. He almost crashed into some car while switching lanes and it was just funny to see him try to compete. He probably didn't realize that the Chicago maniacs were packin NOS. When we got to Oceanwalk we talked to them for like 2 seconds and parted ways. We saw them again like 5 minutes later and we ran. While I was running I yelled, "I'm from Chicago, HAHAHA!" really freakin loud and they were way closer than I thought so they probably heard me. If so, they didn't say anything, because we talked to them one more time and they just shook our hands and stuff. I didn't really wanna touch their hands, but oh well, what're ya gonna do? When we were goin back to the car I saw Amanda and Ian (don't know their last names but they're Jesseca's friends). I was hoping I didn't see Jesseca there, because that would totally contradict what her mom said. Thankfully I didnt, but I did see her amigos. After that fiasco with those fags we were in the mood to ride around the boardwalk area and flaunt the bass heavy system. We did that for maybe 20 minutes before these girls pulled up and yelled some shit at us. It turned out Louie knew them so they said to meet us at the Valero station. They wanted to get drunk, but they had to be home in an hour (and I don't drink...), so we just got in their car and went for a ride. The two girls were Sabrina Goodner and Erin Love. Sabrina has been in a few of my classes, but I never talked to her. Erin I didn't know at all; I wouldn't even know her name if Louie didn't tell me it. Back to the story though: when we were riding around Margot and her gang pulled up beside us and asked who was in the back seat. It was funny as hell because Sabrina was like Louie Garafolo and Dave. They were like "Dave who?" and she was like "...Dave." She forgets that nobody knows who the hell I am, lol. We continued the drive out to Williamson, where we turned onto some crazy dirt road. I never expected it to be the craziest rally trail ever, but it was. It was so crazy when we rode through it because there were large ass bumps and dips galore and we were ridin out in a (Honda??) Tiburon. The front end was getting annhilated as it smashed into the ground like 20,000 times. We were going pretty fast too, and all the while listening to "Hey kitty kitty" (that song by the 69 Boys or whatever). Needless to say, it was the most insane thing i've done in a very long time. The fact that we were in the back seat of a car with some kooks that I didn't know made it much cooler than it should have been. After that funnyness we went back to Louie's car and went home to my house. We decided we weren't finished yet so we took a walk up to 7-11 to get some food or something. On the way there we nigger knocked Justin's old house to an extreme. I walked up there and screamed "I AIN'T NEVER SCARED!!!" at the top of my lungs and banged on the door like a madman with both fists. I'm usually not one for exaggeration, but it was the wildest thing ever. At 7-11 we got a buttload of snack food and some Amp to keep us awake. You will never guess who pulled up when we were eating outside on the curb -- the infamous Chris Sox and the aforementioned Ian. At first I wasn't sure if it was them because i've seen that kid once and the other kid barely twice, but I am 99% sure now because they said "yeah that's him," as they walked by. The fags didn't say anything, but I laughed at their appearance. Out of all the kooks in the world that I could see in the parking lot of 7-11, I had to see them. It was funny though. Me and Louie then went home and dropped off our stuff so we could go niggerknocking some more. Before it was all said and done, we got Wendy Naumann and Tommy Eckenrode's old houses. It was pretty funny. We were pretty much done after that, but we couldn't get to sleep forever because we drank that Amp. We pranked called Chris 3 times and wigged out. I guess that got all of the hyperness out of our system because we fell asleep shortly after that. And that, my friends, is game over. Sorry for that long ass trash. I know it was longer than fuck itself and more boring than your grandma's stories, but I felt like talking about my day for once, and this one just happened to be really eventful. I apologize once again for wasting your time, because I know that was dumb. But what I wanna know is, where is Jesseca at? I miss her.

I'm strong in my convictions and don't you forget it. So I saw The Matrix Reloaded directly after school today and it was awesome. I was really hoping this one didn't suck, and I had a feeling it was going to. Good thing it didn't. The story has managed to once again blow my mind with its scope and depth, the action was breathtaking as I expected, and this sequel has even surpassed the original as far as i'm concerned. I am trying hard not to ruin anything for anybody, but I will say that it's worth your money, just go and see it. You can thank me later. Um oh yeah and did I mention that the Lakers lost? Yep, in an event that is sure to turn the sports world upside down, the Spurs have toppled the three time defending world champion Lakers in game 6, in a very decisive manner; 110 - 82 was the final score. All I can say is wow. I never thought I would see it. Pigs must be flying, and i'm sure that hell has frozen over, because this is crazy. To top it off, half the Lakers team was crying towards the end of the game. What an amazing sight to see, a bunch of grown men crying over a basketball game, i'm glad I witnessed it. I would be surprised to see any one of them cry, but since it was Kobe Bryant himself, it made it all the more incredible to watch. Honestly, I laughed my butt off at these cryin kooks. I was glad to see that big Shaq didn't shed a tear. As Chris said, "He doesn't care." I do care though, i've hated those damn Lakers for a long time now and i'm happy to see them finally get thrashed for a change. Maybe that'll teach em. Speaking of being thrashed, I seem to be on a hot streak with the videogames as of late. I nearly beat Tekken Tag Tournament at the arcade with only 1 credit. I got to the final boss and I had her beat, but she got me with some cheap blows near the end and I let it slip away. But still, winning 10 rounds in a row is not too shabby, especially after you consider that I accidentally picked my first character and was forced to use some kook the whole way through. To make up for it I have been beating down Louie left and right at all these games. I beat him at Knockout Kings twice in a row and then Blitz at my house once and then again today at the arcade. That's what happens when you challenge me. Just for everybody's info - I had great fun in each of the brutal beatings. You want some more Louie? Then don't sing it, bo-ring it .

I always do this with big movies that I want to see a lot; I think it helps me concentrate and actually watch the movie, more so than when i'm with my friends. Louie will probably want to go though, so maybe he will come. He just better be quiet, because i'm gonna Justin out. I'll just have to pound those out even though i'll be wiggin about The Matrix. I won't be seeing Jesseca as much as I planned this weekend, which sucks the chrome off of a trailer hitch. On the bright side, I will be able to finally beat Mario Sunshine, since playing it sporadically isn't cutting it. Good thing too, because i've had enough of that game already. It's time for me to obey the commands of this schlepp of a teacher who is also known as Mrs. Parlade. She's been badgering me to do something all day so I better go before she slaps my ass. Later fiends.

Louie just informed me that some nigger dude slapped a female chink. It does not get much funnier than that. Random kid who was near me and talking to his friend as I walked to lunch: I would only... if I was shit drunk. Me: Shit drunk is not a thing, you are wigging out. Kid: So? Me: So???! What the fuck. (Followed by me laughing.) Now that I got that little anecdote out of the way, I will have a rambling session for the ages. Kind of like in that movie Rules of Attraction where the guy gives his fast talking and quick moving account of his trip to Europe. That was probably the coolest scene in that movie, it cracked me up. Haven't seen Rules of Attraction ? Too bad... I'm gonna slap her ass in the face just like that nigger did to that chink. If she asks me the reason i'm gonna be like, "You put your book on my mouse and when you do that it takes away my full range of motions, and we all know what happens when you take away my full range of motions - I get angry, and you wouldn't like me when i'm angry. Yes that's a reference to The Hulk and yes i'm wigging out, but you can't talk because you just got slapped." Now, believe it or not, there are some other things on my mind. I don't even feel like I should mention this, but Jesseca signed off on me in a rude manner last night and wouldn't tell me what was bothering her, and I hate it when she does both of those things. The funny thing is I wasn't mad about it because I knew she was mad/ sad and if we were both that way then we would both be screwed. So I wrote her this long drawn out email trying to explain that I loved her and I would like to apologize about anything if it had to do with me. Basically that's all I was trying to say. That was directed towards you Jesseca , if you happen to be reading this, and I love you . Not to try and take away the sincerity of the current situation, but the show must go on. I finally had the privilege of watching Doggy Fizzle Televizzle last night after I downloaded it off Kazaa. For the uninformed, that is Big Snoop Dogg's new TV show, and it rocks your ass. If you haven't already seen it, that show is great. It was very funny to me, and it seems to bode well among my friends as well. The humor is definitely not for everyone, but I love the Snoop Dogg craziness. I especially liked the skit where he was teaching those second grade kids some crazy stuff, it was crackin me up. Everything else was cool too, making the show pretty good overall. I am a little worried about the kooks running out of ideas after this action packed foray into TV land, but if they can keep it up then it will turn out to be an awesome show indeed. The presentation actually looks considerably low budget, but I think that helps the gangsta style; you could even say i'm impressed by the freshness of it. Enough about that Dizzle Fo Shizzle My Nizzle :) I also stayed up late last night watching a very good basketball game between the San Antonio Spurs and the Los Angeles Lakers. What a nerve wracking game, specifically near the end. It was almost exactly like the Kings - Lakers game 4 last year where Horry hit a three at the buzzer to win by one, but this time, he missed. Luckily for the Spurs, that shit went in and out, but he was wide open. This surprising Spurs win put the Lakers' backs against the proverbial wall, as they hold a 3-2 series deficit. Everyone still expects the Lakers to win it in 7, and although I can't disagree, I think you should always watch out for the underdog. In any case, these next two games (or game) should be exciting as hell. Last but certainly not least, I will talk about E3. If you don't know what E3 is, I don't blame you because it is rather obscure to people who aren't video game enthusiasts. The only thing it could really be compared to for me is Christmas. That's how big of a deal it is. It stands for Electronic Entertainment Expo and it is basically a convention where all the video game companies, hardware and software, come together and show off all their latest projects, make all their bombshell announcements, and otherwise cause mass histeria within the gaming scene. To me, that equates to games games games, and it's the time of year when everything video game related comes alive. There are all kinds of badass games that we previously knew nothing about being unveiled, and the ones we knew a little about are being playtested by editors who are passing their opinions on to us. Not only that but there are mountains of videos and screenshots and info on almost every game coming out within in the next 1, 2, 3, or even 4 years. It rocks shit. Justin and I were talking about how we wouldn't be able to read and see all this stuff even if we stayed up all night. And this is only the beginning. Right now we're just getting the early leaks of news, while the actual show begins on Friday. It's that crazy. However, I can imagine a lot of people not caring about any of this, so I will stop talking about it now. Besides, I think I have geeked out enough for one whole year. Don't fret though, there will probably be more geekiness to come as the week progresses and I freak out even more about videogames. Before you go, check out the crazy quote below (lol that rhymed). It never ceases to make me laugh when said out loud, so go ahead and say it out loud...then laugh. Then leave my site fucker. "You guys wanna smoke some drugs?" - the skinny kook from Road Trip
Hahaha, I just walked into the kitchen and called my sister and her friend "Cocopuff hoes" for no apparent reason. It was funny as hell. Ya know, if you're me... Jesseca is the pimp .

If I voted for Al Gore back in the presidential election of 2000, I would be pretty mad. I'm talkin Pre Menstrual Syndrome mad, because even though the man I voted for got the majority of the votes, he did not win. As for why I'm talking about the 2000 election, I don't really know. I thought about it last night out of nowhere, because i'm just cool like that. Oh yeah, and if anyone thinks I like Al Gore or hate Bush or something - you're wrong. I just have an odd sense of humor, everyone should know this by now... A good man once said "Great writing is clear thinking made visible," and KoolKellyBelly's LiveJournal is the total opposite of this assessment, seriously. Last night I read it for the first time and it was the weirdest thing i've read in a while. There was like zero use of capital letters at the beginning of sentences (if there was any sentences...), no punctuation whatsoever, and a bunch of jibber jabber that didn't make very much sense. I could barely read most of it due to lack of continuity, and I lost my place several times in those gigantic masses of words. Paragraphs were invented for a reason, use them. I also advise her to not write so much when it is about nothing. It's all about the quality, not quantity. There is some funny stuff to be had in there as well, but not the good funny. She talks about doing some insane stuff to Matt Tower because he treats Jenna bad, and it's all elaborate and crazy. If I were him I would tell her to stay up out my bizzness / bizznass repeatedly, Ludacris style. There is also some talk about a dream she had, which is the thing that inspired me to write this the most, because it is caraazzzyy. But be careful, reading it will change your life. And Kelly, if you're reading this, there was no offense meant towards ya, but your journal is crazy. I'm thinkin it was either Johnny B Bad (the wrestler) or Prince (the crazy asshole), but it was probably neither... you see the kind of boredom that I am forced to suffer through. I kind of skipped out of all the Mother's Day activities today and yesterday and I probably should be feeling bad about it, but right now i'm not really sweatin it. I wasn't in a good mood at all, so these people shouldn't expect me to try and make other people happy. It's alright though because nobody has said anything to me about it, maybe later. This ain't no watered down version either, I will tell you that right now. From what i've seen from videos and pictures and from what i've read as well, that car is fuckin awesome. I give you my phone number and when you worry call me, I make you happy." - Bobby McFerrin, who later killed himself.

As recently as three hours ago I was not into movies; it had gotten to the point where it was a struggle to just sit through them without my wind wandering off on some tangent. I'm not sure why this was, as I have been into them very much in the past. I guess I got caught up in other things such as the excitement of filming of our new video, the dullness of going to school, and the thrill hanging out with Jesseca. Whatever the reason was, I just seemed to have lost interest in them. That all changed today after I watched Chasing Amy . I don't know how I went so long without seeing this movie. Especially since I have been a Kevin Smith fan for at least 6 years now. In any case, this movie has breathed a breath of fresh air into me. I have once again figured out why I love the movies. That being said, I have three little reviews for the movies that I rented from Tony's on Wednesday (yes, they are overdue). I will go in order from worst to best because I figured I would do as that lady says in that one song and "save the best for last." Here we go. C.H.U.D. - Oh my god, what a steaming pile of dog doodoo this is. If you take the worst idea you can think of, put it into movie form, and inject it with the downright ugliest actors you have ever seen, all the cheesiness you can muster, the worst filming locations in the world, and horrible directing, you get this horrifying disaster of a movie. This is very likely the most unwatchable and least entertaining movie ever made. Never in my wildest dreams could I imagine that a movie could be this bad. Steel Magnolias - I didn't really watch this movie because being in the presence of Jesseca fills me with joy and makes me unable to pay attention to such things as TV sets, but I did look at the screen for a lot of it and I even followed some of the story. What I took from it was this: There are some movies made solely for the female audience, and this is one of them. I think I would like this movie and think it was great, funny and sad... if I was a girl. But alas, I am not. So I may sound sexist or whatnot by saying this (and I assure you that i'm not), but this is a chick-flick in its purest form. Not that there is anything wrong with that. And make no mistake about the placing of this film in the paragraph, this movie is a hell of a lot better than C.H.U.D. , even to guys. Chasing Amy - I think I have already made it quite clear that I liked this movie, so that is a given. Now I will just tell you some of the reasons why. First of all I loved the directing. I'm not talking about nice cinematography, flashy special effects, or intriguing camera angles. Rather, I was impressed by the more simplistic things about the directing. This should come as no surprise; seeing that Kevin Smith was behind it. The sheer number of jokes and the overall depth and volume of his movies overwhelmes me, and the simple fact that he accomplishes such feats in writing and film-making makes me aspire to be as good as him someday. Enough ass kissing for now though, and back to the narrower subject of Chasing Amy . There was a good story to be told, and it involved plenty of comic books, mentions of dick and fart jokes, and Jay and Silent Bob. Additionally, that pair of kooks, coupled with the ever hilarious antics of Jason Lee, provided a satisfying comedic experience that had me laughing my ass off on more than a few occasions. And perhaps best of all, Chasing Amy appealed to the mushy wussy inside of me, and if you know me well, that is a pretty big slice of the Davey Boy pie. To sum it up, these are the kinds of movies I like, and as far as movies go, this is what's it all about.
Cops suck, handcuffs suck, this weekend sucks, you suck.
"Tis better to remain silent and appear a fool, than to speak and remove all doubt" - Some philosopher guy, I suspect.

*Guy walks into gay bar and sees a bunch of half nude male strippers dancing all over poles and stuff* He Responds, "Man this is gay as hell!" Oh man that craziness gets me every time. My sister always tells me about that and I laugh my face off. I think it's from the movie Chasing Amy . I think i'm gonna rent that tonight because it's the only Kevin Smith film I haven't seen, and all the other ones are sweet, so ya know. I'm also getting Steel Magnolias because it is Jesseca's favorite movie, meaning it is probably good. If not then I still need to see it so I can make my own judgement on it. Since the deal is 3 movies for 3 days for 3 dollars, this leaves me room to get one more movie. I'm not sure what that will be yet, but the leading candidate is C.H.U.D. because it has the craziest name ever and I have been wanting to know what it's about for a long time. All this movie watching should fun because I have been bored as a bow-legged nutlicker for most of this week and all of these movies will probably be crazy as hell (read: not good).

Me: I am the President of the United States of America. Fucklick McDinner: Dave, you are ear delicious. Me: Whaaaaaaaat? You see that conversation up there? Yeah, it never happened. But my shoe is untied and I am wearing the smallest shirt known to mankind, if that counts. What is with me hating everything people love and loving everything people hate? I don't know about the second half of the question, as I can't think of any examples of me loving some craziness... The first part however, is right on target. I went and saw X-Men 2 on Friday with Jesseca and I thought it sucked. Not only did I think it sucked, I thought it was boring, slow paced, and confusing. I wasn't alone on this one either, Jesseca agreed with me. I'm starting to think that maybe we didn't watch it close enough, because everyone under the sun seems to have loved it. Justin wigged out about it hardcore, so did pretty much everyone on the EGM boards, as did Howard Stern and his gang. It even has a rating close to 8.0 on IMDB.com, and that means it probably doesn't suck. I still haven't heard anyone share my opinion on it. Oh well, screw them for now, but I will watch it again sometime and make my final decision. It deserves at least another look since it has gotten all this positive feedback. Oh yeah, and while we're on the subject - Coldstone is the gayest trash of all time. I can't say much about what i'm doing after school today because it involves CRYK, and that is a top secret project, as i'm sure you've figured out already. I can tell ya something though. If not a lot of stuff goes down today I will spend some time making additions to my website, and have up around 8 new pages before the night is over. That will be cool if I get it done. But for now I leave.
Black, white, revenge of the hittites... The story of my life.
