I have some wacked out news for all you buttcrack lovers. Lucky you. Both of these stories involve slightly obscure actors, but I know who they are and I was shocked by this stuff. So without further adieu... You know Casper from the movie Kids? His real name was Justin Pierce. He was also in Next Friday. He was the guy that worked at the record store, he wore a pink shirt and talked to the dog when he was high. Well he's dead. He hung himself in some hotel in Las Vegas shortly after filming Next Friday. I just found that out yesterday and I was wiggin out. It happened so long ago too. Why didnt I hear about this earlier? There's one more thing that I read about yesterday. You know the Dell guy? His name was Ben Curtis and he went by Steven in the Dell commercials. He's dead too... Just kiddin, he's still alive. He was just arrested and charged with possession of marijuana. I thought that was kind of funny. You could always tell the kid was a stoner. We have a sub in here today so it's basically a free day, which is sweet. These kids were just arguing about all things associated with pro basketball. I didn't opt to give my 2 cents about anything, but I listened to their observations and even lauged at a couple of these kooks. Everyone had their different opinions on everything and nobody really agreed about much, so I can't say there was a big following of any of the teams. The one thing that stood out was when Mr. Gerald Pop and some other negro were arguing about who was better between Tracy McGrady or Allen Iverson and Pop said that " McGrady would put his nuts all over Iversons forehead " and "he would dunk all over his little ass." I will have to agree with him that one, McGrady is the MVP. I just heard some obscene language coming out of the speakers of some computer behind me and I think "Oh man, that kid is gonna get in big trouble." Then I turn around to see the crazy ass substitute teacher at the computer playing all these clips of people cussing. The weirdest thing about it is that the guy is laughing histerically, he's like slapping his knee and stuff. It makes you wonder what this world is coming to... No it doesn't.
I don't feel like writing today, nor do I have the time, so let me just tell ya that I spent all day yesterday with Jesseca at Disneyworld and it was fricking EXCELLENT. Period.

Oh yeah baby. Me and Jesseca are goin to Disneyworld all day tomorrow. I am so crunked about this shit dawg (make sure not to take the thug wiggage too seriously though). Anyway, what I said is true. I got a whole bunch of these free tickets from my cousin Sherry a long time ago because she works at a radio station and I dunno, they give that kind of stuff out all the time. The funny thing is, out of the 6 that we had, only two of them didn't expire by now. Leave it to us [my crazy family] to ruin a perfectly good oppurtunity to scam Disney out of money. Since my birthday was on Tuesday, my parents decided that they would just let Jesseca and I go to Disney with the passes... However, backround stories are for wieners, so enough about that. These tickets are friggin park hoppers, and you know what that means. Yep, we get to have our choice of going to Magic Kingdom, MGM Studios, Epcot, Animal Kingdom, or any combination thereof. I'm thinkin we're not gonna go to Epcot because frankly, it's not really that cool there. Animal Kingdom seems to be out of the picture as well because I have never been there and I don't think we would have enough time to explore everything and go to the other places that we wanna go. So i'm thinkin we should start off at Magic Kingdom and go on the cool stuff all early, like Space Mountain and Splash Mountain, and maybe even the Dumbo ride. Then for the latter half of the day we can go to MGM Studios and ride the Tower of Terror (which is sweet! for a Disney ride). Also at MGM is the Star Wars ride, and everybody knows I love the Star Wars. I'm probably forgetting to mention a lot of cool stuff about Disney, and that's a good thing because i'll be surprised when I see it all tomorrow. Alright friends, I don't have much else to say, so I think i'm leavin now. Disney for life baby... and always remember -- If you're gonna be dumb, you gotta be tough. P.S. (post script, I just learned that *wink wink*) I am supposed to be bringing 2 disposable cameras with me on our trip tomorrow, so hopefully I will get lots and lots of sweet pictures. Who cares if the quality is bad on those things? Not me, that's fo sho.
It's my birthday and i'll cry if I want to. Party. Party. Party. lol Jess.
Who are the jahosafats, and why are they always jumpin? That's what I wanna know...

"I need you now tonight; I fuckin need you more than ever." - the radically kooky singer in Old School . That was definitely the saying of the night. You would have to see the movie to know what i'm talking about though. But if you did see it, oh my god, you would laugh your buttocks off your body. Wow. People talk about stuff being weird all the time, but what they say is weird is not weird. I'll tell ya what's weird. Tonight was friggin weird . That's what. It began with... actually I don't even know how it began, but I do know how it ended up. It ended up with Chris, Louie, Kelly, Taira, and myself all wigging out far into the morning hours. We have been up for the longest time now just doing nothing really except watching tv and talking about the music videos featuring black people. And of course there was a lot of talk about going to McDonalds to get some food, but that plan never came into fruition, humorously enough. Right now i'm at Louie's house struggling to stay awake as he peacefully sleeps in his room. We left Kelly's house about an hour ago for no reason really; we just didn't want to stay there. I imagine Chris and Taira are making out right about now; not that I care. Good for them I say. I don't think Louie would like the thought of that very much, but if not, then it's still ok because it will be no big deal when he wakes up in about 4 hours. Or maybe it will, but it's of no concern to me. I am kind of freaking out at the moment because I haven't slept in over 19 1/2 hours. Not even a little bit. It may not sound like very long, but believe me, it's enough to wear out the best of em. I am usually quite the nighthawk in these situations. Currently though, I see no point in staying awake. I do have one crazy story before I hit the hay for the night (well, for the morning). Chris and I were climbing across this chasm in Kelly's backyard in order to get to this other dock. We had to jump across a 2 foot gap and cross over a fence to get to the point where we were at. Even then it was fairly difficult because there was a ditch in front of the fence that we didn't know about at first; plus Chris had a cast on. Well anyway, after we slowly hauled along to this stone thingy, Louie came charging in behind us going all fast and jumping the gap like it was nothing. When he got to the fence, however, it was a different story. He was coming so fast and he didn't calculate the jump at all, and most importantly, he didn't see the ditch that laid in front of the platform that we were standing on. He came and jumped up, his foot caught on the fence, he busted his ass all over the place, and plunged elbow and hip first onto the hard cement below. At first the urge to laugh was almost overwhelming, but then we calmed down a little because he wasn't saying anything or moving at all. We were a little relieved when he got up and said some craziness, but mostly we just wanted to let out our bottled up laughter. And laugh we did. It was funny as a 1 legged monkey in a pie eating contest. Actually it was probably funnier than that if you can imagine a thing that could be so funny. End of story. I don't know if that read very funny, but that crap was hilarious in real life so I don't care. Alright, excuse my abrubtness, but I am leaving now. There is not much I have to say to any of you sardine cans. I do have something to say to Jesseca though, that is if she even reads this thing anymore... Jesseca, L is for the way you look at me. O is for the only one I see. V is very, very extraordinary E is for everything that I adore. and love, was made for me and you. (do do do dooby da do, whoo!) I don't know if that's really how it goes, but I would be happy to find out and sing it to you for real anytime you want. Because like you, that song rocks. and as always, I love you. If you're reading this and you're not Jesseca, I can imagine how you might think (or wish) I am talking to you. That's simply not true though, I am talking to Miss Jesse. That's right, you heard me, I don't love you, I love Jesseca. I repeat -- I love Jesseca .

The Wizard Of Oz is the scariest movie ever made. I always used to get freaked out by the wicked witch of the west. That's about it for now, but there's a lot of stuff on my mind, so i'll probably write a lot of stuff whenever I get the time. I'd say you can count on it tomorrow.

Auto Response from Garaputo316: I am outside standing in the rain, legs spread wide with my arms stretched towards the sky. My hands are tightly gripping a mighty sword as I scream "I have the powwwweeeerrrr!!!!" You see, I am attempting to get struck by lightning so that it will seem as if I am the great He-Man. Even if it only lasts for a split second, it will be crazy as hell. That's what my away message said for a little while today. You guys thought I was joking, I was serious. Except I had a pole and not a sword... but who the heck has a sword nowadays **coughJustincough**. I'm on some He-Man kick after watching Masters of the Universe . The movie wasn't cool or anything, but when Dolph Lundgren yelled "I have the power!" I remembered the part from the old show where he would lift his sword in the air and lightning would strike it. Then I remembered when Charlie Wagner imitated it with a metal baseball bat and I laughed for a half hour straight. It was pretty crazy when I did it, but I had no luck with the lightning strike, sadly. After that little endeavor I walked up to 7-11 to buy some Sour Bright Crawlers. I ended up staying there for a while reading an Import Tuner magazine. When I left the guy made fun of me for staying in there too long. I just laughed. It could've been worse; I could've stayed in there much longer, but I decided to leave before I seemed like a kook. Apparently I already looked like one. It's ok though, next time I will stay in there all day reading all the magazines and eating all the food -- and I won't pay for it. Wuahaha. Yep, I'm wiggin. My dad said that we're going to work at 3 o clock this morning and I was like "AM?" and he's like "yeah." The funny thing is he's not playing around. That's how we do it around here yo. The workin don't stop till 7 in the mornin.

Mmmm. I'm currently enjoying a fantastic meal from McDonald's fast food service. It encompasses a Double Cheeseburger, a Hot n' Spicy McChicken, an Apple Pie, and a large cup of Coca Cola Classic. I don't know why she would think that... seriously. There are so many counter arguments to her mom's claim that I won't even list them all, but let it be known that it sucks. Speaking of Jesseca, me and her are going to the mall Sunday to do some much needed school shopping. Her infamous mother has once again foiled my plans, however, and is only going to let us stay there for 2 hours. Because of course she has to take us, even though I will have my license by then. But if I don't get to spend the rest of the day with my girly girl, I will be mad. I uhhh, updated my website, if anyone cares to see it. You can also search for Dave's Hell Palace on Yahoo, Google, and assumedly any other major search engine and you will find that my site has been taken to the top of the searching food chain and it will now get hits from more crazy people than ever. Quite an interesting development if I do say so myself... Chris should be coming over any minute now to get his shit. I dont know if he's staying the night again or what, but I guess it would be fun if he did, because I am pretty bored. But anyway, I'm getting in the shower now so I can cleanse my sexy body. Care to join me? Well, unless your name is Jesseca Wales, I don't give a damn.

You walk up to her; ask her to dance. She says "Hey baby, I just might take the chance." You say it's a good thing, that you float in the air. That way there's no way I will crush your pretty toenails into a thousand pieces. That's from one of the most obscure Weezer songs there is. It's called Only In Dreams and it's Track 10 on the Blue Album. Just a little info on a cool ass song that nobody knows about... I just got home from Louie's house. I stayed there for 5 days because my parents went on vacation and didn't trust me to stay at home by myself (and they shouldn't). My sister moved out the day they left so she wouldn't be here. That left me no other option but to stay at Louie's. We didn't do very much the whole time, and we couldn't leave the house because he's on house arrest. So overall it was very boring and I don't wanna talk about it any further. Me and Jesseca's 9 month anniversary has come and gone, and we're still going strong. I'll be calling her in a few minutes actually, so that's awesome. Mad At Gravy has arrived in Chris's mailbox all the way from Justin's house in Gettysburg, PA. I wanted to pick up my copy earlier today, but Chris was "out and about." Justin tells me to go over there at 10 and get it (that's when Chris get's off of work). I might do that, but I would rather have Chris come here because I don't have Chrome at this time. Either way, i'm hoping MAG will be good, and i'm thinking it will... My new EGM magazine hasn't arrived yet. That sucks. I get my license on Friday. That's sweet. Now all I need is a car to drive. I should be making some minor, as well as major, changes to my website today (you'll see what I mean when I do it)... Whether it gets done or not depends on how long I talk to Jesseca and how bored and tired I am. All right, i'm gonna go call Miss Jesse now.

Jesseca and I went to the movies last night. I was at Louie's like 30 minutes before the movie started, so I had to get picked up, go home and take a 3 minute shower (the new world record), and speed over to her house and go to Regal (because it's closer and we were running late, but nobody goes there anymore). We were gonna see Pirates of the Carribean, but since we were running late we just snuck into Bad Boys 2. It turned out to be a good decision after all. It was a damn good movie. Tons of action, plenty of laughs, and a budget that was literally off the charts. They were destroying stuff left and right for two and a half hours, the amount of money that went into this movie must have been ungodly. Not that it was a bad thing; demolishing lots of stuff is definitely a plus. Down with the haters, Bad Boys 2 rocks. As for Jesseca, she's just as beautiful as ever, if not more. I had to restrain myself from singing Eric Clapton - You Look Wonderful Tonight on several occasions (seriously). It was also friggin cold in that movie theater and I wanted to hug her the whole time but the damn drink holders kept me from doing so... that's why Oceanwalk is much better. But anyway, that was the second time we've hung out this week, the other one being Sunday. Hopefully we start seeing eachother this much all the time, because i'm lovin every minute of it. On a slightly different note, my website has been updated. Everyone should go there now ; the link is on the sidebar. First read the Site Info section for details on what's new. This happens only about once every two months, so I would say it's a fairly momentous occasion. More is coming soon, and i'm not just saying that for the sake of saying it. I left some crap at Louie's when I left yesterday, so it looks like I'll be forced to go there and get it, and I'll probably end up staying the night... again. It's funny how I stay the night there almost every night, but I never go when anything cool is happening (i.e. the party). I don't really care all that much that i'm "missing out," it's just funny to me... All right, I think I'm done for now. You gotta love the three paragraph entries :)

I didn't go to Louie's party last night, LoL. I instead opted to go to Jesseca's house and spend the day with her. I was thinking about going over there after I got home, but by that time it was already past 11 and I was tired as a mofo, so needless to say that didn't happen. I have the song Boys of Summer in my head to the extreme. That's pretty much all i'm thinking about right now. I could listen to that song all day long, and I do, so it's probably going to be played out soon. Good thing there's three versions: The original by Don Henley, The Ataris style, and the DJ Sammy techno mix. They're all sweet, in case you're wondering. I'm getting some stuff done today, or at least it seems that way. I got Chrome (the legendary bike) back from Jesseca's house yesterday, along with my hat and the new Harry Potter book. The latter is not mine; i'm just borrowing it from her so I can read it. But anyway, I plan on fixing up Chrome sometime soon. It would be nice to have it done before like 12 so I can ride it to Best Buy before it closes. By fixing it up I mean taking off the brakes, because they barely work anyway; tightening the back tire, because it breaks loose and grinds the frame every once in a while; greasing up everything with WD-40, because that stuff is the miracle solution and it will work wonders on the bike; and taking off the flashlight, because it looks gay and I could care less about cops anymore. After I do all that i'm gonna go to Best Buy and attempt to buy the CKY box set. If they don't have it, and i'm pretty sure they won't, then I have a backup list of things to buy, including: CKY4, Donnie Darko, The Breakfast Club, and Empire Records. I could theoretically get all of those if I don't get the box set, but with price changes and tax, who knows. No matter what, i'll come home with a crapload of cool stuff, so I don't care either way. You wanna know how I can afford all this stuff without having a job? It's easy, a whole bunch of change. I pick up, steal, or save every single penny, nickel, dime, or quarter I come across. Whereas most other people don't pay attention to such things, I know better. I just rolled upwards of 50 dollars in change, so you can't say doing what I do doesn't pay dividends. And it's all cash, so ha. Concerning the internet, I have been extra bored lately, so I have added Morgan's journal to the host of links over there to the left. I also hope to finish up a bunch of stuff on my website today. But don't count on it, because i'm known to go lazy all the sudden and stop working on it. Just consider yourselves lucky if there is an update to that place. Have I stated enough that I love Jesseca? Not today. I love Jesseca! I was at her house almost all day yesterday. It was pretty fun, and i'm glad I got to see her, because it rules when that happens... Switching subjects, I get my license on August 1st, so that's awesome. I don't even know if i'm gonna pass the test, but I heard it was easy as pie so i'm not worried about it at all. I don't have a car though, and that is a little worrying. My parents keep telling me I need to get a job and then they will buy me one. So that's cool, now I just need to start looking for one. A car that is. Job schmob I say, school is starting soon, so I won't be able to work very long, and that's gay. Enough about this, because i'm just rambling anyway... Who's Got Game comes on tonight, and tomorrow is Road Rules, and then the Real World. All the coolest shows in the world. Be sure to tune in. Oh and did you see the fight between Abram and Donnel? How about the biggest Real World lie ever? Hahaha they were both funny as hell. Abe beat that fat nigger's ass (sorry, but he deserved it) and CT is the man. That's all I have to say, but I will leave you with this little anecdote - Dave from RR: "What's for lunch?" Abe: (said immediately in a flat voice) "Cornbread." Me: Haha!!!!!

Someday you will find me Come beneath the landslide In a shampagne supernova in the sky In case you haven't noticed, I dig the idea of starting out my journal with cool little parts of songs in italics... I can already tell this is going to be an odd day. I tried going to sleep at like 4am but it didn't work so good. Instead, I decided to stay up until tonight and then go to bed in hopes of returning to a normal sleeping schedule, one where I wake up fairly early in the morning and go to sleep around 1am; that would be ideal. Yesterday I finally pushed it to the point where some sort of extreme measure needed to be taken to break my bad sleeping habits. I went to sleep at 6am and slept until 6pm. Not only is that borderline nocturnal, but I slept for 12 freaking hours. That's way too much for me. I could be doing better things than sleeping... that's why I need to stay up until at least 9pm tonight. Succeed, and everything will be set straight; Fail, and I will be caught even deeper in the most obsurd sleeping schedule of all time. Pretty high stakes if you ask me... but I haven't slept in a long time, so I wouldn't ask me. It has been my observation that being tired is basically like being drunk. A lot of the same symptoms apply to both, like: not being able to think straight, blurred vision, the inability to walk without looking like a nutter, slurred speech, the tendency to laugh at everything (even if it isn't funny), etc. As you can see, I have a point here, but at this time my mind is unable to figure out just what that is. I'm sure you get it though, so that's all that counts. Due to my current [sad] state, I don't think I'll be able to do anything brain stimulating. I'll be this way all day, so I guess I'll be limited to doing mundane tasks like building toothpick houses and stuff. Hopefully I will get the chance to film the remainder of the CRYK skits today. Then I will be all crazied up and ready to go. I also wanted to go to Jesseca's house to get my bike (and maybe hang out at her house for a couple hours), but I don't think I'll be doing that today because by time she gets home from work I will be drowsy to the extreme and I would be no fun to be around. I will most likely do that tomorrow then. Alright guys, game over.

She is smiling like heaven's down on earth Sun is shining so bright on her And all her wishes have finally come true And her heart is weeping This happiness is killing her It's true, she's in love She'll be right here in my arms So in Love She'll be right here in these arms She can't let go As John would say: That song is like, badass! It's called HIM - Right Here In My Arms if you wanna hear it. I think you would like it, no matter who you are. But anyway, my day was pretty lamo today. I'm not complainin' though, because it was pretty fun, I laughed at a bunch of stuff; I just didn't actively do very much. I called Jesseca at like 2 today and she didn't answer the phone... that kind of sucked because I was looking forward to hanging out with her. So I don't know what she did today but I miss her a whole lot for some reason.... Alan, Zac, and Mike came over for a little while today. It was pretty crazy, I didn't expect that one. They are the craziest kids on the block though, so what do ya expect? Alan told me how David Lee, Glen, and Runk (the last two are cardshop dwellers) have all gone gay. Yes, you heard me right, they are fucking homosexuals. This information tottally blew my mind. It seems like everyone is gay nowadays. I hope nobody else turns homo on me or I might flip out. I can see with David Lee because he hangs out with Tebbe all the time, but Glen? and Runk?... wait, actually Runk did seem a little too nice. And Glen did have a high ass voice. Hmmm, it all makes sense now... queers. Last night Chris and I went out to NSB with Misty and Colleen at like 2 in the morning and stayed at some crazy house they were house-sitting for. I guess they had to stay there to take care of the dogs while the people were away or something, but i'm not too sure really. It was crazy as hell though. We just ate all the people's food and trashed the place pretty much. Actually we didn't trash the place, but we did eat all the food, and that was fun enough. After that we watched Blow and took a bunch of crazy pictures of us wigging out. Chris was sleeping and I put a Merle Haggard album thingy in his arms and took a picture. Haha, it will be funny when that roll gets developed. In other news, i'm obsessed with that new show Who's Got Game? on MTV. I pretty much waited all day today to see the new episode. It was cool, and as for the show as a whole -- I loooove it (Snoop Dogg style). The new Real World is another one of my new favorite shows. The only thing I dislike is how you have to watch this crap all chopped up in 30 minute segments every week throughout like 2 months. I would much rather just wait for the end of the season and watch the marathon all day. Well, that is, of course, if I wasn't such a sucker for all the drama :). Did you hear about the episode that's coming on tomorrow? Or maybe it's tonight, i'm bad with TV times... But anyway, they're hyping it up as "the biggest Real World lie ever." When you think about it, there hasn't been too many lies to draw comparisons with, yet I still must watch it to see what happens. I think i'm turning into one of those soap opera freaks who read those little books about the soaps and ... bad example, nevermind. My mom, my sister, and I were all looking through the old picture box tonight and it was awesome. I remembered almost everything in the photos like it was yesterday; it was weird. I think everyone should look at old pictures every once in a while, because it's funny seeing all this old stuff that you used to have, and especially to see how everyone looked back then. If there is one thing I learned about myself as a child it's that I should've cut my hair way more. I spent about 5 years of my life with either hair down to my chin/ shoulders or with the mushroom cut. I looked crazy. It always looks like I need to get the hair out of my face and it bothers me when I look at it. Besides that though, I was a pretty handsome kid. The best haircut I had was in my early years (3-6) when I had a mullet. If you look at some pictures of me from that time period you will be mesmerized by the perfect mullet. You won't even be able to focus on anything else in the backround because of the power of my mullet. It was that cool. And uh, yeah... that's all I have to say about that. Have you heard that Justin's computer got fried? Well, according to his cousin Eric he has lost everything he had on it. That means all of his songs, documents, pictures, videos, and of course, pornos are gone. Sucks for him, huh? I sure think so. Chris Montag has also started working at Domino's Pizza in case you didn't know. I thought that was funny. He answers the phones there so you can prank him anytime you want; I know i'm going to. One last thing: I took down your website Louie . It was costing my dad 5 dollars a month to host it. Looks like you're gonna have to bite the bullet and figure out how to do it with your own computer. It's really not that hard, and all you have to do once you figure it out is republish everything, and that doesn't take very long because I do it all the time. Put it this way -- if Justin can do it, anybody can do it. For those of you who have been waiting for me to write a lot of stuff, I hope you had fun reading all that, because I had fun writing it. I will probably do another entry fairly soon because I have more to say. I just figured that enough was enough for right now. Very well then, very well. Oh yes, and because I didn't say it enough today -- I Love Jesseca .

These last two days have been pretty damn gay. This is mostly due to the fact that I have watched nothing but crappy little 2 minute clips of people doing CKY/ Jackass type bullshit. Don't get me wrong, I love CKY, and Jackass is pretty cool too, but out of the 100 or so videos I watched, only about 6 were good. I guess not everyone can be cool like us *sigh*. However, I did watch Labyrinth today, and it was definitely a highlight. The classic "Dance Magic Dance" scene never gets old. Neither does the rest of the movie, but that part especially rocks. Which brings me to some recent happenings: the gang of crazy punkers are running wild on Kelly's journal again. Once again I had to silence them with some harsh talk about their lifestyle and such. It may seem cruel now, but it will be good for them in the long run. They need to wake up and smell the coffee -- calling yourself straight edge is G-A-Y. So is being a punky brooster, but if they would just shut up with their "X edge break face break X" crap for a little while, then I would forgive them for that little detail. Ahhh, I guess these kooks never learn... But anyway, I hear that 4th of July is coming up very soon, as in Friday. I don't know about you, but I love the 4th of July. I'm supposed to be going with Jesseca somewhere to see a fireworks show. Those are usually pretty lame, but since i'll be with her it will be like heaven. I still want to light some stuff on fire myself though, so somebody better give me a lighter and a box of fireworks. That would be great. This is my one chance to let out my inner pyro all year, so I might as well take advantage of it. I think my sister is gonna get a box full of cool stuff; hopefully i'll be able to get a hold of some of those. Alright, i've resorted to rambling on and on about nothing now so I will take that as a sign that I need to stop writing. Until next time... P.S. "If she kisses you i'll make you a prince. (Really?) Prince of the land of stench! Hahaha!" -- That was said by Jareth a.k.a. David Bowie in Labyrinth . It was funny as hell when he said it. You know what i'm sayin if you're a big fan of Labyrinth . Peace.

Oh my god. I am sweating my ass off. I don't know what it is. Maybe it's because I have some sort of radical new disease that makes you sweat all of the fluids out of your body within 24 hours. Perhaps I am nervous about something to the point where I am going into a sweaty fit about it. Here's an idea -- it's fucking hot as hell (literally) in this nigger. Pardon my french, but come on, somebody needs to reinstall the air conditioning system is this room. And that ain't no joke, ya bloke. That post I made earlier tonight was just some wiggage that I thought up spur of the moment. It said nothing about what is currently going on in my life. Not that i'm obligated to talk about my life on here, but since i'm bored, I figured I would just write some more. To clear it up, I was only half serious about my pro- Blogger speech, so don't send me hate mail about how LiveJournal is better; I don't really care that much. Now onto some things that are a little more important. Last night me, Chris, Alan, Louie, and Steve were out filming skits when we got pulled over by the cops for "pounding on people's doors." I later learned that they had also recieved various calls that there were some kids running around the area naked. Now who could that be? I won't explain that whole situation; you can speculate for yourself what happened there, and find out later when you watch CRYK for the first time. Anyway, those dirty pigs ended up stealing our tape straight out of our camera. They said that we could get it back after the "investigators" watched it. I am skeptical about that one. I bet they just wanna see our video. Those bastards used their power to get an early sneak peek at CRYK . Good thing we backtalked them to the extreme and, in some cases, made them look like fools. Like when Louie said that his grandpa's funeral was on the tape and that they would probably take pleasure in watching it (implying that they were sick kooks). And when they told us we were out past our curfew and we said that it was only because they kept us there for an hour. It was also funny when the black cop was watching the tape and we blatantly say the word "nigger" on it. Luckily they only watched a small portion of the tape in our presence, because that is only the first in a long line of offensive things on it. It still kind of sucks that those fags took our tape. I'm just glad we're getting it back. And to the investigators of the OBPD , I hope you enjoy it.

I have been reading this guy's humorous column for approximately four hours now, and after all that readin', I feel like writing. So here I am, doing just that. Lately, Louie has been talking about how awesome LiveJournal is. He preached to me about how easy it is to use, and he even showed me this little downloadable program that you can use to update your journal straight from your desktop within seconds. I'm glad that he's so excited about LiveJournal, but it's not exactly the best invention since the microwave. I happen to like Blogger. It's easy to use and it gets the job done; what more could you want from a friggin online journal? I don't care to express the current mood i'm in, or tell everyone what song i'm currently listening to. (What if i'm not listening to music, did anyone ever think of that?) And best of all, with Blogger, you don't have to waste your time reading 75 incoherent, badly written comments from some assholes who won't even leave their names. What good could possibly come from some random butt faced punker (or anyone else for that matter) giving me their two cents about what I write? I sure can't think of any. And even if you can think of something, you can't tell me about it on my journal. So call me a hypocrite, tell me i'm wrong, tell me I made ten thousand grammar and spelling errors in this post, but do it somewhere else, because I don't care what anyone else has to say about my writing. And that, my friends, is the beauty of Blogger . Did I mention that the user interface has just recently been rebuilt from the ground up and is now undeniably sexy? Or that everything loads much faster than ever before? Or that there are new features galore and the sky is now the limit since Blogger has been bought out by Google ? Oh yes, it is all true. I urge everyone to quit using that pesky LiveJournal or any other means of having an online journal type thing, and start using Blogger today. There is nothing to lose, because it's totally free! All the cool people use it, like me and Jesseca! Yay! That was quite a rant for a topic about something that I normally wouldn't even pretend to support. I guess that's what eight days of not writing anything more than my little scribbles on post-it notes will do to me. Oh yeah, and Blogger , i'm expecting my endorsement check in the mail anyday now. (Seriously.) I'm gonna go try to watch Harvard Man now. The last time two times i've tried to watch it I fell asleep a little more than halfway through. That's probably a bad sign, but on the brighter side, I now know why I only paid $5.88 for it.

Oh yeah, and did I mention that I have sexual frustration and schoolwork out the gizang? Well I do. Despite all of this, I seem to be more happy than I have been these past couple weeks or so. And there's still hope because I don't know for sure if she is grounded because I haven't talked to her. Don't worry though, the depression will set in soon enough.

So Jesseca and I were supposed to go to the Mainland game tonight, but at the last minute her mom freaked out and said she couldn't go because she lied to her about having homework. And because she didn't tell her that I was going... so she thought she was trying to "sneak that in" or something. I dunno it's all a big pile of horse shit if you ask me. It pissed me off really bad. Which explains the previous entry; I was talkin about Jesseca's mom. I supressed my anger enough to call her and see if she might still be able to go. Her mom picked up the phone and says some gay shit. She was like "Dave, Jesseca isn't gonna be aloud on the phone for a long time, because she lied to me" I'm thinkin so fuckin what lady, get over it, people lie all the time, she was just tryin to have fun you fuck. But all that came out was "um alright" with a slight attitude in my voice, but not nearly enough given the situation. I should have wigged out on her far more than I did. Damn... well anyway, I ended up going to the game with Chris and Mike. Mike drove us there. He got his license today. I would care much more if my anger didnt loom so heavily, but it's still pretty cool. Mainland also won the game, but they played some chumps so it doesn't matter. We'll see next week when they face the phenominal badasses of downtown (Seabreeze). After the game I got a frosty at Wendy's and I couldn't even enjoy it because of the cut inside my lip. It hurts like a biotch. It's infected for sure. I'm talkin about this stuff, but it doesn't really hold much meaning for me because i'm too busy thinking about Jesseca. I feel sorry for her a lot since her mom is wiggin out on her, but at the same time, I would not take that shit. What's her mom gonna do if she disobeys her anyway? She can't really do anything. I would just say to hell with her and do what I want. But Jesseca refuses to do this, so eh, we're both screwed. It ruins my life hardcore when she gets grounded like this. Plus I already haven't seen her for 2 weeks, and it looks like it will be like a month more if nothing fortunate happens. I can't really do anything about it because I love her so much, so I have to just wait around for a long ass time and hang out with the gang. I don't even drink or do drugs, so I can't drown out my problems that way... I dunno, I have to deal with this shit the old fashioned way I guess. Just deal with it. Listening to hardcore music sure does help though. I'm rambling and revealing the inner workings of my brain to anyone who wishes to see it, so I'll be stopping now... later.

It turns out that Jesseca went and did some crazy shit all day, so I was left to sit around and do nothing. She called me at like 6, and since then i've been playing Super Ghouls N Ghosts and Ghosts N Goblins; the sequel and prequel, respectively. In case you didn't know, they are two of the hardest games ever made. As far as that goes, I have some good news and some bad news. First, the good news. I finally managed to beat SGNG. It's a good thing I did too, because if I didn't succeed this time I would have smashed the cartridge with a sledgehammer. It wasn't really worth all the trouble I went through, but it was good to have some closure on that damn game. Secondly, I was NOT able to beat Ghosts N Goblins. Well I made it all the way through, but once you do that you have to do it all over again with some crazy weapon. I dunno, after a while I got pissed off and just quit. It wasn't really worth it anyway. It's not easy for me to recount the level of frustration I had while playing the game, but I found this review that says exactly what I wanna say -- "Back in the old days, NES games were hard. Not just hard--old school NES games were like a big mean kid on the playground that made you eat dirt and say you like it. Except Ghosts 'N Goblins doesn't just make you eat dirt, it makes you eat broken glass. Then it rubs your face on the concrete, kicks you in the back of the head, pees on you, and laughs at your pain. " "How did they test market this game? Maybe they gave it to a roomful of kids and kept upping the difficulty until it made them all cry. I would say this is easily the hardest Nintendo game ever made, and that's saying a lot. Challenge is usually a good thing, but taken to this extreme it's definitely not. " Props go to that dude for explaining it so perfectly. The entire review can be found urlLink here . I encourage everyone who's at all interested to read it because it's surprisingly well written and it tells more about that piece of shit game... well that's about all for right now. I'm kind of in bad mood because of the Jesseca situation so I don't feel like writing very much. I will wig out tomorrow. Whether or not that means I will write in this is for you to decide.

I called her an hour ago but no answer. I'm gonna go try again. You are the weakest link, goodbye!

Everything has been going pretty shitty lately. Well not everything... School has been fine. As far as academics go anyway. I think I have almost 100% A's in all my classes. Except probably Agriculture, because I didn't go there today. Oh well. That class is gay anyway. There is one of those "Good Charlotte punk" whores in there (you know, the type who just decide to be "punk" all the sudden since they're really ugly losers, and Good Charlotte is on MTV all the time), and that kook pisses me off to an extreme. I usually don't pay much attention to those kind of kids, but it's hard to ignore her when she says such stupid ass shit. She's always having these debates with her fellow assholes about which bands are punk and which bands are pop. And get this, she labeled The Ataris under the pop genre. I wanted to strangle her right then and there, but that isn't the end of it. She then went on to say fuckin Rooney and and Good Charlotte are "real punk" and The Ataris can't sing. She said The Ataris can't sing like a million times too. It was like she was trying to rub it in or something. First of all, who the fuck is Rooney? Second, does she not realize that Good Charlotte sounds wayyy more popish than The Ataris do? Oh, and another thing. She called a bunch of bands sell outs and said The Ataris' only good song was Boys of Summer, and it's not even their song; "it's really by the Beatles." At this point I was freaking infuriated . (For those of you who don't know, The Ataris have been in the underground music scene forever before "making it big," and have plenty of awesome songs that that bitch has apparently never heard. Also, the song Boys of Summer is NOT by the Beatles. It's by Don Henley. And finally, Good Charlotte is widely considered to be among the biggest punk music "sell-outs" ever. Not to mention their music is basically pop.) Not that I care about such things... It's just that if someone talks trash about The Ataris, they need to get their facts straight, because that's pretty much slander to me. If I knew this girl's name I would put it on my website along with a banner that would say "20 DOLLARS TO WHOEVER SLAPS THIS CHICK IN THE FACE." I don't usually promote the beating of women, but she deserves it. Before I went off on that tangent about that dumby in my Agriculture class, I was about to explain the reasons why I'm currently mad at the world. Chiefly, there are 2 things that are causing this -- 1)I failed my driving test. 2)I failed my driving test again the next day. If you haven't experienced that crap (failing the test), then you don't know what it's like. It sucks very badly. It's probably the most annoying trash i've ever been through. This is mainly because the test is very easy, and stupid little stuff caused me to fail both times. The first time I pulled into the wrong side of the lane because I thought the course was just like a 1 way thing. The second time I did fine, except for at the beginning when some crazy negro pulled out at the same time as me and honked her horn like a million times. That was gay. She made me seem like an idiot when we were both in the wrong. The only thing is, I was taking my test and she wasn't. Gimme a break lady. Gah. Oh well though. I'll probably be trying that shit again tomorrow. And the next day. And the day after that. If I don't pass it that is. I don't even care really. They'll eventually get tired of seeing me and just hand it over and tell me to leave. If not then i'm prank calling that place every 5 minutes for the next 6 years. P.S. I'm not really as mad as I might seem about this. In fact, this whole scenario is very funny to me. That's probably the reason I fail the test, because I don't take it very seriously. I guess i'm gonna have to get serious on these fools. I will seriously look behind the car for 700 hours if that's what they want. And after that, 600 more years of me looking side to side to see if any imaginary cars are coming at every stop sign in that little course. We'll see who fails what, ya punks.

Man i'm frickin tired as Paul Bunyan after a hard day's work right now. That's all that i've been hearin from everyone lately though... "i'm tired, i'm tired, i'm tired." I don't really know what's goin on. That seems to be the new trend. Pretty soon it will be cool to tell people you're tired. So next time you see your friends at a party, make sure to go up to them and say "Hey man, i'm tired as fuck, how about you?" (whatever they say) "hell yeah dude let's take a nap up in this biatch! Woot Woot!" and go to sleep soon thereafter. I'm tellin ya, sleeping is the future, so you better embrace it. I've been spazzing out lately (falling asleep at random times of the day, and doing other maniacal acts such as completing my homework and dancing to the rhythm of that Conga beat), so I haven't been able to write in this very much... well not at all actually. That kind of sucks for you, because there's been so much going on. I had all of this crap to write about for so long and everyday a few more things got added on and eventually I just forgot everything. So that's that. There is a few things that happened today and yesterday that I would like to touch on shortly. First, Zac and I laughed at John Kinder histerically last night because all he talks about is gettin fat sacks of weed, trading them for a bunch of shrooms, drinkin down on alchoholic beverages, doing other drugs, smoking more weed, poppin pills, eatin shroom caps, fat weed bags, trippin on shrooms, smokin down on bags of weed, weed, weed, drugs, more drugs, etc. Seriously, there is no exaggeration there. That's all he fuckin says and it's hilarious. We blatantly laugh at him to his face and he's just like "come on Zac, let's go pick those shrooms and trade em for that fat ounce of cryp, and take a shot you pussy." And then we laugh some more and he's like "you don't want weed?" (rolling on the floor, crying from histeria) "what's wrong with you guys? you don't like weed? take some shots, smoke some weed, let's get those caps" at this point we are wiggin out to the extreme with laughter and he gets confused and leaves, mumbling shit about weed as he walks away. Oh man... it might not sound funny, but if you were there and you heard him saying this stuff, it would be funnier than anything you've seen in your life... The second thing I wanted to talk about is this dude I knew from Arizona got murdered. They found his body burned up in his car in the desert. They don't really know what happened yet, but it's some pretty crazy stuff either way... Third, I went and saw Uptown Girls with Jesseca at the Oceanwalk Movie Theater tonight. I didn't really care for the movie. I would prefer to have seen Freddy vs Jason instead. But she liked it and she said she woulda got scared seeing Freddy vs Jason, so as long as she enjoyed it that's all that matters. I'll tell ya what though, it's gay going to movies with her and then coming home by myself directly after. It makes me feel lonely. So now i'm gonna go listen to that song that goes "oooonnnne is the loooonnnnliest number that you'll eva seeeeeeeeee." I'm dead serious about this, so i'll catch you later.

The topic has really been beaten to death lately, but school started today, and I was there to witness it. I don't really care about the academics involved. It's pretty much the same as the last 2 years... Mostly I was amazed by how crazy looking all these kids were. There are the old favorites such as The Uptight Raptor, Baby Face, and the Pat Wannabe, among others. And then there are the new (and ever so hilarious) recruits like The Small Headed Rasta Nigger, a large gang of retards, and many other mayhem causing midgets. The one that stands out the most, however, is actually from the old school (OBMS), and has returned from his hiatus crazier than ever. The man I am talking about is none other than the infamous "Tha Kook." He is the king of all that is funny looking. The queen of corruption. The duke of dingus eggs... alright maybe I'm taking this too far, but to me and Chris he is the craziest motherfucker to walk the halls of Seabreeze since Sebastian Janikowsi. He cracks me up. We used to hold signs up to him in middle school that said "Tha Kook" in big letters with an arrow pointing towards him. It was funny because he used to get all mad at us for it and he got serious a couple times, including an incident where he shot me in the eye with a rubber band and I slapped him. Oh yeah, and in case anybody is keeping tabs on this queer, he now has long hair and a beard, and hangs out with the "rocker" crowd. The meaning of his life is to provide me with another reason to laugh every day at school, and one of these days he's probably going to notice and there is gonna be a rumble between our group of gangtas versus his band of cock rocking homos. I can't wait until that day. Look forward to my overly exaggerated story of that in the future... On a closing note, Nick Tremper is back, and he looks more like a gay fucker than he ever has. He looks so gay, in fact, that he has earned the nickname "Gay Tremp" by me and my comrads. That's all for this edition of "The Humorous Looking Assholes At Seabreeze" report. This is Davey Dank signing off. I would really have liked to talk to Jesseca today and ask her how her day at school went, but i'm guessing that's not gonna happen. She said she had to go to Kidsko and get some crap today... Oh well though, I'm freakin tired as hell anyway. I need all the sleep I can get so I'm leavin now I guess. P.S. Davey Dank?????? Who broke into my Blog and wrote that gay ass name?

All right, now that I've gotten that out of the way, I must announce that I am back with a vengeance after many days of not writing in this beast. Here's a little summary of what's been going on in my life since the last time I wrote: Later in that day I got really sick, went insane (literally), and tried all kinds of odd things to calm myself down. Some of my actions included: running around, lifting weights, doing sit-ups, and... going Julian's with Mike and Chris to smoke some weed (because even though I don't smoke, I thought doing so would alleviate my insanity). When we got there everyone was looking at me weird and I felt extremely crazy so I freaked out and had my dad pick me up, which was funny because it was like 2 in the morning. I didn't smoke either, if I must point that out. When I got home I was kookin out and breathing hard and shaking and shit so I had to sleep in my mom's bed that night. That's how crazy I felt hehe. I later found out that I had the flu and I wigged out so much because it's a respiratory disease and it makes you get hot and breathe hard, so if you do physical activity it makes you wig out even more. That explains why the degree to which I wigged was so hardcore... if you even know what i'm talking about anymore. Moving on, I felt pretty sick for a few days after that one (Monday), but nothing else really crazy happened. But I did have dry heaves and pee a lot, if that counts... Soon after I got done being sick (well actually before), I went to the mall with Chris, Steve, and Louie and bought some cool gear, and had a ball while doing it. We went there two days in a row, Wednesday and Thursday. It was fun both days because we were wiggin out, yelling shit at people, knocking stuff over, and generally being the obnoxious teenagers that we are. The only thing that bothered me about the mall was that we bought some clothes in Hot Topic. That means we had to stay in there for an extended period of time and talk to the kooks that work there and stuff -- Something that is not too high on my list of priorities. Maybe I'm a jerk for saying this, but shopping at Hot Topic makes me feel like some sort of wacked out gothic corkboarding a-hole. I don't know what i'm talking about exactly but it isn't cool. Especially since I had to carry around a little Hot Topic bag the whole time I was at the mall. It's embarassing you know. I did get some cool ass shirts out of the deal though. The likes of which include The Konami Code, The Strokes, and Finch themed tees. I am wearing the Finch one right now and I like it a lot. (Even though I only know a couple songs from the band. That's what happens when they are all out of the cool ones like Ataris, Taking Back Sunday and Starting Line. Maybe some day.) After the mall on Thursday, we dropped Steve off at his house and went back to Chris's to wig out. On a side note, I hung out at my sister's apartment on Wednesday. It was the first time I'd seen the place and I must admit that it's pretty cool. Her and Dan live there and I love it... Back to Thursday, late night at Chris's. The bulldog came over and Louie punched her. Then Louie and I went to pick up Alexia Meadows and bring her to Chris's. When we got back the bulldog had left and Chris was taking shots of liquor and listening to "I Drink Alone." Later on Louie took Alexia home and never came back, he just went home instead. So Chris and I ended up taking 7 and 6 shots, respectively, and getting fucked up beyond belief. We tried watching Ninja Turtles 2 but ended up just going outside and chasing ducks around and bullshit like that. It was all good and fun until I realized what was going on. Then I started feeling really gross and sick to my stomach. At some time during this period I had serious thoughts of peeing on Chris's carpet because I didn't want to get up. I fell asleep somehow, despite not being tired. I woke up on Friday, which is actually just really early today, with a hangover from hell. I felt like I had to puke really bad but when I tried it didn't work. So I ended up just laying on the futon watching the minutes slowly go by, thinking about how much drinking fucking sucks and wishing I wasn't feeling like crap. I went on like this for many hours until Chris woke up and played some Dashboard Confessional, and that made me feel loads better for some reason and put me to sleep. When I woke up at 4, I had to go home because Chris had to go to work. When I got home I had some milk and that made me feel bad again and I realized the hangover wasn't done with me yet. I toughed it out for a while until Louie called me and told me there was some crazy party in NSB tonight. I was hesitant to go since I felt so bad, but I figured what the heck. I took a shower and chilled for a while. I had to wait until like 6:30 to leave because I refused to go unless I knew I couldn't do anything with Jesseca, and that's when she gets off work. Speaking of Jesseca, I hadn't talked to her since we went to the mall on Sunday and I was beginning to get worried. I still am kind of because I don't know what's going on with her. When I called her today she said she had to go to a sleepover at Kidsko. That sucks that on her last Friday before school starts she's spending her time at work instead of with me where she should be. Then when I got home tonight my dad told me she called me, and that made me sad that I missed the call :( So that's how it's goin with the wifey. Not very good I suppose. But hopefully I'll be able to see her tomorrow, or Sunday maybe. Here's hoping... But anyway, since Jesseca was busy, I was forced to go with Louie to New Symrna tonight. And don't worry, it was crazy as hell. The party died in the planning stages so we just ended up going to Morgan's and watching the movie They . It was a very stupid movie though and it bored everyone to death. My tale isn't over yet, however. Before we watched They, we had to wait for Chase to get done watching The Jungle Book 2, so we were chillin in Morgan's room right. Then out of nowhere Louie tried to let a turd poke out of his butt in front of me while I was playing a game and accidentally shit all over her room. It was the craziest thing ever done, bar none. She was freaking out because there was crap all over the ground and she told her mom on him and he couldn't stop laughing long enough to explain himself (plus, how do you explain something like that?). Well somehow he managed to blame it on me and I just laughed even more at that because it obviously wasn't. Haha oh man. If only you knew the half of how crazy that incident was. Whew, I apologize for that paragraph being the longest, most rambling thing ever written, but I was in a hurry to get all of this crap out of my head, because it's been in there for almost a week now. A few more things are on my mind that I must share real fast. 1) Amber, when you read this, don't go off and tell mom that I drink and smoke and stuff now because I don't; That was just a one time thing and you better believe I won't be doing that again for a long time to come. 2) I love Jesseca more than anything in the world and I hope she knows that. 3) It's 4 AM and counting 4) I'm going to bed now 5) That story about Louie shitting on Morgan's floor, it is completely false. 6) As fictional as it may be, it is still funny as all get out.

Motherfucker. Jesseca's mom is the fucking anti-Christ. She ruins my whole day (and week, pretty much), because she's in her pajamas. This is a situation where most people would simply put some fucking clothes on . And if I can't go over there, then why the fuck can't Jesseca stay at my house for a little while? Oh yeah, because her mother is an obssessive psycho freak, my bad. Well, if you ask me, that is a complete and total crock of shit. That pretty much sums it up. Now I just need to go buy a punching bag, so I can beat the shit [takke mushrooms] out of it.

I spent my night reading, reading some more, and watching the New Tom Green Show. And let me tell ya, that Tom Green cracks me up. It seemed like he was extra funny today because it was monster spectacular Friday (or whatever you call it), but then when I think about it, he was just as laugh-enducing last night. You slay me Tom, you slay me. It might not sound like my night was very eventful, and it wasn't, but a few interesting things did happen. For instance, at 11 P.M. Eastern I tuned into 105.9 O Rock FM and tried to listen to Loveline; but guess what, it didn't come on! This could mean one of three things: It has been canceled, taken off O Rock, or it simply didn't come on tonight. Hopefully it was the latter, because I love that show. To find out for sure i'll keep trying to listen all next week... Going off on a whole nother tangent, i'm looking forward to Dashboard Confessional's new album in the worst way. I have heard two new songs off of it (well one is actually a remix of sorts), and they are both stuck in my head and won't get out. A Mark, A Mission, A Brand, A Scar is the title, it comes out on August 12th, and you can expect it to be the shiznit. Ya dig? Oh fa sho. Haha, now that I'm already wiggin, I suppose I'll touch on another subject entirely -- Spy Kids 3-D: Game Over. For starters, the title of the movie is funny as hell. Game Over? What were they thinking? At least it's funny, though. My sister saw this movie tonight and she informed me that not only is it awesome, but the whole thing is in 3-D as well. Like they give you the glasses when you buy your ticket. For some reason that is stunning to me. I mean, I didn't know that... Wouldn't it cost like a cajillion dollars to distribute all those frickin glasses? I'm thinkin it would, but what do I know? Now that I think about it, those things are just paper, and they probably wouldn't cost much to produce... Hmmm, in any case, i'm putting way too much brainpower into a movie with the subtitle "Game Over." Back to the real world now [not the TV show, my life], I didn't get my license today. Funny? Yes. But it will give me time to shop for a car. Ahh, who am I kiddin, I still won't have a car on Tuesday (that's the next day the DMV will be open, and coincidentally the same day that I will be obtaining my driver's license). In other news, I recieved an unexpected phone call from Jesseca earlier this evening, and it blew my [frigging] mind. I totally was not expecting her to call. We didn't talk for very long, but it was still cool nonetheless. It's always cool when she does stuff like that, because I love the surprises... All in all, it was not the best Friday night in history, but not the worst one either.

Wake up, wake up, get up, it's the first of the month... There was a Bone Thugs N' Harmony song that went something like that a few years back... So, i've had this journal for 12 months now, not exactly a year yet, but the archives show 12 months of stuff that you can read. I went back and read some of the old stuff yesterday and it's all funny to me because I remember everything like it just happened. That's what happens I guess. I got my new EGM today. There were 3 covers that I could've gotten and I got the one I wanted. That's sweet. I always seem to get lucky with this type of thing. My uncle Geno will be over to pay me back for the 20 dollars I let him borrow on Wednesday. What a good guy. Everyone has always told me that he always pays people back, no matter what, but now he's proven that to me. While i'm on the subject of payback, someone has stolen my Bad Karma. I came home from Louie's house on Wednesday and it was gone. I'm guessing it was my sister watching it or maybe bringing it to her friends so they can watch it. If that's the case then i'm fine with that, but they need to tell me they're taking it next time. If it's somebody else, when I find out who it is i'm gonna slap them silly for all the trauma they've caused me. Oh yeah, and then there's always the fact that I get my license today . That is pretty crazy to me because 1) I don't feel like i'm 16 and 2) I don't feel like I should be able to legally drive around by myself. But I am, and I can, starting today. You may say, "You can't get your license if you don't pass the test," but i'm not sweating the test very much. Everyone has told me it's easy, and Louie told me exactly what you do and gave me some pointers and stuff, so it shouldn't be a problem. If I do fail it, however, it will be funny as 4 cheeseburgers being huffed into the trunk of an elephant at the same time.
"The first four Black Sabbath albums have wiped me out on many occasions." - Henry Rollins.

Alright my fellow dinoflagellates. I have prepared a speech for this moment, and here it is... I have been writing in this journal for almost a year now. In fact, the day I started was September 24th, 2002. That's exactly 2 weeks from today, so hopefully that gives you an idea of how long this thing has been going on for. I must say there have been plenty of jokes, song lyrics, tired ramblings, angry rants, heartfelt confessions, and other shit of the sort that I can't think of right now because I only have 60 seconds to write this entire entry or else Arnold Schwarzenegger aka "The Terminator" is going to take me down to the paradise city where the grass is green and the girls are pretty, if you know what I mean (basically he's gonna kill my ass). Anyways, that was probably the longest sentence that's ever graced the "pages" of this thing that I call Jareth's Little Ball That He Throws Crazily (for no good reason, I might add). Enough lollygagging though. What I'm trying to say is, I'm done with this and journal and it's time to move on... to LiveJournal :) Before I go, I just want to say that it has been fun the whole time. Well, maybe not the whole time, but overall, it was pretty enjoyable. Even though I am leaving, if you happen to be a big fan of this thing for some reason, don't be distraught, because I'm not abandoning it completely. You can still expect some updates about once a month or so. Maybe more, depending on what's going on. For example, you can bet that I won't forget to say something on the one year anniversary of this beast (which also happens to be the 11 month anniversary of me and Jesseca's wonderful relationship). That means if I have anything to do with it, this place will stay put pretty much forever, or at least until Blogger goes bankrupt, just so people can get on and read all the old stuff I wrote. And there's quite a lot of it, so enjoy. One last thing. You can always expect the links on the sidebar to be updated as soon as someone cool gets a journal, as usual. So you can always come here for the updated list o links in case you forget the name of somebody's journal or something. Well, that's about all I have to say. So farewell my friends, and start reading my new journal, because that's where all the action's gonna be at from now on. If you're a lazy asshole and didn't feel like reading all that, you can just skip the formalities and goodbyes and click right here --> ( urlLink Dave's New Journal )to be taken to my new and improved temple of doom. P.S. On the very day that I leave, Blogger updates their service with like 6 or 7 new features that everyone can use, including free users like myself. You'd think that I would be feeling sorry that I left so soon, but quite the contrary. While I still respect Blogger, I can't help but notice that out of all the new features, there isn't very much that interests me. The bottom line -- No comments? No pictures? Pshh, I'm leavin .

Check out this crazy story. It will blow your mind. Suicide? Or Murder? Or Suicide? At the 1994 annual awards dinner given for Forensic Science, AAFS president Dr. Don Harper Mills astounded his audience with the legal complications of a bizarre death. Here is the story: On March 23, 1994, the medical examiner viewed the body of Ronald Opus and concluded that he died from a shotgun wound to the head. The decedent had jumped from the top of a ten-story building intending to commit suicide. He left a note to that effect indicating his despondency. As he fell past the ninth floor, his life was interrupted by a shotgun blast passing through a window, which killed him instantly. Neither the shooter nor the decedent was aware that a safety net had been installed just below at the eighth floor level to protect some building workers and that Ronald Opus would not have been able to complete his suicide the way he had planned. Ordinarily, Dr. Mills continued, "a person who sets out to commit suicide and ultimately succeeds, even though the mechanism might not be what he intended" is still defined as committing suicide. Mr. Opus was shot on the way to certain death nine stories below at street level, but his suicide attempt probably would not have been successful because of the safety net. This caused the medical examiner to feel that he had a homicide on his hands. The room on the ninth floor from whence the shotgun blast emanated was occupied by an elderly man and his wife. They were arguing vigorously, and he was threatening her with a shotgun. The man was so upset that when he pulled the trigger he completely missed his wife and the pellets went through the window striking Mr. Opus. When one intends to kill subject A, but kills subject B in the attempt, one is guilty of the murder of subject B. When confronted with the murder charge, the old man and his wife were both adamant. They both said they thought the shotgun was unloaded. The old man said it was his long standing habit to threaten his wife with the unloaded shotgun. He had no intention to murder her. Therefore the killing of Mr. Opus appeared to be an accident, that is, the gun had been accidentally loaded. The continuing investigation turned up a witness who saw the old couple's son loading the shotgun about six weeks prior to the fatal accident. It transpired that the old lady had cut off her son's financial support and the son, knowing the propensity of his father to use the shotgun threateningly, loaded the gun with the expectation that his father would shoot his mother. The case now becomes one of murder on the part of the son for the death of Ronald Opus. Now comes the exquisite twist. Further investigation revealed that the son was in fact Ronald Opus. He had become increasingly despondent over both the loss of his financial support and the failure of his attempt to engineer his mother's murder. This led him to jump off the ten-story building on March 23rd, only to be killed by a shotgun blast passing through the ninth-story window. The son had actually murdered himself, so the medical examiner closed the case as a suicide. Pretty weird, huh? Maybe not to you, but I liked it.

cuddle and a kiss on the forehead - you like to be close to your special someone and feel warm, comfortable, and needed urlLink What Sign of Affection Are You? brought to you by urlLink Quizilla Alright, I know I've never done this kind of thing before (putting one of these quizzes on my journal). This just further proves that we are the biggest twins ever made... Well either that, or the damn quiz is rigged and everybody gets the same thing... But I'm gonna go with the Jesseca and I were built for eachother option, because you and I both know we definitely were. So it's a sealed deal, Camille.

But onto the subject of a far more important matter, Jesseca. We went to the game tonight and on the way there it was all good... but then like halfway through and on the way home she was just being silent and not really responding to me in the least. She's never done that before ever and it scared the bejeesus out of me. I think she like hates me now or something. I almost had a nervous breakdown on the way home because of it, but then she kind of started talking a little so I don't know what's going on now. She said nothing was wrong, but all I can think about is if there was something wrong she just wouldn't tell me ... There are some pretty disturbing thoughts going through my head, but I don't think I should get all bent out of shape about it if I don't know for sure what she was thinking. But if she does break up with me or something, then i'll really be fucked. Badly bruised and broken... like a head on collision. So here's hoping it was nothin.

Well, it's 3:12 am on a school night and I'm still awake. This is certainly not cool, not by any means. But on the plus side, I did get my Agriculture Project done. I also managed to download Haggard, finally. So I will be watching that as soon as I can. Which will probably be Saturday, since I'll be sleeping all day and night Thursday (tommorrow) and going to the football game and otherwise wigging all day on Friday. As far as tiredness goes, I am usually more awake when I sleep for 2-3 hours and then go to school, than when I sleep for 5-6 hours and go to school. I don't know for sure why that is, but I suspect it's because when you sleep for such a short period of time, it's like you haven't even slept at all, and you're not as tired. I dunno, even if I am tired as fuck tommorrow, I'll live through it, so it's ok. Plus I plan on eating a large breakfast including waffles, syrup, and milk galore. So that should help. But for now, I'm off to pass out on my bed and awaken 2 minutes later. Or at least it will seem that way...

I already have a LJ, but I don't write anything serious in it, so I'll simply have to start getting serious when she makes the switch. All I know is if we don't get the tickets there's gonna be hell to pay. Actually nothing will probably happen except I'll be like "that's really gay." But still, that's reason enough to hand over the freakin tickets, ya ticket holdin bastards! I am going to sleep now I guess... goodnight.
